Radiant Panoply.name: Radiant Panoply
Radiant Panoply.description: 20 feet. The peacock phoenix is surrounded by an aura of iridescence. An adjacent creature that starts its turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[will|dc:35] save. On a failure, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} until the start of its next turn.

Mythic Skill.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The creature attempts its next skill check with a +4 bonus and is considered to have mythic proficiency for that check. This applies to one skill when this ability is gained and a second skill if the creature is 12th level or higher.
Mythic Skill.name: 神话技能 Mythic Skill

Radiant Beam.name: Radiant Beam
Radiant Beam.description: The phoenix emits a @Template[type:line|distance:100] of radiance from their eyes. Creatures in the area take @Damage[10d12[force]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:38|basic] save). The phoenix peacock can't use Radiant Beam again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Radiant Beam]]{1d4 rounds}.

Remove a Condition.name: 移除状态 Remove a Condition
Remove a Condition.description:
花费 1神话点

效果 该生物结束一项正在影响它的状态。

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Mythic Resilience (Reflex).name: Mythic Resilience (Reflex)
Mythic Resilience (Reflex).description: 该怪物将与其相关的豁免成功率比骰掷结果的成功度高一个等级。这不会与其他改变成功度的效果叠加，例如失能特征（自然1或20时除外）。怪物每次获得神话韧性时，可选择一项豁免。该能力应首先应用于该怪物的最高豁免。

Rebirth.name: Rebirth
Rebirth.description: When the peacock phoenix dies while incorporeal, they return to life at the start of their next turn with full Hit Points. They are no longer incorporeal, lose the spirit trait, gain the beast trait, and lose their immunities and resistances (except for mythic resistance) and radiant panoply. Their Strength modifier becomes +7. They lose their radiant wing Strike and gain a beak and talon Strike.

Mythic Power.name: 神话之力 Mythic Power
Mythic Power.description: 该生物拥有 3 点神话点，并可以将这些神话点用于以下任何动作。

Peacock Phoenix.name: Peacock Phoenix
Peacock Phoenix.publicNotes:
Unlike its namesake, the peacock phoenix is a being of pure magic, a unique manifestation of Xanderghul's alter ego as the Peacock Spirit.

Other Mythic Phoenixes

Because it's tied so intrinsically to Runelord Xanderghul and his alter ego, the Peacock Spirit, once the peacock phoenix is destroyed, it's doubtful Golarion will ever see its like again. Whether different kinds of mythic phoenixes, born from similar confluences of magical and psychic energy, could ever exist remains uncertain.
Peacock Phoenix.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Remove a Condition.name: 移除状态 Remove a Condition
Remove a Condition.description:
花费 1神话点

效果 灰烬客结束一项正在影响它的状态。

Mythic Resilience (Will).name: Mythic Resilience (Will)
Mythic Resilience (Will).description: 该怪物将与其相关的豁免成功率比骰掷结果的成功度高一个等级。这不会与其他改变成功度的效果叠加，例如失能特征（自然1或20时除外）。怪物每次获得神话韧性时，可选择一项豁免。该能力应首先应用于该怪物的最高豁免。

No Breath.name: No Breath
No Breath.description: An ancient one doesn't breathe and is immune to effects that require breathing (such as inhaled poisons).

equipment-Timeflaying Blade.name: Timeflaying Blade
equipment-Timeflaying Blade.description:
Timeflaying blades are forged around shards of collapsed paradoxes. Their existence is largely an enigma. In the furthest corners of esoteric scholarship, they're mentioned in passing or simply alluded to without ever being named outright. They're associated with Stethelos, the legendary city said to lie at the heart of the Dimension of Time, though it's unclear if they were made there, were discovered there, or are bound to return there at the end of time itself.

A timeflaying blade is a +3 greater striking greater corrosive keen quickstrike orichalcum bastard sword. Acid damage caused by a timeflaying blade appears not to be caused by liquid, but by the act of material simply eroding away into dust as if thousands of years passed in an instant (this doesn't impact a creature or object's acid immunity, resistance, or weakness, though).

Activate—Flay Time 1 (concentrate, incapacitation, manipulate)

Frequency once per minute

Effect Spend 1 Mythic Point. You swing the timeflaying blade through the air as if slicing something while you attempt to sever a creature within 120 feet from time itself. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:43] save.

Critical Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Success The creature is hurled [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} into the future. They disappear in a flash of white light, only to reappear in the same space on their initiative after the duration. If that space is occupied, the creature is shunted harmlessly aside to the closest unoccupied space.

Failure As success, but the creature is hurled forward in time [[/gmr 1d4 #minutes]]{1d4 minutes}.

Critical Failure As success, but the creature is hurled into an entirely alternate timeline. At your discretion, the creature's gear is left behind in your timeline. Whether or not the creature will ever return to your timeline depends on the GM's whim, but at the very least, it should never return within the span of a year's passing.

Entropy Sense.name: Entropy Sense
Entropy Sense.description: The ancient one can predict the presence of a creature through supernatural insight into chaotic probabilities and chance and builds a perception of reality from this information, allowing them to "see" as a precise sense in the listed range. Invisible creatures are visible to them, but veil of privacy prevents a creature from being detected via entropy sense automatically (without a counteract check).

Otherworldly Mind.name: Otherworldly Mind
Otherworldly Mind.description: Whenever a creature targets the ancient one with a mental effect, that creature takes @Damage[6d8[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:39|basic] save). On a critical failure, the creature also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

The Connection Cuts Both Ways.name: The Connection Cuts Both Ways
The Connection Cuts Both Ways.description: Creatures the ancient one affected with a mental effect or communicated with telepathically within the last round can hijack the ancient one's telepathic connection; they automatically ignore the ancient one's immunity to auditory, emotion, and visual effects until the end of their current turn. They can additionally spend 1 Mythic Point as a free action to reach through the connection to manipulate the ancient one's mind, ignoring the ancient one's mythic resilience on Will saving throws.

Undying Myth.name: Undying Myth
Undying Myth.description:
Cost all of the Ancient One's Mythic Points

Trigger The ancient one would die and has at least 1 Mythic Point

Effect The ancient one remains conscious, and recovers 50% of their maximum Hit Points.

Unified Timeline.name: Unified Timeline
Unified Timeline.description:
Trigger A creature ends its movement within 10 feet of the ancient one

Effect Ancient ones exist spread out across infinite times and places simultaneously and can shift themselves through their catalog of potentialities. The ancient one teleports themself and the triggering creature into empty squares within 10 feet of their respective positions, though the triggering creature can't be moved into hazardous terrain or to a place it can't stand. An unwilling creature can resist the teleportation with a successful @Check[will|dc:42] save.

Dismantle All Life.name: Dismantle All Life
Dismantle All Life.description: Time and entropy end all things, even the undead. When the ancient one's Strikes hit a creature with void healing, they deal vitality damage instead of void damage. The ancient one can't use their Strikes to restore Hit Points to living or undead creatures.

Recharge.name: Recharge
Recharge.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The ancient one regains an expended spell.

Reroll.name: Reroll
Reroll.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Trigger The ancient one fails a check

Effect The ancient one rerolls the check.

Slither Between Worlds.name: Slither Between Worlds
Slither Between Worlds.description: The ancient one instantly transports themself and any items they're wearing and holding from their current space to an unoccupied space within 100 feet they can see. Once per turn, the ancient one can spend 1 Mythic Point to slither between worlds as a free action on their turn.

Vision of Lost Meaning.name: Vision of Lost Meaning
Vision of Lost Meaning.description:
The ancient one speaks without sound, contacting a creature within 120 feet telepathically to send out waves of visions that fill its mind with fragmented thoughts, unrealized chaos, and futures where its choices are never consequential. The target attempts a @Check[will|dc:42] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is disoriented by the visions and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Failure The target is overwhelmed by the visions and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure, but the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3}.

Ancient One (The Ashen Man's Anger).name: Ancient One (The Ashen Man's Anger)
Ancient One (The Ashen Man's Anger).publicNotes:
In the Dimension of Time, creatures clad in tattered robes float between encapsulated bubbles of still, captured moments, untethered to any other place, unspeaking and unseeing. The few mortals to meet these enigmatic, faceless creatures have never known them to identify by any name other than the ancient ones, seemingly holding no identity (or no identity they wish to share) beyond their relationship with time.

The ancients profess to have always existed in the Dimension of Time, and for time to have always existed in the Great Beyond. Most reside in Stethelos, the storied city at the center of time, though they're also found wandering the Void, crossing the strangest corners of the Maelstrom where it lies between other planes, and occasionally, venturing into dark corners of the Universe. They serve at the will of Tawil at'Umr, the All in One and the One in All, an avatar of Yog-Sothoth lurking deep within time as Stethelos's caretaker. Though the ancient ones resemble their master in stature and attire, and though none would describe Tawil at'Umr as anything other than ancient in origin, most scholars consider "ancient one" a classification of its own separate from that of Great Old One, and Tawil at'Umr is definitively counted among the Great Old Ones by all who know it.

Where Yog-Sothoth is an embodiment of all space and time, an entity who concerns himself with guarding cosmic secrets, the ancient ones are philosophers and mystics seeking ever more enlightenment. They search, have searched, and will search across time indefinitely and, having found entropy and disorder, conclude this to be the Great Beyond's ultimate purpose. When a new creature dawns, it's pristine and whole—perfectly ordered—for but a single moment before it can be eroded by Pharasma's poison, accumulating decay, change, and chaos, until finally it reaches its ending, when time leaves a twilight creature broken and gone. Law and chaos, the ancient ones believe, aren't opposing or even separate forces, but a single expression of reality viewed from two angles, different from each other only in time.

How Old is Time?

Lying in parallel with the Great Beyond with a presence felt on nearly every plane, from the Inner Sphere to the Outer Rifts, the Dimension of Time holds too many secrets for a reality so seemingly omnipresent. Can a world truly be said to begin before time is there to start? Scholars say Pharasma is the oldest being in the Great Beyond, a survivor of some previous multiverse's collapse, but does the Lady of Graves predate time, or did she bring the Dimension of Time with her so history could begin everything anew?

Into the Dimension of Time

The Dimension of Time is one of the most difficult and complex realms in the Great Beyond to travel to, with restrictions on its access limiting all but the most powerful of planar travelers from visiting it. At the GM's discretion, though, items looted from an ancient one, or even just fragments torn from their robes, could function as the planar key needed to allow a PC to use interplanar teleport to access the Dimension of Time.

Tortured Gaze.name: Tortured Gaze
Tortured Gaze.description: 30 feet, or 60 feet if the tormented hero is at 170 HP or lower. The psychic agony of the tormented hero spills into the world around them, inflicting murderous hallucinations of being trampled by the Oliphaunt or crushed beneath Spindlehorn. A non-undead creature that ends its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:37] save or take @Damage[5d8[bludgeoning]] damage and be knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Scream in Agony.name: Scream in Agony
Scream in Agony.description: Each creature in the tormented hero's tortured gaze aura takes @Damage[18d6[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:40|basic] save). A creature that fails is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure). The tormented can't Scream in Agony again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Scream in Agony]]{1d4 rounds} but recharges the ability whenever they take damage from an attacker's critical hit or their own critical failure on a saving throw.

Maze-Weaver.publicNotes: The monstrous, bloated spiders from the windswept realm of Leng build eerie, dangerous lairs with the aid of magically compelled slaves. Leng spiders have anywhere from five to 13 legs, but never an even number.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Leng Spider Venom.name: Leng Spider Venom
Leng Spider Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:33]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 round); the confused effect has the emotion and mental traits.

Ranged Trip.name: Ranged Trip
Ranged Trip.description: A Leng spider can use a web bola to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} a target with the Athletics skill. The skill check takes a -2 circumstance penalty. A web bola deals no damage when used to Trip.

Web Step.name: Web Step
Web Step.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The maze-weaver teleports to a space containing its webs, even if it is on another plane of existence.

Interdimensional Web Sense.name: Interdimensional Web Sense
Interdimensional Web Sense.description: The maze-weaver senses when a creature touches its webs, even if it is on another plane of existence. While touching its webs, the maze-weaver has precise tremorsense to detect the vibrations of creatures touching its webs.

Create Web Weaponry.name: Create Web Weaponry
Create Web Weaponry.description: The Leng spider creates a weapon by applying a cord of webbing to heavy objects, such as rocks or chunks of metal, either attaching two heavy objects together to create a web bola or fastening one to its leg to create a web war flail.

Descend on a Web.name: Descend on a Web
Descend on a Web.description:
The Leng spider moves straight down up to 120 feet, suspended by a web line. It can hang from the web or drop off. The distance it Descends on a Web doesn't count when calculating falling damage.

The web can be severed by a Strike that deals slashing damage (AC 30, Hardness 15, 25 HP), causing the Leng spider to fall.

Lay Web Trap.name: Lay Web Trap
Lay Web Trap.description:
Frequency three times per day

Effect The Leng spider spins a web within 20 feet of itself to create a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.TFnr9Gq7VXPJu0GQ]{Grasping Snare}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.a2XaerM1KkPyLIPM]{Stunning Snare}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.XU8u9F3uoesGDjgM]{Warning Snare}. The Leng spider's web provides all the raw materials it needs. All save and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DCs associated with web traps use the Leng spider's Crafting DC for traps (DC 36). A web trap decays after 24 hours.

Maze-Weaver.name: Maze-Weaver
Maze-Weaver.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Haunted Forge.name: Haunted Forge
Haunted Forge.hp: to destroy one of the forges (both must be destroyed to disable the haunt completely)
Haunted Forge.disable: @Check[religion|dc:38] (master) to exorcise the spirits or @Check[intimidation|dc:41] to quell them with furious anger; three total successes are required to disable the haunt
Haunted Forge.hazarddescription: The rundown furnaces blaze to life, filling with metal and fire, while the wall of hardened lava to the east appears to revert to red hot molten rock.
Haunted Forge.routine:
(4 actions) The burning spirits shriek and howl, swooping in and out of the forges to the south, which roar into scorching life. The spirits scoop up gobs of phantasmal molten dawnsilver and hurl them at different targets in the room. Up to four randomly determined creatures are targeted in this way with molten dawnsilver Strikes (the spirits can target any creature in area B5). A single creature may be targeted only once per round, so if there are fewer than four different targets, the haunt's extra actions are lost. The haunt also loses two actions from its routine if one of the two forges are destroyed.

On a critical hit from a molten dawnsilver Strike, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round as the molten dawnsilver swiftly cools and encases the target. Molten dawnsilver produced by the haunt vanishes entirely 1 round after it's been thrown.

Searing Heat.name: Searing Heat
Searing Heat.description:
Trigger A creature comes within 30 feet of either forge

Effect The eastern wall appears to transform into molten lava, and dozens of shrieking human spirits made of fire fly out of the lava to spiral and scorch through the room. Creatures in area B5 must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:34] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[4d6[fire]] damage

Failure The creature takes @Damage[8d6[fire]] damage, @Damage[1d6[persistent,fire]] damage, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[16d6[fire]] damage, @Damage[2d6[persistent,fire]] damage, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Animate Nightmare.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Panicking Touch.name: Panicking Touch
Panicking Touch.description:
Requirements The animate nightmare's previous action was a nightmare tendril Strike against a creature

Effect The animate nightmare's touch lingers and infuses the mind of the creature it just attempted to Strike. The creature takes @Damage[8d6[persistent,mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:38|basic] save). If the creature is already taking persistent mental damage from Panicking Touch, it must instead succeed at a @Check[will|dc:38] save or endure a different effect based on the animate nightmare's apocalyptic embodiment; this additional effect lasts as long as the persistent mental damage lasts.

Disaster The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and can't reduce its frightened condition.

Disorder The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}.

Famine The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}.

Plague The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Apocalyptic Embodiment.name: Apocalyptic Embodiment
Apocalyptic Embodiment.description:
An animate nightmare embodies one societal fear, chosen from the following options. Depending on the choice, the animate nightmare gains one additional 8th-rank occult innate spell, as listed below.

Disaster The animate nightmare appears as a person or creature who's suffered devastating wounds from a calamity—horrific burns, crushed and broken limbs, impalements from wind-tossed debris, and the like. It gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0XP2XOxT9VSiXFDr]{Phantasmal Calamity} at 8th rank.

Disorder The animate nightmare looks like a distorted parody of a commonplace person with unnaturally long limbs, a twisted visage, and a scratching shrill voice. It gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.LiGbewa9pO0yjbsY]{Confusion} at 8th rank.

Famine The animate nightmare appears as a humanoid carrion bird or other bestial scavenger (such as a jackal or a fly) on the brink of death from starvation. It gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.fd31tAHSSGXyOxW6]{Vampiric Exsanguination} at 8th rank.

Plague The animate nightmare is shaped like a tangle of diseased bodies animated into hideous life that might have just crawled out of a mass grave. It gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.MS60WhVifb45qORJ]{Spiritual Epidemic} at 8th rank.

Animate Nightmare.name: Animate Nightmare
Animate Nightmare.publicNotes:
Whereas animate dreams form from the fears of specific individuals, animate nightmares are spawned by the terrors that beset civilizations. An animate nightmare's appearance depends on the type of fear that created it, but, like fears, result in similar forms.

Emigrants From Dreams

Animate nightmares often haunt the ruins of the civilization that birthed them. Others are drawn to Jandelay, the enigmatic demiplane where the fragments of dead worlds are preserved for all eternity, or to Abaddon, where apocalyptic nihilism is the rule. These latter nightmares might stay close to their "parent" civilizations, while others wander the broken avenues of multiple worlds, feeding off the traces of fear that linger in those places.

Covetous Corridor.name: Covetous Corridor
Covetous Corridor.hazarddescription: Statues depicting the runelords of envy steal magic from intruders.
Covetous Corridor.reset: The hazard resets automatically if not disabled.

Covet Magic.name: Covet Magic
Covet Magic.description:
Trigger A magic item or active spell effect enters the corridor

Effect A randomly determined statue uses the hazard's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} Magic action. The hazard then rolls initiative.

Steal Magic.name: Steal Magic
Steal Magic.description:
Roll a [[/gmr d10]] to determine which statue activates, rerolling a result of 10 or any result that would indicate a disabled statue or a statue that is already charged. The indicated statue casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kUSShxXzY1sPtJA0]{Detonate Magic} with a [[/gmr 1d20+32 #Counteract]]{+32} bonus to its counteract check. The spell targets the closest magic item within 120 feet, prioritizing the highest-ranking magic item and targeting spell effects only if no magic item is within range. On a success or critical success, the statue gathers the dispersed energy into its implement, charging it.

While the statue's implement remains charged, any creature who is at least an expert in @Check[arcana|dc:44], @Check[nature|dc:44], @Check[occultism|dc:44], or @Check[religion|dc:44] can use a 2-action activity with the concentrate trait to attempt a DC 44 check using that skill. On a success or critical success, they return the magic to its original source, causing it to reactivate. Removing an implement from its statue prevents the statue from using Transfer Magic but doesn't prevent a creature from restoring the charge to its source.

Transfer Magic.name: Transfer Magic
Transfer Magic.description:
Requirements The implements of at least three runelord statues are charged

Effect Three statues with charged implements transfer their charges to the Belimarius statue. While the Belimarius statue holds at least one charge, a creature can transfer charges from its implement as described in Steal Magic, except the DC of the skill check increases to DC 46; success returns the stolen magic to the appropriate items.

@Check[arcana|dc:46], @Check[nature|dc:46], @Check[occultism|dc:46], or @Check[religion|dc:46]

Empower Barrier.name: Empower Barrier
Empower Barrier.description:
Requirements The hazard starts its turn, and the Belimarius statue holds at least one charge

Effect The Belimarius statue transfers all charges from its implement into the force barrier separating the corridor from area B3. For every charge the statue transfers, the force barrier gains 10 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 hour. (If the force barrier has been destroyed, the statue instead expends the first charge to cast a 6th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.7Iela4GgVeO3LfAo]{Wall of Force}, with any remaining charges granting the barrier temporary Hit Points.) Charges transferred to the force barrier are lost forever and can't be returned to items they were stolen from.

Covetous Corridor.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:45] (master) to unweave the magic surrounding a statue, @Check[athletics|dc:48] (expert) to wrest a statue's implement from its hands, @Check[thievery|dc:48] (expert) to slip an implement free, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th rank; counteract DC 36) to counteract the magic that empowers the statue. Increase the DCs to disable the Belimarius statue by 2. Each statue must be disabled or counteracted separately, and disabling the Belimarius statue or all nine other statues permanently disables the hazard.
Covetous Corridor.routine: (4 actions) The hazard uses @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} Magic twice. Once the implements of at least three runelord statues are charged, the hazard uses its next available action to Transfer Magic. If the hazard starts its turn with the Belimarius statue charged, the hazard uses its reaction to Empower Barrier. A disabled runelord statue can't use Steal Magic. If the Belimarius statue is disabled, the hazard can't use Transfer Magic or Empower Barrier.

Elder Shantak.name: Elder Shantak
Elder Shantak.publicNotes:
The imposing shantaks are far more intelligent than their bestial appearance would suggest. They can speak, though their voices sound like glass grinding on stone, and they can't converse in any language besides Aklo.

Shantaks' ability to travel through the gulfs of outer space at supernatural speed allows them to nest on numerous worlds, yet despite this mobility, most shantaks are reluctant to seek out new homes unless faced with no other option. Instead, they roost in discarded ruins or asteroids adrift in space, only emerging and landing upon planets in their chosen stellar system when the urge to feed compels them.

Despite not being native to the Dimension of Dreams, they're commonly found in that realm. Their ability to fly through space affords them swift travel between Leng and more hospitable reaches of the Dreamlands, making them particularly sought after as mounts for those who have business in the far reaches of the dreaming plane.

Convincing a shantak to become a mount is notoriously difficult. They refuse any sort of training, and even if one is convinced to ferry a humanoid on their back, they can be obstinate and fickle. Anyone relying on a shantak mount should have a backup plan ready in case the shantak strands their passenger on an asteroid or strange planet after some disagreement.

Although a shantak is nearly the size of an elephant, many possess irrational fears of certain creatures. In particular, nightgaunts terrify them, but other shantaks have been observed fleeing from harpies and gargoyles. Though these ancestries all share the same trait, shantaks don't fear every type of winged humanoid, which makes the origin of their phobia all the more mysterious. Shantaks on Golarion typically hide themselves away in remote places since several of the creatures they fear appear on the planet in abundance.

No Breath.name: No Breath
No Breath.description: The elder shantak doesn't breathe and is immune to effects that require breathing (such as inhaled poison).

Slippery.name: Slippery
Slippery.description: The elder shantak's scales are slimy, granting it a +3 circumstance bonus to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}. A creature mounted on a shantak takes double the normal circumstance penalty to its Reflex saves (–4 instead of –2 in most cases) while mounted.

Flying Strafe.name: Flying Strafe
Flying Strafe.description: The elder shantak Flies up to their fly speed and makes two claw Strikes at any point during it's movement. Each Strike must target a different creature. The attacks take the normal multiple attack penalty.

Screech.name: Screech
Screech.description: The shantak's screech deals @Damage[15d6[sonic]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:50] (@Check[fortitude|dc:33|basic] save). A creature that fails the save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} on a critical failure). The shantak can't use Screech again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Screech]]{1d4 rounds}.

Share Defenses.name: Share Defenses
Share Defenses.description:
Trigger A creature is riding the shantak

Effect The shantak extends their no breath ability and cold resistance to a single creature riding them. They can withdraw this protection as a free action.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.zqgntQXIEbulBgZX]{Effect: Share Defenses}

Cataclysmic Planar Rift.name: Cataclysmic Planar Rift
Cataclysmic Planar Rift.disable: DC 42 Lore (expert) with the plane's Lore skill, @Check[arcana|dc:45] (master), @Check[nature|dc:45] (master), @Check[occultism|dc:45] (master), @Check[religion|dc:45] (master) or @Check[performance|dc:48] (legendary) to perform a planar stabilization rite to minimize the damage
Cataclysmic Planar Rift.hazarddescription: This apocalypse represents the effects of numerous planar rifts forming and exploding in a region, with the risk of the planar fabric being compromised enough to tear a city-sized (if not larger) hole in reality. These rifts are likely to eject inhabitants of the other plane into the Universe, as well as serve as gateways for furious defenders to pour through to punish anyone they think might be responsible for the problem. Any additional encounters that result from these incursions should award XP as normal for encounters of their difficulty. While the rifts are likely to all lead to the same plane, particularly far-reaching disruptions might create gateways to multiple planes at once, with each rift spewing forth its own defenders. These groups would each have their own aims and agendas, clashing, collaborating, or causing chaos wherever they go.
Cataclysmic Planar Rift.routine:
(1+ hours, @Check[flat|dc:18]) Rifts detonate with raw planar essence. As the hazard progresses, the ruptures grow more frequent until they merge together into a gaping portal (this final stage might be prevented with good fortune or successful efforts to Prepare). Ruptures occur once per 10 minutes for the first hour and once per minute for the second hour. The frequency with which each unprepared creature in the area is hit by a rupture depends upon their proximity to the hazard's epicenter. If the hazard proceeds into a third hour, all creatures and objects in the area take the hazard's damage one final time before being swallowed up by the burgeoning portal and deposited on the other plane.

The planar explosions deal 2d12+18 damage, with a DC 42 basic saving throw, and inflict a condition on a failed saving throw. The damage type, saving throw type, condition, and condition duration depend upon the exploding plane, as detailed in the table below.

d20PlaneDamage and SaveCondition
1AbaddonFortitude vs. poison damagefrightened 2 (1 hour, The condition's value can't be reduced by the typical means for 1 hour)
2Astral or Ethereal PlaneEach time a new rift appears, roll again on this table, using the listed effects.Each time a new rift appears, roll again on this table, using the listed effects.
3AxisFortitude vs. force damageclumsy 2 (1 hour)
4BoneyardWill vs. spirit damagedrained 2 (1 hour)
5Creation's ForgeWill vs. vitality damagedazzled (1 hour)
6ElysiumFortitude vs. sonic damagedeafened (24 hours)
7First WorldWill vs. mental damageconfused (1 minute)
8HeavenReflex vs. fire damagefascinated by the rift (10 minutes)
9HellReflex vs. fire damagedoomed 1 (1 hour)
10Maelstromvaries 2varies 2
11NirvanaFortitude vs. bludgeoning damagestupefied 2 (1 hour)
12The NetherworldFortitude vs. cold damageblinded (10 minutes)
13Outer RiftsReflex vs. acid damagesickened 1 (1 hour) 1
14Plane of AirReflex vs. electricity damagestunned 1 (1 minute)
15Plane of EarthFortitude vs. bludgeoning damagefatigued
16Plane of FireReflex vs. fire damage2d6 persistent fire damage
17Plane of MetalReflex vs. slashing damage2d6 persistent bleed damage
18Plane of WaterReflex vs. bludgeoning damageoff-guard (10 minutes)
19Plane of WoodReflex vs. piercing damage–15-foot circumstance penalty to Speeds (10 minutes)
20The VoidWill vs. void damageenfeebled 2 (1 hour)
Cataclysmic Planar Rift.stealthdetails: DC 40 Lore (expert) for the plane's Lore skill to notice pinpoint incursions from the other plane or @Check[arcana|dc:45] (master), @Check[nature|dc:45] (master), @Check[occultism|dc:45] (master), or @Check[religion|dc:45] (master) to detect subtle instabilities in the fabric of the Universe

Clockwork Whale.name: Clockwork Whale

Aquatic Echolocation.name: Aquatic Echolocation
Aquatic Echolocation.description: The clockwork whale can use its hearing as a precise sense at the listed range, but only underwater.

Astounding Orienteering.name: Astounding Orienteering
Astounding Orienteering.description: While in a large body of water, the clockwork whale treats a failure at Survival checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.fJImDBQfqfjKJOhk]{Sense Direction} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} as a success.

Self-Winding.name: Self-Winding
Self-Winding.description: A clockwork whale winds itself through the act of swimming, and as long as it spends at least a minute a day swimming, it gains 24 hours of operational time. A creature can still attempt a @Check[thievery|dc:36] check to Disable a Device to cause the clockwork whale to lose 1 hour of operational time (or 2 hours on a critical success).

Gearsong.name: Gearsong
Gearsong.description: The whale creates a vocalization that can be heard up to 1 mile away, or 10 miles away underwater. Creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] (or a @Template[type:emanation|distance:60] underwater) take @Damage[15d6[sonic]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:38|basic] save). On a failed save, a creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} on a critical failure). The whale can't use Gearsong again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Gearsong]]{1d4 rounds}.

Clockwork Whale.publicNotes:
Out of all ancient Azlant's clockwork creations, clockwork whales are perhaps the most impressive—or at least the among the largest. Shaped like a bizarre fusion of a shark and an enormous toothed whale, clockwork whales patrolled the shipping lanes around Azlant for centuries before Earthfall shattered the continent, sinking it beneath the waves. Outfitted with complex programming and sensory arrays that allowed for near-perfect navigation, clockwork whales are thought to have been used primarily for securing new and safe nautical routes, although some served as naval transports during Azlant's cold war with the empire's ancient enemy, the alghollthus.

With jaws nearly a third of its entire length, a clockwork whale's bite can slice neatly through smaller seafaring vessels and inflict devastating damage to the hulls of larger ones. These gears swiftly cut those swallowed whole into fragments that are then slowly washed away by the flow of water through tiny gaps in the creature's body.

Winding Up

Most clockworks must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute, after which the clockwork remains operational for the listed amount of time. As long as a clockwork whale spends at least a minute every day swimming, its self-winding ability allows it to continue operating without needing this step. A clockwork whale that can't swim (as might be the case after a clockwork whale becomes beached) usually remains operational for approximately 8 hours before it completely winds down.

Meteor Shower (Escalation).stealthdetails: @Check[Astronomy Lore|dc:41] (master) or @Check[nature|dc:45] (legendary) to notice signs of the approach of unusual celestial bodies
Meteor Shower (Escalation).name: Meteor Shower (Escalation)
Meteor Shower (Escalation).disable: @Check[Astronomy Lore|dc:40] (master) or @Check[nature|dc:50] (legendary) to predict the trajectory of the falling asteroids and determine safe zones, @Check[athletics|dc:45] (legendary) or @Check[crafting|dc:47] (master) to dig underground shelters, @Check[diplomacy|dc:45] (master) or @Check[intimidation|dc:47] (master) to coordinate an orderly evacuation
Meteor Shower (Escalation).hazarddescription: Impact from a sufficiently large asteroid would be powerful enough to wipe out a region or destroy a planet, but smaller-scale impact events, like from a meteor shower, present hazards that could be survived. This shower might arise naturally, or it might be the result of the PCs or other forces preventing a greater calamity by breaking a world-rending asteroid into smaller pieces.
Meteor Shower (Escalation).routine:
(1+ minutes, @Check[flat|dc:17]) Small asteroids rain down across the sky, battering and incinerating those caught in their path before carving craters. Over the course of a minute, enough asteroids smash into the ground and explode to inflict @Damage[7d10[bludgeoning],14d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to any unprepared characters in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:46|basic] save). The @Template[type:burst|distance:40]{40-foot-radius} craters left behind are greater difficult terrain.

The material raining down from outer space includes chunks of adamantine. Adamantine's ability to break through the Hardness of materials is particularly lethal at terminal velocity. The falling adamantine has Hardness 20, allowing the asteroid's bludgeoning damage to overcome the Hardness of all materials with less Hardness, including shelters that would otherwise provide cover. Cover that's destroyed by the bludgeoning damage provides no protection against the fire damage.

Commander Yrasthura.name: Commander Yrasthura

equipment-Splint Mail.description: This type of armor is chain mail reinforced with flexible, interlocking metal plates, typically located on the wearer's torso, upper arms, and legs. A suit of this armor comes with an undercoat of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.zBYEU9E7034ENCmh]{Padded Armor} and a pair of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Ix2vicchE79d6Cl3]{gauntlets}.
equipment-Splint Mail.name: Splint Mail

Spell Effect: Fly.name: Spell Effect: Fly
Spell Effect: Fly.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.A2JfEKe6BZcTG1S8]{Fly}

The target can soar through the air, gaining a fly Speed equal to its Speed or 20 feet, whichever is greater.

Demand.name: Demand
Demand.description: When a rune giant casts their innate @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.R9xqCBblkS5KE4y7]{Sending} spell, they can also cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qwlh6aDgi86U3Q7H]{Suggestion} on the target.

Flashing Runes.name: Flashing Runes
Flashing Runes.description:
Trigger The rune giant uses an arcane ability or casts an arcane spell

Effect The runes on the giant's body flash with magical energy. Each creature within a @Template[emanation|distance:10] must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:35] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

equipment-Longspear.name: Longspear
equipment-Longspear.description: This very long spear, sometimes called a pike, is purely for thrusting rather than throwing. Used by many soldiers and city watch for crowd control and defense against charging enemies, it must be wielded with two hands.

equipment-Greatsword.name: Greatsword
equipment-Greatsword.description: This immense two-handed sword is nearly as tall as its wielder. Its lower blade is often somewhat dulled to allow it to be gripped for extra leverage in close-quarter fights.

Reactive Strike (Special).name: Reactive Strike (Special)
Reactive Strike (Special).description:
The rune giant gains an additional reaction at the beginning of each of their turns that they can use only for a Reactive Strike.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ReactiveStrike]

Command Giants.name: Command Giants
Command Giants.description: When a rune giant casts a mental spell against another giant, the DC is 39, rather than 35

Invoke Rune.name: Invoke Rune
Invoke Rune.description:
The rune giant invokes one of the runes on their body, causing the rune to spray forth a @Template[cone|distance:30] of sparks that deals @Damage[6d12[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage to all creatures in the cone (@Check[reflex|dc:37|basic|options:area-effect] save).

The giant can't use Invoke Rune again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Invoke Rune]]{1d4 rounds}.

A glowing copy of the invoked rune appears on a single weapon the giant holds, granting the weapon one effect listed below of the giant's choice. The effect on the weapon lasts for 1 minute. If the giant places a new rune on a weapon, any previously placed rune immediately vanishes, ending its effect.

  • Rune of Destruction The weapon gains the deadly trait with three weapon damage dice of the same die size as for the base weapon, and a creature hit with the weapon is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} unless it succeeds at a @Check[fortitude|dc:35] save.
  • Rune of Flames The weapon deals an additional @Damage[3d6[fire]] damage on all attacks.
  • Rune of Smiting When the weapon hits, the giant can Push the target back 10 feet, or 20 feet on a critical hit.
  • Rune of Space During the rune giant's turn, the weapon's reach is increased to 60 feet.

Wide Swing.name: Wide Swing
Wide Swing.description: The rune giant makes a single greatsword Strike and compares the attack roll result to the ACs of up to two foes within their reach. This counts as two attacks for the giant's multiple attack penalty.

Commander Yrasthura.publicNotes:
Rune giants are tyrants among their own kind, given power to command and magically control other giants. They once served even more powerful masters—potent wizards known as runelords—and in so doing, commanded entire armies of giants in service to the runelords' empires.

In the eons since these empires collapsed, rune giants have persisted, though to the outside world they're little more than fabled horrors. Rune giants usually dwell in the most remote and rugged of towering mountain ranges, but they can also be found in immense ruins atop lost islands, glacial valleys, or even more remote or magical regions.

Dozens of runes decorate rune giants' striking charcoal flesh. They are towering creatures, averaging at 40 feet in height and weighing 25,000 pounds.

Giants are massive humanoid creatures who live in remote regions throughout the world. They vary widely but are united in their hunger, requiring sustenance of their own element along with the feasts one would expect from such a massive humanoid. Although a simple matter for some giants, more esoteric types find this need a harsh reality. While a massive fistful of ice or snow alongside their meal will satisfy a frost giant, shadow giants hunger for the coagulated shadows of the Netherworld.

Drain Dreams.name: 汲取梦境 Drain Dreams
Drain Dreams.description:
频率 1次/轮

需求 纳特巴赫的上个动作是成功以下颚打击伤害了1个生物

效果 纳特巴赫那带吸盘的舌头会捉住对方。该生物必须成功通过一次 @Check[will|dc:34] 豁免，失败则会由于梦境被吸走而陷入持续1周的 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}（大失败为 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2}）。若该生物以此方式陷入呆滞，纳特巴赫会恢复 @Damage[32[healing]] 生命值。从已经陷入呆滞的生物身上汲取梦境无法恢复生命值，但是会使得受害者的呆滞值增加1点，最高为 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 5}。

Mythic Power.name: 神话之力 Mythic Power
Mythic Power.description: 该生物拥有 3 点神话点，并可以将这些神话点用于以下任何动作。

Mythic Skill.name: 神话技能 Mythic Skill
Mythic Skill.description:
花费 1点神话点

效果 纳特巴赫尝试的下次特技或隐秘技能检定具有+4点加值，并且该检定视同为具有神话熟练度。

Remove a Condition.name: 移除状态 Remove a Condition
Remove a Condition.description:
花费 1点神话点

效果 纳特巴赫结束1个正在影响它的状态.

Mythic Resilience (Reflex).name: 神话韧性（反射） Mythic Resilience (Reflex)
Mythic Resilience (Reflex).description: 该怪物将与其相关的豁免成功率比骰掷结果的成功度高一个等级。这不会与其他改变成功度的效果叠加，例如失能特征（自然1或20时除外）。怪物每次获得神话韧性时，可选择一项豁免。该能力应首先应用于该怪物的最高豁免。

Nightmare Screech.name: 噩梦尖啸 Nightmare Screech
Nightmare Screech.description:
纳特巴赫在一个 @Template[type:cone|distance:50] 内发出尖啸，这回声在区域内生物的脑海中比在耳畔更加清晰。区域中的人会回想起被遗忘的噩梦中的尖叫声，而梦中承受创伤的记忆会带来令人作呕的痛苦。区域中的生物承受 @Damage[10d8[mental]|options:area-damage] 伤害，而且必须尝试一次 @Check[will|dc:34] 豁免。纳特巴赫在 [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Nightmare Screech]]{1d4轮} 内无法再次使用噩梦尖啸。

大成功 该生物不受伤害。

成功 该生物承受一半伤害并陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}。

失败 该生物承受全部伤害并陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}

大失败 该生物承受双倍伤害，陷入恶心2，而且只要还处于恶心状态（或1分钟，以先结束者为准），就会同时陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}。

Writhing Clutches.name: 盘绕抓握 Writhing Clutches
Writhing Clutches.description: 当纳特巴赫令一个超大型或更小的生物陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]或 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]时，它能带着该生物以半速飞行；当纳特巴赫令一个中型或更小的生物陷入受擒或束缚时，它能带着该生物以全速飞行。

Natbakh.name: 纳特巴赫 Natbakh
Natbakh.publicNotes:
纳特巴赫是栖息在狂风肆虐的维度——冷原（Leng）的生物，常见于山峰与地下洞穴之中，盘桓在这噩梦领域的昏暗天空之下。

噩梦迸发 Nightmare Eruptions

在格拉利昂与冷原之间的边界很薄的地区，比如科达山脉（Kodar Mountains）的深处，纳特巴赫掌握着一种进入清醒世界的可怕手段。若纳特巴赫吞食了在这种边界很薄的地区睡觉的人的梦中人格，它就能从这入睡之人的身体中迸发而出，同时在梦境与现实中杀死对方，它通常会先把已死的入梦者的家砸成碎片，然后才会飞到山上建立自己的巢穴。这种“噩梦迸发”十分罕见，但只需要几只纳特巴赫，就能在这片毫无防备的地区留下深刻的印记。

Malfunctioning Perfumery (Eastern).disable: @Check[crafting|dc:52] (legendary) to quickly introduce neutralizing agents into the alchemical machinery, @Check[thievery|dc:55] (master) to disable the mechanized portions of the devices, or @Check[arcana|dc:55] (master) to counteract magical elements; four total successes are required to disable the hazard (destroying one of the four workbenches counts as one success)
Malfunctioning Perfumery (Eastern).name: Malfunctioning Perfumery (Eastern)
Malfunctioning Perfumery (Eastern).hazarddescription: The magically and mechanically automated tools Sorshen used to aid in the crafting of perfume on the long, eastern workbench have interacted in unexpected ways, transforming the workshop into a dangerous peril.
Malfunctioning Perfumery (Eastern).routine:
(5 actions) On its initiative, the malfunctioning perfumery takes the following five actions, in order. For each success at disabling it, the hazard loses one action. The targets for actions 2–5 are randomly chosen from creatures in the room, with no one creature being targeted more than once before all other creatures in the room have been targeted. For example, a party of 4 PCs will each be targeted by one of these actions. If just a single PC is in the room, they will be targeted by all four.

  • 1: Crushing Notes 1 (olfactory, poison) The malfunctioning machinery exudes a blast of concentrated and overwhelming perfume notes into area B11. Creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:15|traits:olfactory,poison] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} on a critical failure).
  • 2: Nozzle Spray 1 (poison) Nozzles built into the machinery extend out to spray toxic, overwhelmingly cloying perfume in multiple directions. One randomly determined target in area B11 takes @Damage[14d6[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:45|basic|traits:poison] save).
  • 3: Sillage 1 (emotion, mental) A larger, more intimidating nozzle than the one utilized in the previous action extends forward and violently sprays a staggering array of different scents at a random target in the room. The overwhelming mixture of lingering scent (the perfume's sillage) causes the creature to take @Damage[10d6[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:45|basic|traits:emotion,mental] save); on a failed save, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round by the overwhelming scents.
  • 4: Oil Spill 1 (fire) Sparks from grinding machinery ignite a patch of spilled oil somewhere in the room—a random creature in area B11 takes @Damage[10d6[fire],4d6[persistent,fire]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:45|basic|traits:fire] save).
  • 5: Boiling Beaker 1 (emotion, mental) A pressurized beaker containing boiling fluids springs a leak, and a dislodged tube sprays disorienting, psychotropic fumes at a random creature in the room, who must then succeed at a @Check[will|dc:44|traits:emotion,mental] save to avoid becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round (1 minute on a critical failure).

Pungent Cloud.name: Pungent Cloud
Pungent Cloud.description:
Trigger The door to area B11 is opened or a creature enters the area, or any open flame is brought into area B11

Effect The musky fog filling the perfume laboratory billows out into the hall, spreading 5 feet from the doorway and expanding by another 5 feet each round the door remains open. All creatures within the fog become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the fog become concealed to creatures within it. Creatures in the fog must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:45|traits:poison|options:area-effect,inflicts:sickened] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure); this is a poison effect. If the pungent cloud was triggered by open flame, chemicals in the air ignite into a flash of fire, dealing @Damage[6d6[fire],6d6[poison]|options:area-damage] damage to all creatures in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:45|basic|options:area-effect] save), after which the pungent cloud disperses. The hazard then rolls initiative.

Colossus Rampage.disable: @Check[crafting|dc:48] (master) or Thievery (master) to lay traps to hamper the approaching rampage; DC 50 (master) skill check with a skill typically used to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} about the creature's type to make targeted preparations (DC 46 if it's a Lore skill); or @Check[Warfare Lore|dc:46] (master), @Check[intimidation|dc:48] (master), or @Check[diplomacy|dc:50] (master) to rally nearby troops to prepare for battle
Colossus Rampage.stealthdetails: DC 32 (master) skill check with a skill typically used to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} about the rampaging creatures to notice subtle signs of their proximity in the surrounding landscape (DC 30 if it's a Lore skill) or @Check[survival|dc:38] (master) to notice the ground trembling from immense footfalls

Flying Shards.name: Flying Shards
Flying Shards.description:
The stampede crushes through buildings and rends the ground in its wake. As it does, rocks, trees, metal fragments, and all manner of other dangerous objects soar through the air at perilous speeds. All creatures in the area take 4d10+12 bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:42|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage type depends upon the nature of what the stampede is currently destroying (or can be randomly determined).

@Damage[(4d10+12)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage]

@Damage[(4d10+12)[piercing]|options:area-damage]

@Damage[(4d10+12)[slashing]|options:area-damage]

Toxic Miasma.name: Toxic Miasma
Toxic Miasma.description:
Poison fills the air, infiltrating the bodies of all who are unfortunate enough to enter its reach. This ability most often represents the effect of a congregation of poisonous monsters, but it could also come about from more unusual circumstances like the destruction of a site used to mass-produce toxic compounds. By default, the miasma exposes all creatures in the area to cerulean scourge, with Fortitude DC of 42. If the creatures in the stampede have their own specific poison with no onset, you can replace cerulean scourge with their poison effect. Use a Fortitude DC of 42 or the poison's normal DC, whichever is higher.

Cerulean Scourge This poison is infamous for making the victim's blood vessels glow with a bright blue light before painfully bursting.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:42|traits:alchemical,injury,poison]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[10d6[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[12d6[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[14d6[poison]] damage (1 round)

Deathly Terror.name: Deathly Terror
Deathly Terror.description:
The stampede's approach inflicts overwhelming fear upon those who can't escape its path. This ability might represent exposure to frightful presence auras, terrifying howls, or simply the sheer presence of the advancing army. All creatures that start their turn in the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:42] save, with the following effects. An affected creature can't reduce the value of its frightened condition while it remains in the aura.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to deathly terror for 10 minutes.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 4}.

Dust Shroud.name: Dust Shroud
Dust Shroud.description: The stampede fills the air with an impenetrable cloud, blocking all vision. This cloud might arise from a dust storm churned up by massive stomping feet, debris from countless ruined buildings, or a magical ability to summon cloying mist. The cloud blocks all vision, making unprepared creatures @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} until they leave the area, and imparting a –4 circumstance penalty to vision-based Perception checks for prepared creatures. Creatures outside the area can't see into the cloud.

Energy Burst.name: Energy Burst
Energy Burst.description:
Overlapping blasts of energy or other effects carpet the area. This ability might represent the energy breaths of creatures like dragons, or the overlapping auras of creatures wreathed in fire or other elements. It might also represent the combined effects of numerous spellcasters to cover the region, whether they are part of the stampede itself or defenders attempting to slow the stampede with indiscriminate magic. All creatures in the area take 4d10+12 acid, cold, electricity, fire, sonic, or void damage (@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage type depends upon the nature of the magic (or can be randomly determined).

@Damage[(4d10+12)[acid]|options:area-damage]

@Damage[(4d10+12)[cold]|options:area-damage]

@Damage[(4d10+12)[electricity]|options:area-damage]

@Damage[(4d10+12)[fire]|options:area-damage]

@Damage[(4d10+12)[sonic]|options:area-damage]

@Damage[(4d10+12)[void]|options:area-damage]

Colossus Rampage.name: Colossus Rampage
Colossus Rampage.hazarddescription: Monsters of titanic proportions awaken and stampede across the land, crushing everything in their wake. These might be a group of battling kaiju, an army of titanic constructs, or another onslaught of oversized creatures. This hazard works best when combined with combat against one or more massive monsters. These creatures might notice the PCs' strength and decide to get rid of them before the PCs have a chance to interfere with their onslaught.
Colossus Rampage.routine:
(10+ minutes, @Check[flat|dc:15]) The colossus rampage affects the entire area, but whether or not the affected area remains static, moves, expands, or otherwise changes is left to you to determine as the story needs. At the start of each minute, unprepared creatures in the area take @Damage[(3d10+10)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:47|basic] save). A creature that fails the save is jostled enough that they're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for that minute, while a creature that critically fails is pinned under fallen debris and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until they [[/act escape dc=47]].

Two additional effects, based on the nature of the creatures and the battlefield, take place during that minute. Roll [[/gmr 1d10]] for each to determine on which round during that minute each effect takes place (rerolling duplicate rounds). You can create alternative abilities to better fit the nature of the creatures in the stampede, but in general, consider selecting one ability that imposes a condition or battlefield effect and one that deals damage. Note that these effects can affect prepared and unprepared creatures in the area, but when a prepared creature attempts a save against any of these effects, they increase their result by one degree of success.

Shattered Runewell of Pride.name: 破碎的傲慢符文井 Shattered Runewell of Pride
Shattered Runewell of Pride.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:37]（大师）或 @Check[occultism|dc:40]（大师）以将魔法重新引导回其自身并消除危险；或 @Check[crafting|dc:40]（传奇）以重新安置符文井碎片使其不再危险；总计需要三次成功才能解除破碎的符文井。
Shattered Runewell of Pride.hazarddescription: 洋红色与紫色的光芒和蒸汽从现实中的一个裂隙中翻动而出，周围悬浮着处于爆炸中的符文井 碎片。
Shattered Runewell of Pride.routine: （3 动作）当破碎的符文井进行第一个动作时，一个由闪烁的洋红色与紫色光芒和火焰构成的、高达30尺的符文领主赞多古尔形象自符文井中巍然升起。在该危害的三个动作中，这一符文领主赞多古尔的显现都会俯视PC们，同时从符文井中射出色彩奇异的火焰触须，每一条触须各自以区域内不同的PC为目标。这些触须的效果因其颜色而异；这些远程打击可以将傲慢之眼中的任何生物作为目标，并正常累积多重攻击减值。
Shattered Runewell of Pride.stealthdetails: （专家）以意识到破碎的符文井具有危险性；注意到该危害的DC为0。

Frightful Shriek.name: 惊惧尖啸 Frightful Shriek
Frightful Shriek.description:
触发 入侵者进入傲慢之眼

效果 半位面中的所有幻象孔雀发出愤怒的大声尖啸。所有傲慢之眼的入侵者必须尝试进行一次 @Check[will|dc:37] 意志豁免，否则将陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}（大失败则为 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}）。随后，破碎的符文井骰先攻。

Phantom of Desire.name: Phantom of Desire

Universal Language.name: Universal Language
Universal Language.description: Anything spoken by the phantom of desire is perceived by the listener in its native language.

Urban Legend.name: Urban Legend
Urban Legend.description:
This phantom is a manifestation of the pernicious rumors throughout the Inner Sea region that Sorshen is hiding her true intentions as ruler of New Thassilon and is biding her time for a chance to reveal her true motives to the world once she's lulled everyone into a false sense of security. A PC who Seeks or Senses Motive on a phantom of desire with a @Check[perception|dc:44] check realizes that the phantom of desire doesn't actually do additional bleed damage with her strikes, doesn't have her Enticing Charade ability, and doesn't have any innate spells at all. Unlike the typical brainchild, phantoms of desire are fully created by the animus of longing; they do not possess the typical Persistence of Memory ability most brainchildren have.

A brainchild is sustained only by the reputation that precedes them. Mindless creatures are immune to a brainchild and can't perceive them.

The brainchild's size, features, and items, as well as the appearance of their attacks, match what the foes perceiving them expect. If foes expect to see different things, the brainchild chooses which to manifest. If any creature that can perceive the brainchild believes the brainchild has one of the abilities below, the brainchild has that ability.

A creature can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1xRFPTFtWtGJ9ELw]{Sense Motive} (against the brainchild's Deception DC) to attempt to disbelieve an individual ability. If at any point no creature perceiving the brainchild believes in the ability, the brainchild loses that ability immediately. If foes expect different particulars, such as one believing the brainchild is immune to fire and another believing they're immune to divinations, the brainchild chooses one to have.

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.j2wsK6IsW5yMW1jW]{Tremorsense} (imprecise) 100 feet
  • Immunity to one damage type, magic school, or condition
  • Weakness 10 to one damage type other than mental
  • Resistance 10 to physical damage, with an exception for either cold iron or silver
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.etMnv73EIdEZrYYu]{Frightful Presence} (aura, emotion, fear, mental) 100 feet, DC 28
  • [[/r 1d6]]{1d6} Extra Damage on Strikes, of a type one foe believes in
  • Additional Spells @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.R8bqnYiThB6MYTxD]{Phantom Pain} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IqJ9URobmJ9L9UBG]{Shadow Blast} at 6th rank

Delusional Aspiration.name: Delusional Aspiration
Delusional Aspiration.description: When a phantom of desire hits a creature with an intrusive thought Strike, the creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:38] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}.

Enticing Charade.name: Enticing Charade
Enticing Charade.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The phantom telepathically reaches into the mind of another creature, offering to make their dreams come true. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:40] save to avoid becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} by the distraction (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure) until the start of the phantom's next turn.

Phantom of Desire.publicNotes: A rumor can become so vivid and so persistent that it comes to life, creating a brainchild-a living illusion that hatches from an intense belief in a remorseless and implacable killer. Often, these rumors swirl around the victims of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.tlcrVRqW1MSKJ5IC]{Phantasmal Killer} spell. A brainchild's capabilities grow when they pursue a believer but deflate against skeptics, making them only as bad as one thinks they are. A simple drive to stalk, terrify, and kill propels a brainchild, but the creature might also exhibit other behaviors ascribed to them through gossip.

Remove a Condition.name: 移除状态 Remove a Condition
Remove a Condition.description:
花费 1点神话点

效果 复生符文领主结束1个正在影响它的状态.

Beyond Life.name: Beyond Life
Beyond Life.description: A risen runelord may drink or eat for pleasure or entertainment, but they need not do so for nourishment and never suffer the effects of thirst or starvation.

Mythic Resilience (Will).name: Mythic Resilience (Will)
Mythic Resilience (Will).description: 该怪物将与其相关的豁免成功率比骰掷结果的成功度高一个等级。这不会与其他改变成功度的效果叠加，例如失能特征（自然1或20时除外）。怪物每次获得神话韧性时，可选择一项豁免。该能力应首先应用于该怪物的最高豁免。

Vanishing Death.name: Vanishing Death
Vanishing Death.description: When a risen runelord is slain, their body and (if manifested) polearm vanishes as the trapped legacy that was drawn upon to create them is set free, exploding outward in a riot of swirling color. This release of arcane energy hammers the minds of nearby creatures. All creatures adjacent to a risen runelord during their vanishing death must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 24 hours (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) as fragments of their own memories are temporarily scrambled or hidden. Other objects carried by the risen runelord fall to the ground.

Manifest Runelord's Polearm.name: Manifest Runelord's Polearm
Manifest Runelord's Polearm.description:
Requirements The risen runelord isn't holding a runelord's polearm

Effect The risen runelord causes their runelord's polearm to appear in one of their hands. The exact appearance of the polearm depends on the type wielded by the runelord in life, but these weapons are purely spiritual constructs that inflict mental damage on a Strike and vanish as soon as the risen runelord releases the weapon or dies.

Mythic Power.name: 神话之力 Mythic Power
Mythic Power.description: 该生物拥有 3 点神话点，并可以将这些神话点用于以下任何动作。

Quickened Casting.name: Quickened Casting
Quickened Casting.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect If the risen runelord's next action is to cast a cantrip or spell that's 4th-rank or lower, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

Recharge.name: Recharge
Recharge.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The risen runelord regains an expended spell slot or can use Quickened Casting again.

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt the risen runelord's spellcasting action, the risen runelord attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

Risen Runelord (Sloth).name: Risen Runelord (Sloth)
Risen Runelord (Sloth).publicNotes:
Risen runelords are created by a powerful ritual invented by Runelord Xanderghul—a ritual called raise runelord. All risen runelords are at least level 11 creatures. Once created, a risen runelord has no capacity to become more powerful, as they are manifestations of their legacy at a specific point in time (although given enough time and resources, a risen runelord could potentially find a way to overcome this limitation on self-improvement).

A risen runelord has a modicum of free will, but as long as the one who created them via raise runelord lives, they're bound to their creator's desires. A risen runelord ordered to undertake obviously self-destructive actions might, at the GM's discretion, resist the command and could potentially even break free of their creator's control.

Since raise runelord draws upon a runelord's legacy as it exists within the Dreamlands, no risen runelord can ever sleep or dream. Xanderghul can use a risen runelord in a special way: he can use any risen runelord (including ones he didn't create) as a spare body. If he's slain, his soul can instantly jump to the closest risen runelord to replace them and continue the fight, unless the PCs can disable this defense during the second adventure in Revenge of the Runelords. Regardless of level, all risen runelords are mythic creatures and are immune to sleep effects.

Lust and Pride

Of the seven sins, lust and pride are unique among the runelords for these sins were only ever represented by a single runelord—and both still live during the events of this Adventure Path. This may change once the events of Revenge of the Runelords come to a conclusion, in which case the sinful foci for lust and pride become potential options for risen runelords of Sorshen or Xanderghul, but during Revenge of the Runelords, no risen runelords of lust or pride can exist.

Risen Runelord Gear

A risen runelord's polearm is an extension of their being and cannot exist without them, vanishing upon their death. This doesn't prevent a risen runelord from claiming, carrying, or using other items, and most higher-level risen runelords keep real magic items that remain behind after their death.

Security Alert.name: Security Alert
Security Alert.description:
Trigger The adamantine sentinel becomes aware of an unfamiliar creature

Effect The adamantine sentinel alerts its owner of an intruder, either with a mental or audible alarm, depending on established orders. The mental alarm has a range of 1 mile.

Statue's Head.name: Statue's Head
Statue's Head.description: Until the next time it acts, the adamantine sentinel appears to be the head of a statue it's perched atop. It has an automatic result of 53 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as nothing more than a statue's head.

Adamantine Sentinel.name: Adamantine Sentinel
Adamantine Sentinel.publicNotes:
This sentinel has a canine skull adorned with patterns of constellations.

Thassilonian sentinels are crafted in the shapes of skulls or heads.

Sentinel Sets

Thassilonian sentinels were typically carved from marble, ivory, and bronze, easily blending in with most statues. Rarer sentinels carved from wood, coral, and skymetals were often commissioned in sets alongside matching statues to ensure seamless fits or were carefully sculpted for display alone.

Mirror of Glory.stealthdetails: （大师）以察觉镜像能量场具有危险性；察觉该能量场的DC为0
Mirror of Glory.name: 荣耀之镜 Mirror of Glory
Mirror of Glory.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:37]（大师）以破坏连接范式立方体与镜子的六个锚点之一，@Check[arcana|dc:34]（传奇）以运用与傲慢相悖的魔法知识来瓦解镜子的力量，@Check[intimidation|dc:37]（大师）以凭借个人气势对抗镜子放大的傲慢，或施展 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]（8环；反制DC36）以反制范式立方体的六个面之一；需六次成功方可解除荣耀之镜。
Mirror of Glory.hazarddescription: 一座门楼的大型拱门内充满了镜像能量场，观察者会看到自己身着华服，在符文领主赞多古尔面前躬身下拜。
Mirror of Glory.routine:
（6 动作）在荣耀之镜的回合中，它会随机选取区域内的PC作为目标，扭曲他们的现实，每个动作选取一名PC作为目标。若在扭曲PC们的现实后仍有剩余动作，则消耗剩余动作以每动作恢复25点生命值的速度修复自身损伤。若镜子未受损，则未使用的动作将丢失。每次荣耀之镜对PC施展扭曲时，骰1d6并参考以下条目，以确定PC的经历及后续效果。每成功一次解除陷阱的检定，陷阱将失去一个动作，但这不会减少其能创造的扭曲数量。当PC经历扭曲时，他们将受到 @Damage[10d6[mental]] 伤害（@Check[will|dc:37|basic] 豁免），但豁免失败者将承受该扭曲的额外效果。

1—美丽： 将赞多古尔视为他们见过的最具吸引力的人物。额外效果： 陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1} 1轮。

2—残酷： PC将赞多古尔视为一个能施展难以想象的残酷的恶魔般的人物，他向该PC挥出数十把利刃和毒针，意图削弱PC的力量。额外效果： 陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 1}，持续24小时。

3—失望： 对PC而言，赞多古尔突然变成了一个令人畏惧的家长形象、指挥官或其他具有权威的人物，其不赞同的态度导致PC紧张地颤抖。额外效果： 陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1}，持续24小时。

4—嫉妒： PC看着赞多古尔身后展开的华丽孔雀尾羽，心中充满嫉妒，这可能驱使他们不可预测地对盟友发起攻击，以期成为唯一值得赞多古尔关注的人。额外效果： 陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{困惑 Confused} 1轮。

5—绝望： PC感觉自己的肉体正在腐烂，因为他们意识到站在他们面前的赞多古尔存在于时间法则之外。额外效果： 陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1}。

6—崇拜： 深信赞多古尔是唯一真神，并感到迫切需要向他祈祷以求得宽恕。额外效果： 陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 3}。

Bow Before Your God.name: 向你的神祇下拜 Bow Before Your God
Bow Before Your God.description:
触发 生物触摸镜子，或在与镜子相邻时搜索镜像

效果 出现在PC们镜像身后的赞多古尔形象张开双臂，尽显荣耀，改变镜像中的世界。每个在镜中倒映的PC（无论是否正在观察镜像）必须尝试一次 @Check[will|dc:37] 豁免，以避免被迫在赞多古尔的荣耀前跪下——豁免失败的PC将倒地，并因自卑感而陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}，持续24小时。随后陷阱骰先攻。

Watcher in the Wastes.name: Watcher in the Wastes
Watcher in the Wastes.disable: @Check[stealth|dc:51] (master) to avoid the initial notice of the gigantic form, or @Check[occultism|dc:48] (legendary) to know the proper posture and hand sign to make to turn away the watcher's attention
Watcher in the Wastes.hazarddescription: A massive sculpture of a wolflike form as tall as a mountain guards passage to the Cold Wastes at the northern end of Leng and seems almost ready to come to life at the approach of any creatures.
Watcher in the Wastes.stealthdetails: (master) to realize the mountain is dangerous (DC 0 to see the towering statue in the first place)

Dreadful Notice.name: Dreadful Notice
Dreadful Notice.description:
Trigger A creature comes within a mile of the mountain-sized statue's base

Effect While the Watcher does not actually animate, it fills the triggering creature's mind with the dread conviction that it might do so at any moment. The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:42] save, after which they are temporarily immune to that particular Watcher's Dreadful Notice for 24 hours.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 24 hours.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} (unlimited duration).

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} with fear with an unlimited duration; as long as the creature remains paralyzed, they need not drink or eat. If they are brought to a location where they no longer have line of sight to the watcher, the paralyzed creature can attempt a new Will save every day to recover from the paralysis, but during this time they are subject to thirst and starvation as normal.

Spiteful Eye.name: Spiteful Eye
Spiteful Eye.description: 30 feet. Knights of malice hate to see others succeed and sabotage the efforts of other knights whenever they can. The knight of malice takes a –2 circumstance penalty to Reflex saving throws and their Strikes deal an extra 1d6 mental damage if there's at least one other knight of malice in the aura.

Seethe.name: Seethe
Seethe.description:
Requirements Another knight of malice is within the area of the knight's spiteful eye aura

Effect The knight of malice ruminates on their unjust treatment and plots a new method of overthrowing and outshining another knight. The knight of malice gains a second reaction until the start of their next turn, though they still can't use more than one reaction on the same triggering action.

Sinful Bite.name: Sinful Bite
Sinful Bite.description:
A creature hit by the jaws Strike of a knight of malice must attempt a @Check[will|dc:37] save as it's assaulted by envious thoughts.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 minute. For as long as it remains stupefied, the flat check to end the confused condition when the creature is damaged is DC 14.

Critical Failure As failure, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3}.

equipment-Halberd.name: Halberd
equipment-Halberd.description: This polearm has a relatively short, 5-foot shaft. The business end is a long spike with an axe blade attached.

Sin Scent.name: Sin Scent
Sin Scent.description: A knight of malice can smell envious creatures as the scent ability, but as a precise sense. The GM determines which creatures are appropriately envious.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

+4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental.name: +4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental

Jealous Enmity.name: Jealous Enmity
Jealous Enmity.description:
Trigger Another knight of malice successfully Strikes a creature within 15 feet

Requirements The knight of malice Seethed during their last turn

Effect The knight of malice Strides up to 15 feet and makes a melee Strike against the same creature. The knight of malice who rolled a higher result on their attack becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round and can use the extra action only to Seethe or Stride.

Knight of Malice.name: Knight of Malice
Knight of Malice.publicNotes:
Knights of malice are powerful, winged sinspawn, cultivated for the abundance of jealousy and hatred in their hearts. The knights scheme and strive to undermine each other, nourishing their animosity like any other soldier might train to foster camaraderie and teamwork with their allies. Each knight dreams of the day they prove their power and worthiness to the runelord of envy and reap their just rewards.

A Source of Malice

While other runelords abandoned the original sinspawn creation ritual in favor of using minor runewells, Belimarius instead innovated and perfected the original ritual used to create sinspawn, using it to empower a sinspawn through repeated and nested castings. Her knights of malice are washed in the souls of dozens of envious creatures each, reaching greater heights of envy than any other sinspawn.
Knight of Malice.allSaves: +1 status to saves vs. magic, +4 status to saves vs. mental

Sneak Attack.description: Lograsi does an additional 3d6 precision damage to creatures that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}.
Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack

equipment-Rapier.name: Rapier
equipment-Rapier.description: The rapier is a long and thin piercing blade with a basket hilt. It is prized among many as a dueling weapon.

equipment-Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
equipment-Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

Evasive Response.description: When Lograsi rolls a success on a Reflex save, he gets a critical success instead. He isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to hidden, undetected, or flanking creatures of level 18 or lower.
Evasive Response.name: Evasive Response

Unexpected Parry.name: Unexpected Parry
Unexpected Parry.description:
Trigger A creature within Lograsi's reach attempts to Strike Lograsi with a melee weapon

Effect Lograsi attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. The triggering creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to this attack. If the attack is a critical hit, Lograsi disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward his multiple attack penalty, and his multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

Numbing Strike.name: Numbing Strike
Numbing Strike.description:
Trigger Lograsi's Strike hits an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creature and deals damage

Effect The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and takes a –10 foot status penalty to their Speeds from overwhelming chills that numb their flesh. This lasts until the end of Lograsi's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.cBxjqExA5RZ4UNAz]{Effect: Numbing Strike}

Shadowy Wings.name: Shadowy Wings
Shadowy Wings.description:
Trigger Lograsi rolls initiative or Leaps

Effect As one of the favored pawns of the velstrac demagogue Aroggus, Lograsi has been granted a pair of shadowy wings. When he activates his Shadowy Wings, they spring from his back and grant him a 40-foot fly Speed. He can sustain his Shadowy Wings for one round at the start of his turn as a free action. As long as his Shadowy Wings are active, Lograsi gains a +2 status bonus on all Acrobatics and Stealth checks.

Greedspawn.allSaves: 对抗魔法时获得+1状态加值；对抗心灵时获得+4状态加值
Greedspawn.name: 贪婪罪生怪士兵 Greedspawn
Greedspawn.publicNotes:
罪生怪是由被共称为符文领主的七名古代巫师中的一位所创造的——他们每人接纳并呈现出七原罪中的一罪。第一名罪生怪由愤怒符文领主所创造，这源于他对影响并扭曲肉体的技术实践（详见畸肉体）。这种技术在用于创造罪生怪不久之后便落入了其他符文领主手中，之后他们每人都尝试根据自己的设计创造变种，时至今日愤怒罪生怪仍旧是同类中数量最多也最知名的存在。
