罪生怪与肉体被重塑的类人原型之间只有极为模糊的相似之处，他们通常看起来骨瘦嶙峋，长着不自然地修长手臂和反关节的腿部，每根肢体末端都长着短粗的爪状指头。凸起的血管遍及罪生怪全身，血红色的凸起仿佛构成了扭曲的符文，其皮肤苍白无毛。他们的头部被拉长，五官只剩下鼻子、红色的双眼、以及从下巴处裂开成两瓣的下颚，其中露出长长的下垂舌头，舌头尖端分成了三根宛若手指的触须。

罪生怪站起来有6.5尺，体重与同体型的人类相仿。罪生怪的行为模式与和其相关联的原罪有关，他们的体貌特征也会对此有所暗示。举例说明，贪婪罪生怪的血管里流淌的是金色的液体，而嫉妒罪生怪比其他类型的罪生怪更加瘦弱。

Sin Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: 嗅探原罪（模糊感官）30尺
Sin Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet.description:
罪生怪能通过嗅觉闻到生物所反映出的原罪，此能力在其他方面同灵敏嗅觉。由GM判断哪些生物与哪些原罪相符。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Scent]

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法时获得+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

+4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental.name: 对抗心灵时获得+4状态加值 +4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental

Covetous Claws.name: 贪欲之爪 Covetous Claws
Covetous Claws.description: 贪婪罪生怪士兵在尝试进行 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{卸武 Disarm} 时，获得 +2 状态加值。

Sinful Bite.name: 原罪之噬 Sinful Bite
Sinful Bite.description:
被贪婪罪生怪士兵的颚咬命中的生物必须尝试一次 @Check[will|dc:29] 豁免，因为他们的心智正遭受贪欲思维的侵袭。

大成功 该生物不受影响。

成功 该生物陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}。

失败 该生物陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}。

大失败 该生物陷入恶心 2，且陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2}，持续 1 分钟。

Snatch Up.name: 夺取 Snatch Up
Snatch Up.description:
触发 当贪婪罪生怪士兵在一次 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{卸武 Disarm} 尝试中取得大成功，并将目标手中的一件物品击落时。

效果 贪婪罪生怪在该物品落地前用一只手将其接住。

Lightning Arc.name: Lightning Arc
Lightning Arc.description: (electricity) One creature (other than the peacock phoenix) within 60 feet of the sentry takes @Damage[(3d12+19)[electricity]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic] save). A target wearing metal armor or made of metal takes a –1 circumstance penalty to its save; if damaged, they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 round. A creature may only be targeted once by a lightning arc each round—any lightning arcs that go unused as a result of there not being enough targets instead restore 20 HP each to the peacock phoenix.

Entry Denied.name: Entry Denied
Entry Denied.description:
Trigger The PCs fail the Trial of Runes

Effect Each sentry whose question the PCs answered correctly crashes to the ground. A creature directly below a head when it falls takes @Damage[(6d12+37)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic] save). The 10-foot area beneath the head becomes difficult terrain. The hazard then rolls initiative.

Rune Sentries.name: Rune Sentries
Rune Sentries.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:45] (legendary) to turn the lightning back against the sentry, causing the head to plummet, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th rank; counteract DC 36) to counteract the magic that empowers the sentry, causing it to plummet. Each sentry must be counteracted or destroyed separately.
Rune Sentries.hazarddescription: Arcs of lightning arc flash from the eyes of the floating sentries.
Rune Sentries.routine: (6 actions) Each Rune Sentry grants the hazard 1 action; a Rune Sentry that's plummeted or been disabled or destroyed reduces the hazard's available actions by 1. On the hazard's turn, all active Rune Sentries spend their action to use Lightning Arc.

Undying Myth.description:
Cost all the creature's Mythic Points

Trigger The creature would die and has at least 1 Mythic Point

Effect The creature remains standing and conscious, and recovers 50% of its maximum Hit Points.
Undying Myth.name: Undying Myth

Manifest Runelord's Polearm.name: Manifest Runelord's Polearm
Manifest Runelord's Polearm.description:
Requirements The risen runelord isn't holding a runelord's polearm

Effect The risen runelord causes their runelord's polearm to appear in one of their hands. The exact appearance of the polearm depends on the type wielded by the runelord in life, but these weapons are purely spiritual constructs that inflict mental damage on a Strike and vanish as soon as the risen runelord releases the weapon or dies.

Remove a Condition.name: 移除状态 Remove a Condition
Remove a Condition.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The risen runelord ends one condition affecting them.

Beyond Life.name: Beyond Life
Beyond Life.description: A risen runelord may drink or eat for pleasure or entertainment, but they need not do so for nourishment and never suffer the effects of thirst or starvation.

Mythic Resilience (Reflex and Will).name: Mythic Resilience (Reflex and Will)
Mythic Resilience (Reflex and Will).description: 该怪物将与其相关的豁免成功率比骰掷结果的成功度高一个等级。这不会与其他改变成功度的效果叠加，例如失能特征（自然1或20时除外）。怪物每次获得神话韧性时，可选择一项豁免。该能力应首先应用于该怪物的最高豁免。

Vanishing Death.name: Vanishing Death
Vanishing Death.description: When a risen runelord is slain, their body and (if manifested) polearm vanishes as the trapped legacy that was drawn upon to create them is set free, exploding outward in a riot of swirling color. This release of arcane energy hammers the minds of nearby creatures. All creatures adjacent to a risen runelord during their vanishing death must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 24 hours (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) as fragments of their own memories are temporarily scrambled or hidden. Other objects carried by the risen runelord fall to the ground.

Mythic Power.name: 神话之力 Mythic Power
Mythic Power.description: 该生物拥有 3 点神话点，并可以将这些神话点用于以下任何动作。

Quickened Casting.name: Quickened Casting
Quickened Casting.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect If the risen runelord's next action is to cast a cantrip or spell that's 4th-rank or lower, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

Recharge.name: Recharge
Recharge.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The risen runelord regains an expended spell slot or can use Quickened Casting again.

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt the risen runelord's spellcasting action, the risen runelord attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

Risen Runelord Aethusa II.name: Risen Runelord Aethusa II
Risen Runelord Aethusa II.publicNotes:
Risen runelords are created by a powerful ritual invented by Runelord Xanderghul—a ritual called raise runelord. All risen runelords are at least level 11 creatures. Once created, a risen runelord has no capacity to become more powerful, as they are manifestations of their legacy at a specific point in time (although given enough time and resources, a risen runelord could potentially find a way to overcome this limitation on self-improvement).

A risen runelord has a modicum of free will, but as long as the one who created them via raise runelord lives, they're bound to their creator's desires. A risen runelord ordered to undertake obviously self-destructive actions might, at the GM's discretion, resist the command and could potentially even break free of their creator's control.

Since raise runelord draws upon a runelord's legacy as it exists within the Dreamlands, no risen runelord can ever sleep or dream. Xanderghul can use a risen runelord in a special way: he can use any risen runelord (including ones he didn't create) as a spare body. If he's slain, his soul can instantly jump to the closest risen runelord to replace them and continue the fight, unless the PCs can disable this defense during the second adventure in Revenge of the Runelords. Regardless of level, all risen runelords are mythic creatures and are immune to sleep effects.

Lust and Pride

Of the seven sins, lust and pride are unique among the runelords for these sins were only ever represented by a single runelord—and both still live during the events of this Adventure Path. This may change once the events of Revenge of the Runelords come to a conclusion, in which case the sinful foci for lust and pride become potential options for risen runelords of Sorshen or Xanderghul, but during Revenge of the Runelords, no risen runelords of lust or pride can exist.

Risen Runelord Gear

A risen runelord's polearm is an extension of their being and cannot exist without them, vanishing upon their death. This doesn't prevent a risen runelord from claiming, carrying, or using other items, and most higher-level risen runelords keep real magic items that remain behind after their death.

Air of Delusion.name: Air of Delusion
Air of Delusion.description: 15 feet. False visions and strange shadows dance through the area, obscuring the truth for only Xanderghul to know. A creature that first enters the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:46] save. On a failure, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to Xanderghul whenever it's in the area. On a critical success, the creature is temporarily immune to air of delusion for 1 minute.

Anything You Can Do.name: Anything You Can Do
Anything You Can Do.description:
Trigger A creature Xanderghul is imitating with illusory disguise takes a single action of any type

Effect If the triggering action is a move action, Xanderghul can use the same distance and method to move himself. If the triggering action is a Strike, Xanderghul can attempt a Strike against any foe in reach with his hammer. If the triggering action was any other type of action, Xanderghul mimics that action via a reflexive illusion that confuses onlookers; Anything You Can Do gains the mental and visual traits, and all observers save the duplicated foe become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to Xanderghul until the end of his next turn.

Undying Myth.name: Undying Myth
Undying Myth.description:
Cost all Xanderghul's Mythic Points

Effect When Xanderghul would die, as long as he has at least 1 Mythic Point, he immediately expends all remaining Mythic Points he has, remains standing and conscious, and recovers 50% of his maximum Hit Points.

Ego Boost.name: Ego Boost
Ego Boost.description: When a creature fails to disbelieve one of Xanderghul's illusions, he becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round and can use the extra action to Stride or Stride.

Quickened Casting.name: Quickened Casting
Quickened Casting.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect If Xanderghul's next action is to cast a cantrip or spell that is 8th rank or lower, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

Sovereign of the False.name: Sovereign of the False
Sovereign of the False.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Xanderghul Sustains one spell with the illusion trait.

Vision of Loss.name: Vision of Loss
Vision of Loss.description: The first time in a round that Xanderghul hits a creature with his waking dreams Strike, their mind is clouded by illusory hallucinations and waking dreams of all their triumphs not only being revealed to be failures in the end, but with the conviction that had Xanderghul attempted the same, it would've prevailed. The target must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:49] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 round (or stupefied 2 with an unlimited duration on a critical failure).

equipment-Xanderghul's Flawless Hammer.name: Xanderghul's Flawless Hammer
equipment-Xanderghul's Flawless Hammer.description: A bec de corbin is a spiked polearm that uses a hammer head to help balance the spike. The hammer portion can be used as a secondary striking surface, while the spike or fluke is specially designed to punch through armor and shields.

Remove a Condition.name: 移除状态 Remove a Condition
Remove a Condition.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Xanderghul ends one condition affecting him.

Mythic Resilience (Fortitude and Will).name: Mythic Resilience (Fortitude and Will)
Mythic Resilience (Fortitude and Will).description: 该怪物将与其相关的豁免成功率比骰掷结果的成功度高一个等级。这不会与其他改变成功度的效果叠加，例如失能特征（自然1或20时除外）。怪物每次获得神话韧性时，可选择一项豁免。该能力应首先应用于该怪物的最高豁免。

Sin Counterspell.name: Sin Counterspell
Sin Counterspell.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet casts a spell that creates or changes physical things

Effect Xanderghul attempts to counteract the triggering spell with a [[/r 1d20+42 #Counteract]]{+42} counteract modifier and a counteract rank of 10.

Recharge.name: Recharge
Recharge.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Xanderghul regains a previously cast spell.

Reroll.name: Reroll
Reroll.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Trigger Xanderghul fails a check

Effect Xanderghul rerolls the check.

Shuffle the Deck.name: Shuffle the Deck
Shuffle the Deck.description:
Trigger Xanderghul casts illusory disguise to imitate the appearance of a creature he is adjacent to

Effect Xanderghul and the creature appear to Step several times, exchanging spaces. The target creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:49] save with the following results.

Critical Success The targeted creature may choose which square they Step into, and no other creature is tricked.

Success Xanderghul chooses which square the creature Steps into (which must be a legal space for the creature to occupy, must be able to bear its weight, and cannot be difficult or hazardous terrain), but no other creature is tricked.

Failure As success (but the new space Xanderghul has the target Step into can be difficult or hazardous terrain), but other creatures lose track of who is who. They are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to Xanderghul for 1 round. The next time someone targets either the illusory PC (who is Xanderghul) or the real PC must randomly determine which of the two figures they target.

Critical Failure As failure, but Xanderghul can cause the PC to Step into an area incapable of holding their weight (such as into the swirling mists of Jandelay), and all attempts to target either are randomly determined until the start of Xanderghul's next turn.

Zutha's Legacy.disable: @Check[occultism|dc:45]（传奇）或宗教（传奇）以驱除祖萨的灵魂，或 @Check[intimidation|dc:48]（大师）或 @Check[performance|dc:48]（大师）来讲述祖萨失败的详细经过；总共需要六次成功才能解除该作祟。
Zutha's Legacy.routine: (4 动作) 作祟使用喷吐蛆虫三次，然后使用一次毒气喷吐。每次解除作祟成功时，作祟便失去一个喷吐蛆虫动作。摧毁一个面具也会移除作祟的一个喷吐蛆虫动作。一旦作祟无法再使用喷吐蛆虫，它将立即恢复三个动作，并将喷吐蛆虫替换为幽魂骨镰。摧毁一把骨镰也会移除作祟的一个幽魂骨镰动作。一旦作祟失去所有三个幽魂骨镰动作，作祟将被摧毁。
Zutha's Legacy.reset: 当附近没有活物时，作祟将停止活跃。1小时后，作祟将重置。
Zutha's Legacy.stealthdetails: （专家）以在祖萨饥饿的灵魂显现前就注意到它。

Howl of Rage.name: 愤怒咆哮 Howl of Rage
Howl of Rage.description:
触发 一名活物试图从区域A1a的楼梯井下到小岛内部

效果 祖萨作祟般的脸孔浮现在岛屿上方，同时小岛上的碎石扭曲成较小的祖萨脸孔的样子。这些脸孔一同发出愤怒的咆哮。岛上的所有生物必须成功通过一次 @Check[will|dc:42] 意志豁免，否则将陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}（若大失败则为 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 3}）。随后，作祟骰先攻。

Vomit Maggot.name: 喷吐蛆虫 Vomit Maggot
Vomit Maggot.description: 祖萨的碎石面具之一喷吐出一群蛆虫。（面具出现在小岛各处，被摧毁的面具很快又会重新形成，使得小岛上没有安全之处。）蛆虫会钻入由GM选择的生物体内。该生物受到 @Damage[2d12[persistent,piercing]] 伤害（ @Check[fortitude|dc:42|basic] 豁免），并在持续受到此伤害期间陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}。当持续伤害结束时，蛆虫会溶解成一股恶臭的油。

Spectral Scythe.name: 幽魂骨镰 Spectral Scythe
Spectral Scythe.description:
祖萨的一把骨镰挥向由GM选择的生物。该生物必须尝试 @Check[reflex|dc:42] 豁免，结果如下：

大成功 生物不受影响。

成功 生物受到 @Damage[(3d10+10)[void]] 伤害。

失败 生物受到 @Damage[(6d10+10)[void]] 伤害，并陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1}。

大失败 生物受到 @Damage[(12d10+10)[void]] 伤害，并陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 2}。

Poisonous Belch.name: 毒气喷吐 Poisonous Belch
Poisonous Belch.description:
祖萨面孔的灵魂影像喷吐出一股散发着腐烂肉味的毒云。毒云充满以小岛上任意一处为中心的 @Template[type:burst|distance:10] 范围，并持续到作祟的下一回合。任何进入该区域或在该区域内开始回合的生物必须尝试 @Check[fortitude|dc:44] 豁免，结果如下：

大成功 生物不受影响。

成功 生物受到 @Damage[5d8[poison]|options:area-damage] 伤害。

失败 生物受到 @Damage[10d8[poison]|options:area-damage] 伤害，并陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}。

大失败 生物受到 @Damage[20d8[poison]|options:area-damage] 伤害，陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}，并在恶心状态持续期间陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}。

Zutha's Legacy.name: 祖萨的遗存 Zutha's Legacy
Zutha's Legacy.hazarddescription: 符文领主祖萨怒容满面的脸孔浮现在祭坛上方。与此同时，仿佛面具般的祖萨脸孔在附近的碎石上显现，并喷吐出成群的蛆虫。一旦这些面具被摧毁，空中便充斥着祖萨那吸取生命的骨镰幻影。

Silent Devotee.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. auditory

Untouched by Time.name: Untouched by Time
Untouched by Time.description: Though not undead, silent devotees don't age as most mortal creatures do. They don't eat, drink, sleep, or breathe.

+2 Status to All Saves Vs. Auditory.name: +2 Status to All Saves Vs. Auditory

Quieting Rune.name: Quieting Rune
Quieting Rune.description: The silent devotee marks a creature within 60 feet they can see with a rune of magical silence. The creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:34] saving throw or be affected as if by a 7th-rank silence spell. The rune lasts for 1 minute or until the devotee dies. A creature can be marked with only one Quieting Rune at a time. If the devotee uses this ability again, any previous Quieting Rune they've created ends.

Pall of Silence.name: Pall of Silence
Pall of Silence.description: 10 feet. The silent devotee is surrounded by an aura that suppresses sound, granting the silent devotee resistance to sonic energy and a bonus to all saves against auditory effects. Creatures within the aura can't use sonic attacks, use auditory actions, or Cast a Spell without the subtle trait.

Cruel Sneak Attack.name: Cruel Sneak Attack
Cruel Sneak Attack.description: A silent devotee's Strikes deal and additional 2d6 precision damage to creatures that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} or are taking persistent bleed damage.

Transdimensional Step.name: Transdimensional Step
Transdimensional Step.description: The silent devotee teleports to an unoccupied space within 30 feet.

Silent Devotee.name: Silent Devotee
Silent Devotee.publicNotes:
When the runelords first created the Emerald Chambers, an order of martial spellcasters was established to protect Xin's tomb. Known as the Silent Devotees, members of this order cut out their own eyes and tongues in a gesture intended both to prove their devotion and to ensure that knowledge of the Emerald Chambers would never spread beyond the order. After an initial surge of volunteers, interest in the order waned once the duplicitous nature of the runelords (and rumors of their involvement in Xin's assassination) came to light. Today, only a few dozen silent devotees remain.

The devotees expanded the scope of their mission after the runelords claimed portions of the Emerald Chambers for their personal use. These devotees fitted their empty eye sockets with emeralds magically imbued with the site plans for the Chambers, allowing them to patrol the extradimensional space in its entirety. Combined with the raw magic flowing through the Chambers, the emeralds turned the skin of the devotees a pallid green but also gifted them with a sort of immortality, such that the remaining devotees seem immune to the ravages of time. Today, the Silent Devotees are something more than the humans they once were.

Xin-Hndoros

The most devoted member of the Silent Devotees was surely Xin-Undoros, a loyal champion of Xin and one of the order's first volunteers. Though he predicted Earthfall, Xin-Undoros failed to warn the runelords of the catastrophe, blaming them for the death of his beloved emperor. As punishment for this treachery, Xin-Undoros became a graveknight shortly after the end came. While this transformation returned Xin-Undoros's ability to speak, he still refuses to do so, regarding such an act as a violation of his eternal oath.

Trinity Star.hazarddescription: A blazing comet with three tails—one red, one black, and one with rainbow hues—careens throughout the area.

Starform.name: Starform
Starform.description:
Trigger Dream Aethusa has been dead for 10 minutes

Effect Dream Aethusa's body is consumed with mythic energy, transforming into a comet with three blazing tails. All creatures within 120 feet must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:40] save to resist becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 minute (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} permanently on a critical failure). The hazard then rolls initiative.

Trinity Star.name: Trinity Star
Trinity Star.disable: @Check[athletics|dc:48] (legendary) to grab one of the comet's tails and rip it free; @Check[occultism|dc:45] or @Check[religion|dc:45] (master) to exorcise the divine energy of the red tail (which is infused with Gorum's legacy) or the black tail (infused with the nihilism of Abaddon's Eclipse); @Check[arcana|dc:45] (master) to unweave the magic of the rainbow tail (Xanderghul's mythic power); or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th rank; counteract DC 36) to counteract one of the tails. Each tail must be disabled separately to disable the hazard.
Trinity Star.reset:
(1 action) The Trinity Star flies at a speed of 60 feet, moving through the spaces of as many creatures as possible. Each creature the Trinity Star moves through must make a @Check[reflex|dc:42] save with the following results.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[6d6[force]] damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[11d6[force]] damage and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[22d6[force]] damage, is knocked prone, and if the creature is mythic, they lose 1 Mythic Point. If the Trinity Star has lost any of its tails, it regrows one of them (chosen at random if it's lost two tails).

Quoroc.name: 奎洛克 Quoroc

Compression.name: 压缩 Compression
Compression.description: 巨章鱼在不进行挤入的情况下可以穿过至少2尺宽的裂隙，如果@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]则可以穿过1尺宽的裂隙。

Quoroc Toxin.name: 奎洛克毒液 Quoroc Toxin
Quoroc Toxin.description:
豁免 @Check[fortitude|dc:36]

最大持续时间 6轮

阶段1 @Damage[3d8[poison]] 伤害和 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1}（1轮）

阶段2 @Damage[3d8[poison]] 伤害和 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2}（1轮）

阶段3 @Damage[3d8[poison]] 伤害和 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{麻痹 Paralyzed 1} （1轮）

Quoroc.publicNotes:
巨章鱼在黑暗的深海中出没。它们聪明、适应性强，捕食并吞噬各种动物。尽管巨章鱼最多能长到16尺长，但只要有和它的喙差不多大的缝隙，它就可以压缩自己的身体然后挤过去。

巨型章鱼喜欢把沉船、珊瑚礁或水下洞穴作为巢穴，在那里它们可以利用狭窄的空间来保护自己。就像它们较小的同类一样，它们喜欢用现成的东西来装饰自己的巢穴——对巨章鱼来说，其中许多也是魔法武器、盾牌或从沉船或倒下的冒险家那里打捞出来的艺术品。

Megatsunami.hazarddescription: A tsunami can be a devastating disaster but pales in comparison to the daunting wall of water created by a megatsunami. When a megatsunami begins, ocean water often recedes far away from the shore, much more dramatically than it would during low tide. This warning sign might occur only seconds or minutes before the full force of the megatsunami crashes onto the land in the form of a wave whose height can exceed a hundred feet.
Megatsunami.stealthdetails: @Check[Ocean Lore|dc:36] (expert), @Check[nature|dc:38] (expert), or @Check[survival|dc:40] (master) to notice anomalies in wave patterns
Megatsunami.name: Megatsunami
Megatsunami.disable: @Check[Ocean Lore|dc:36] (expert) or @Check[nature|dc:38] or @Check[survival|dc:38] (master) to chart the flood path, @Check[crafting|dc:38] (master) to reinforce a shelter, or @Check[athletics|dc:40] (expert) to quickly ferry people or supplies to higher ground,
Megatsunami.routine:
(5+ minutes, @Check[flat|dc:18]) The megatsunami's wave overtakes and crushes everything in its path. It rips buildings off their foundations and tears up trees by their roots. Prepared creatures have managed to reach an area of high ground or another form of safety, but unprepared creatures in the area are caught up in the flood and battered by a combination of water and debris.

Unprepared creatures take @Damage[(5d12+30)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:43|basic] save) when the megatsunami hits and are thereafter surrounded by water. If they can't breathe water, they must hold their breath or begin to drown. Each round, a creature can attempt a @Check[athletics|dc:40] check to Swim up near the surface or to keep their head above water for the remainder of the minute once they reach the surface.

At the start of the next four minutes, the megatsunami has carried each unprepared character 250 feet inland. At this time, each unprepared character takes @Damage[(3d12+20)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic] save). A character who managed that minute to remain near the surface gains a result one degree of success better than their actual rolled result, with a critical success indicating they've managed to clamber out of the surge onto high ground and are now prepared.

At the end of the five minutes, attempt a @Check[flat|dc:18] to determine if a new wave repeats the routine. Characters already swept inland only become affected by these following waves once the rushing water reaches them, but until then they can Swim in the choppy floodwaters with a successful @Check[athletics|dc:30] check, potentially reaching safety or high ground before the next wave hits. Once a region is flooded by a megatsunami, it typically remains flooded for several hours.

Pridespawn Sentinel.allSaves: 对抗魔法时的豁免获得+1状态加值；对抗心灵时的豁免获得+4状态加值
Pridespawn Sentinel.name: 傲慢罪生怪守卫 Pridespawn Sentinel
Pridespawn Sentinel.publicNotes:
罪生怪是由被共称为符文领主的七名古代巫师中的一位所创造的——他们每人接纳并呈现出七原罪中的一罪。第一名罪生怪由愤怒符文领主所创造，这源于他对影响并扭曲肉体的技术实践（详见畸肉体）。这种技术在用于创造罪生怪不久之后便落入了其他符文领主手中，之后他们每人都尝试根据自己的设计创造变种，时至今日愤怒罪生怪仍旧是同类中数量最多也最知名的存在。

罪生怪与肉体被重塑的类人原型之间只有极为模糊的相似之处，他们通常看起来骨瘦嶙峋，长着不自然地修长手臂和反关节的腿部，每根肢体末端都长着短粗的爪状指头。凸起的血管遍及罪生怪全身，血红色的凸起仿佛构成了扭曲的符文，其皮肤苍白无毛。他们的头部被拉长，五官只剩下鼻子、红色的双眼、以及从下巴处裂开成两瓣的下颚，其中露出长长的下垂舌头，舌头尖端分成了三根宛若手指的触须。

罪生怪站起来有6.5尺，体重与同体型的人类相仿。罪生怪的行为模式与和其相关联的原罪有关，他们的体貌特征也会对此有所暗示。举例说明，贪婪罪生怪的血管里流淌的是金色的液体，而嫉妒罪生怪比其他类型的罪生怪更加瘦弱。

Sin Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: 嗅探原罪（模糊感官） 30尺 Sin Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet
Sin Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet.description:
罪生怪能通过嗅觉闻到生物所反映出的原罪，此能力在其他方面同灵敏嗅觉。由GM判断哪些生物与哪些原罪相符。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Scent]

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法时的豁免获得+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

+4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental.name: 对抗心灵时的豁免获得+4状态加值 +4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental

Hallucinatory Backlash.name: 幻景反噬 Hallucinatory Backlash
Hallucinatory Backlash.description:
触发 当傲慢罪生怪受到来自某生物武器打击的伤害时

效果 傲慢罪生怪回击伤害它的敌人的傲慢，并对攻击嗤之以鼻。触发该效果的生物会产生幻觉，仿佛自己发出的攻击正反噬自身，并承受 @Damage[4d6[mental]] 伤害(@Check[will|dc:32|basic] 豁免).

False Pride.name: 虚假傲慢 False Pride
False Pride.description:
傲慢罪生怪守卫踉跄后退，在距它30尺内可见的某个生物面前，表现出惊惧和被威吓的样子。目标生物必须进行一次 @Check[will|dc:32] 豁免；无论结果如何，该生物在24小时内对虚假傲慢暂时免疫。

大成功 该生物不受影响。

成功 该生物变得过度自信和粗心大意，因为他们认为自己比实际上更具威慑力。对本轮中该傲慢罪生怪守卫尝试对该生物发动的下一次攻击，该生物将陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Off-Guard}。

失败 与成功相同，但该生物的虚假傲慢会让他们在1轮内陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}，因为他们会花一个动作摆姿势并吹嘘自己的优越性。只要他们仍处于缓慢状态，就会一直处于措手不及。

大失败 与失败相同，但持续时间为1分钟。

Sinful Bite.name: 原罪之噬 Sinful Bite
Sinful Bite.description:
被傲慢罪生怪守卫的颚命中的生物必须尝试一次 @Check[will|dc:29] 豁免，因为他们的心智被充满傲慢的思维所侵袭。

大成功 该生物不受影响。

成功 该生物陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}。

失败 该生物陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}。

大失败 该生物陷入恶心2，且同时陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1} 和 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 1}，持续1分钟。

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: 傲慢罪生怪守卫对处于 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg] 状态的生物额外造成1d6点精准伤害。

Remove a Condition.name: 移除状态 Remove a Condition
Remove a Condition.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The risen runelord ends one condition affecting them.

Beyond Life.name: Beyond Life
Beyond Life.description: A risen runelord may drink or eat for pleasure or entertainment, but they need not do so for nourishment and never suffer the effects of thirst or starvation.

Chromatic Aegis.name: Chromatic Aegis
Chromatic Aegis.description:
Cost all of Karzoug's Mythic Points

Requirements Aethusa's Prison hazard hasn't been destroyed

Trigger Karzoug would die and has at least 1 Mythic Point

Effect Karzoug uses his dying breath to destroy Aethusa's prison and wrap himself in the remnants of its magical energy. Karzoug remains standing and conscious, and he recovers @Damage[166[healing]] Hit Points. He becomes immune to the type of elemental damage the prison was focused on when Karzoug used this ability. At the end of Risen Runelord Karzoug's next turn, he vanishes entirely, reappearing somewhere distant in the Universe. His gear (his chromatic robe and the slate of distant letters) remains behind. While the risen runelord no longer takes part in this Adventure Path, he might, at your discretion, rise again in a future campaign of your design. This ability replaces the Undying Myth ability most mythic creatures of this level have.

Manifest Runelord's Polearm.name: Manifest Runelord's Polearm
Manifest Runelord's Polearm.description:
Requirements The risen runelord isn't holding a runelord's polearm

Effect The risen runelord causes their runelord's polearm to appear in one of their hands. The exact appearance of the polearm depends on the type wielded by the runelord in life, but these weapons are purely spiritual constructs that inflict mental damage on a Strike and vanish as soon as the risen runelord releases the weapon or dies.

Mythic Resilience (Reflex and Will).name: Mythic Resilience (Reflex and Will)
Mythic Resilience (Reflex and Will).description: 该怪物将与其相关的豁免成功率比骰掷结果的成功度高一个等级。这不会与其他改变成功度的效果叠加，例如失能特征（自然1或20时除外）。怪物每次获得神话韧性时，可选择一项豁免。该能力应首先应用于该怪物的最高豁免。

Vanishing Death.name: Vanishing Death
Vanishing Death.description:
When a risen runelord is slain, their body and (if manifested) polearm vanishes as the trapped legacy that was drawn upon to create them is set free, exploding outward in a riot of swirling color. This release of arcane energy hammers the minds of nearby creatures. All creatures adjacent to a risen runelord during their vanishing death must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:37] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 24 hours (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) as fragments of their own memories are temporarily scrambled or hidden. Other objects carried by the risen runelord fall to the ground.

This ability only occurs if Chromatic Aegis does not.

Mythic Power.name: 神话之力 Mythic Power
Mythic Power.description: 该生物拥有 3 点神话点，并可以将这些神话点用于以下任何动作。

Quickened Casting.name: Quickened Casting
Quickened Casting.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect If the risen runelord's next action is to cast a cantrip or spell that's 4th-rank or lower, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

Recharge.name: Recharge
Recharge.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The risen runelord regains an expended spell slot or can use Quickened Casting again.

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt the risen runelord's spellcasting action, the risen runelord attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

Risen Runelord Karzoug.name: Risen Runelord Karzoug
Risen Runelord Karzoug.publicNotes:
Risen runelords are created by a powerful ritual invented by Runelord Xanderghul—a ritual called raise runelord. All risen runelords are at least level 11 creatures. Once created, a risen runelord has no capacity to become more powerful, as they are manifestations of their legacy at a specific point in time (although given enough time and resources, a risen runelord could potentially find a way to overcome this limitation on self-improvement).

A risen runelord has a modicum of free will, but as long as the one who created them via raise runelord lives, they're bound to their creator's desires. A risen runelord ordered to undertake obviously self-destructive actions might, at the GM's discretion, resist the command and could potentially even break free of their creator's control.

Since raise runelord draws upon a runelord's legacy as it exists within the Dreamlands, no risen runelord can ever sleep or dream. Xanderghul can use a risen runelord in a special way: he can use any risen runelord (including ones he didn't create) as a spare body. If he's slain, his soul can instantly jump to the closest risen runelord to replace them and continue the fight, unless the PCs can disable this defense during the second adventure in Revenge of the Runelords. Regardless of level, all risen runelords are mythic creatures and are immune to sleep effects.

Lust and Pride

Of the seven sins, lust and pride are unique among the runelords for these sins were only ever represented by a single runelord—and both still live during the events of this Adventure Path. This may change once the events of Revenge of the Runelords come to a conclusion, in which case the sinful foci for lust and pride become potential options for risen runelords of Sorshen or Xanderghul, but during Revenge of the Runelords, no risen runelords of lust or pride can exist.

Risen Runelord Gear

A risen runelord's polearm is an extension of their being and cannot exist without them, vanishing upon their death. This doesn't prevent a risen runelord from claiming, carrying, or using other items, and most higher-level risen runelords keep real magic items that remain behind after their death.

Vesinra.name: 维辛拉 Vesinra

Falchion Swipe.name: 弯刃大刀横扫 Falchion Swipe
Falchion Swipe.description: 维辛拉对触及范围内的每个敌人发动一次弯刃大刀攻击。每次攻击都计算多重攻击减值，但直到所有攻击都结束之后减值才增加。她伤害的第一个敌人将暴露在维辛拉之爱抚的影响下。

Vesinra's Caress.name: 维辛拉之爱抚 Vesinra's Caress
Vesinra's Caress.description: 维辛拉触碰一个生物，该生物必须通过一次@Check[will|dc:30]豁免，否则将陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 2}。如果目标对此能力的豁免再次失败，则该状态值增加2（最大达到@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 4}）。此状态值每24小时减少1。

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的所有豁免有+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
拉米亚女族长可以变成中型类人生物的外观。但这不会改变它的速度或打击时的攻击加值、伤害加值，但它们此时无法通过接触来施加诅咒。每个拉米亚女族长都有一个固定的类人生物外观，类似于她们真实形态的上半身。这是她们使用这种能力所能采取的唯一人形外观。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Vesinra.publicNotes:
杰出而强大的拉米亚女族长拥有无限的野心，总是寻求将更多的人和领地纳入它们的家族。它们自然而然地成为了其他拉米亚的统治者。由于它们对其他生物残忍行径，让它们成为了其他拉米亚的凶残保护者，因此它们很适合作为了邪教或站帮的领袖。无论性别如何，这些晋升的拉米亚都被称为拉米亚女族长。它们各自追求着不同的异能力量，其中一些甚至有宏大的计划试图打破改变它们的动物化诅咒。然而到目前为止这些尝试都失败了。

拉米亚是某种古老诅咒的嗜血受害者，他们将此归咎于神罚。大多数拉米亚从腰部以上是人形，但是下半身是蛇。拉米亚来天生就擅长阴毒的魔法，他们更喜欢使用幻觉来欺骗猎物供以后食用，或者只是为了折磨。
Vesinra.allSaves: 对抗魔法的所有豁免有+1状态加值
Vesinra.blurb: 变体精英拉米亚女族长

Past Lives.name: Past Lives
Past Lives.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Aethusa accesses what she believes to be the memories of two previous runelords. For the next 1 minute, whenever Aethusa makes a skill check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge}, she rolls three times and uses the highest result.

Adaptive Rune Magic.name: Adaptive Rune Magic
Adaptive Rune Magic.description:
Frequency once per round

Trigger Aethusa Casts a Spell of 6th rank or higher

Effect Aethusa momentarily infuses her preferred form of sin magic (sloth) with the power of either gluttony or greed magic. The triggering spell slot is expended, but instead of the spell's normal effects, Aethusa casts either @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dN8QBNuTiaBHCKUe]{Cursed Metamorphosis} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.fd31tAHSSGXyOxW6]{Vampiric Exsanguination} at 6th rank.

Quickened Casting.name: Quickened Casting
Quickened Casting.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect If Aethusa's next action is to cast a cantrip or a spell that is 6th rank or lower, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt Aethusa's spellcasting action, she attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

Crumbling Stairs.name: Crumbling Stairs
Crumbling Stairs.description:
A stretch of stairs crumbles, dropping into the void at the bottom of the stairwell. The first time the trap takes this action, the upper third of the stairwell collapses. The second time, the middle third collapses. The third time, the entire stairwell collapses. A creature on a collapsing section of stairs can try to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} with a @Check[reflex|dc:40] save to avoid falling into the void. Flying creatures avoid the fall automatically but might tumble into the void anyway if their slowed condition prevents them from taking the Fly action on their turn.

Though it appears to stretch forever, the void at the bottom of the stairwell functions as a portal to the Crypt of Sloth. Creatures who plummet into the void experience a fall that seems to take hours, but are eventually deposited in the middle of area B10, taking @Damage[80[bludgeoning]] damage from the fall.

Collapse.name: Collapse
Collapse.description:
Trigger A creature inspects the wall at the top of the stairs or begins to descend the stairs after reaching the top

Effect The floor at the bottom of the stairwell disappears, revealing a seemingly bottomless pit. Meanwhile, the stairwell begins to collapse, starting from the top and working its way down. Any PC standing on the lower few steps falls into the pit unless they Grab the Edge with a successful @Check[reflex|dc:40] save. The trap then rolls initiative.

Leaden Limbs.name: Leaden Limbs
Leaden Limbs.description:
The trap drains vigor from creatures in the stairwell, making their limbs feel as heavy as lead. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:40] saving throw with the following results.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of their next turn.

Failure The creature's clumsy condition value increases by 1, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 4}. The creature is slowed 1 as long as they remain clumsy. The clumsy condition ends as soon as the creature exits the stairwell.

Critical Failure As failure, but the value increases by 2, and the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2}.

Slothful Stairs.name: Slothful Stairs
Slothful Stairs.disable: @Check[athletics|dc:45] (legendary) to wedge crumbling stones into cracks to jam the collapsing stairs, @Check[thievery|dc:48] (master) to deface the hidden magical runes that power the trap; or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th rank, counteract DC 36) to counteract a rune; three total successes are required to disable the trap
Slothful Stairs.hazarddescription: A supernatural exhaustion fills creatures who climb the stairs.
Slothful Stairs.routine: (2 actions) The haunt uses Leaden Limbs once, then Crumbling Stairs once.
Slothful Stairs.reset: The trap continues taking Leaden Limbs actions (and the void at the bottom of the stairwell remains open) for as long as creatures remain in the area. Once no creatures remain, the stairwell rebuilds itself, the void closes, and the trap resets.

Risen Runelord Haphrama.name: Risen Runelord Haphrama
Risen Runelord Haphrama.publicNotes:
Risen runelords are created by a powerful ritual invented by Runelord Xanderghul—a ritual called raise runelord. All risen runelords are at least level 11 creatures. Once created, a risen runelord has no capacity to become more powerful, as they are manifestations of their legacy at a specific point in time (although given enough time and resources, a risen runelord could potentially find a way to overcome this limitation on self-improvement).

A risen runelord has a modicum of free will, but as long as the one who created them via raise runelord lives, they're bound to their creator's desires. A risen runelord ordered to undertake obviously self-destructive actions might, at the GM's discretion, resist the command and could potentially even break free of their creator's control.

Since raise runelord draws upon a runelord's legacy as it exists within the Dreamlands, no risen runelord can ever sleep or dream. Xanderghul can use a risen runelord in a special way: he can use any risen runelord (including ones he didn't create) as a spare body. If he's slain, his soul can instantly jump to the closest risen runelord to replace them and continue the fight, unless the PCs can disable this defense during the second adventure in Revenge of the Runelords. Regardless of level, all risen runelords are mythic creatures and are immune to sleep effects.

Lust and Pride

Of the seven sins, lust and pride are unique among the runelords for these sins were only ever represented by a single runelord—and both still live during the events of this Adventure Path. This may change once the events of Revenge of the Runelords come to a conclusion, in which case the sinful foci for lust and pride become potential options for risen runelords of Sorshen or Xanderghul, but during Revenge of the Runelords, no risen runelords of lust or pride can exist.

Risen Runelord Gear

A risen runelord's polearm is an extension of their being and cannot exist without them, vanishing upon their death. This doesn't prevent a risen runelord from claiming, carrying, or using other items, and most higher-level risen runelords keep real magic items that remain behind after their death.

Remove a Condition.name: 移除状态 Remove a Condition
Remove a Condition.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The risen runelord ends one condition affecting them.

Beyond Life.name: Beyond Life
Beyond Life.description: A risen runelord may drink or eat for pleasure or entertainment, but they need not do so for nourishment and never suffer the effects of thirst or starvation.

Mythic Resilience (Will).name: Mythic Resilience (Will)
Mythic Resilience (Will).description: 该怪物将与其相关的豁免成功率比骰掷结果的成功度高一个等级。这不会与其他改变成功度的效果叠加，例如失能特征（自然1或20时除外）。怪物每次获得神话韧性时，可选择一项豁免。该能力应首先应用于该怪物的最高豁免。

Vanishing Death.name: Vanishing Death
Vanishing Death.description: When a risen runelord is slain, their body and (if manifested) polearm vanishes as the trapped legacy that was drawn upon to create them is set free, exploding outward in a riot of swirling color. This release of arcane energy blasts at the minds of nearby creatures. All creatures adjacent to a risen runelord during a Vanishing Death must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:34] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 24 hours (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) as fragments of their own memories are temporarily scrambled or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}. Other objects carried by the risen runelord fall to the ground.

Manifest Runelord's Polearm.name: Manifest Runelord's Polearm
Manifest Runelord's Polearm.description:
Requirements The risen runelord isn't holding a runelord's polearm

Effect The risen runelord causes their runelord's polearm to appear in one of their hands. The exact appearance of the polearm depends on the type wielded by the runelord in life, but these weapons are purely spiritual constructs that inflict mental damage on a Strike and vanish as soon as the risen runelord releases the weapon or dies.

Mythic Power.name: 神话之力 Mythic Power
Mythic Power.description: 该生物拥有 3 点神话点，并可以将这些神话点用于以下任何动作。

Quickened Casting.name: Quickened Casting
Quickened Casting.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect If the risen runelord's next action is to cast a cantrip or spell that's 4th-rank or lower, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

Recharge.name: Recharge
Recharge.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The risen runelord regains an expended spell slot or can use Quickened Casting again.

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt the risen runelord's spellcasting action, the risen runelord attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

Undying Myth.name: Undying Myth
Undying Myth.description:
Cost all of Areelu's Mythic Points

Trigger Areelu would die and has at least 1 Mythic Point

Effect Areelu remains standing and conscious and recovers @Damage[200[healing]] Hit Points.

equipment-Dagger.name: Dagger
equipment-Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

Remove a Condition.name: 移除状态 Remove a Condition
Remove a Condition.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Areelu ends one condition affecting her.

Mythic Resilience (Fortitude and Will).name: Mythic Resilience (Fortitude and Will)
Mythic Resilience (Fortitude and Will).description: 该怪物将与其相关的豁免成功率比骰掷结果的成功度高一个等级。这不会与其他改变成功度的效果叠加，例如失能特征（自然1或20时除外）。怪物每次获得神话韧性时，可选择一项豁免。该能力应首先应用于该怪物的最高豁免。

Rejection Vulnerability.name: Rejection Vulnerability
Rejection Vulnerability.description: Areelu Vorlesh's apotheosis into a demon has made her vulnerable to rejection like a succubus. When Areelu fails a Deception check to Embrace or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ewwCglB7XOPLUz72]{Lie}, or when a creature succeeds at its save against her mental spells or abilities, she takes @Damage[6d6[mental]] damage. For 1 hour after causing mental damage to Areelu in this way, the creature can deal @Damage[6d6[mental]] damage to her with a successful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} action incorporating its rejection.

Embrace.name: Embrace
Embrace.description: Areelu attempts to [[/act grapple skill=deception]] a creature using her Deception bonus instead of Athletics. If the creature is willing, Areelu automatically succeeds.

Kiss of Locusts.name: Kiss of Locusts
Kiss of Locusts.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Areelu engages a creature she has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in an embrace or other act of passion, creating an opportunity for a cloud of locusts to enter the creature's body. The creature takes @Damage[5d6[persistent,bleed]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for as long as they remain sickened.

Recharge.name: Recharge
Recharge.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Areelu regains an expended spell slot.

Reroll.name: Reroll
Reroll.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Trigger Areelu fails a check

Effect Areelu rerolls the check.

The Gullet.reset: Once the weight in the eastern end of the hallway is removed, the ramp rises back to its original position and the trap immediately resets.
The Gullet.stealthdetails: (master) to notice the hallway is constructed to tilt on a hinge point halfway down its length

See-saw.name: See-saw
See-saw.description:
Trigger The number of PCs in the eastern half of the hallway equals or exceeds the number in the western half

Effect The eastern side of the hallway floor tilts at a 45-degree angle, its end descending. Any creature standing in this section of the hall must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:43] save to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge}. On a failure, the creature falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, tumbles eastward down the length of the ramp, and falls 30 feet into a chamber beneath the hall (area B4b), taking @Damage[(3d12+15)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:43|basic] save). A PC within 10 feet of the hallway's eastern end when it tilts can instead attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:40] save to scramble into area B5. A PC who fails this check instead tumbles and rolls all the way down the steeply sloped ramp before plummeting into area B4b.

The Gullet.name: The Gullet
The Gullet.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:43] (expert) to jam the hallway so it can't tilt; a character who succeeds at a @Check[acrobatics|dc:46] or @Check[athletics|dc:46] check can balance or sprint the length of the hallway before it has a chance to tilt. Flying creatures and Tiny creatures don't trigger the trap. Creative solutions (such as loading the hallway's western half with an appropriate counterweight) might also disable the trap.
The Gullet.hazarddescription: Images of excessive feasts decorate the walls of the hallway.

Cavern Dependent.name: Cavern Dependent
Cavern Dependent.description: An erzgeist is bonded to a single cavern or complex of underground tunnels (such as the Prosperity Vault in this adventure) and must remain within them (or within their walls). If the erzgeist moves outside their bonded caverns, they're immediately destroyed.

Fey Avenger.name: Fey Avenger
Fey Avenger.description: Even when a fey creature doesn't want their aid or finds their nature unsettling, an erzgeist is eager to inflict pain on anyone in return for perceived injustices to fey creatures. As long as an erzgeist is within 30 feet of a fey creature that's suffering from a negative condition, the erzgeist gains a +2 status bonus to all attack rolls.

Aurify.name: Aurify
Aurify.description: The touch of an erzgeist transforms flesh into gold. When a living creature is damaged by the erzgeist's gilded hand Strike, that creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:41] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} on a critical failure) for 1 minute. Further failed saves against aurify increase the clumsy condition. Once a creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 5}, they become petrified, except they're transformed into gold instead of stone for 24 hours, after which the creature (or any gold harvested from it) crumbles to worthless dust and dies.

Erzgeist.name: Erzgeist
Erzgeist.publicNotes:
Verdorites don't rise from the unquiet spirits of humanoids, or even from the souls of sapient creatures at all. Instead, these vengeful undead manifest when disaster befalls the natural world. When enough life is lost, be it plant or animal life, those anguished souls can accrete into a singularity of sorts—a verdorite.

While many verdorites rose in the aftermath of Earthfall, one type of these brutal spirits was already well-established in the heartland of the nation of Shalast—the erzgeist. First spawned in response to the devastation wreaked on the underground environments of the central Storval Plateau by Runelord Kaladurnae's greed, these creatures persist today in various parts of north-central Varisia—particularly in the region surrounding Spindlehorn.

Erzgeists look like large bats, but they're ghostly and semitransparent. Instead of fur, their bodies show growths of crystals and jagged shards of rock shot through with gold ore—all of it shimmering and phantasmal. Their eyes are glittering rubies, the membrane in their wings is like pale gold smoke, and their teeth and fangs are made of gold—all reflections of one man's environment-destroying greed.

An Erzgeist's Anger

Erzgeists often latch onto specific examples of mortal cruelty against the natural world—but in particular, cruelty against fey. While they aren't and never were from the First World, they're drawn to the pains of tormented fey—not to seek their release, but to lie in wait for others who might be drawn to the same torments. Even those who seek to free the tormented fey find themselves targets of erzgeists' anger.

Soul-Melting Breath.name: Soul-Melting Breath
Soul-Melting Breath.description: Lythazossa expels a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] of ghostly acid that melts a creature's very soul, dealing @Damage[20d6[spirit]|options:area-damage] damage to creatures in the area (@Check[will|dc:42|basic] save). The ghostly acid also saps the life from affected creatures. At the beginning of Lythazossa's next turn, each creature that failed the Reflex save must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:42] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} on a critical failure). Lythazossa can't use Soul-Melting Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Soul-Melting Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Remove a Condition.name: 移除状态 Remove a Condition
Remove a Condition.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Lythazossa ends one condition affecting her.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Mythic Resilience (Reflex).name: Mythic Resilience (Reflex)
Mythic Resilience (Reflex).description: 该怪物将与其相关的豁免成功率比骰掷结果的成功度高一个等级。这不会与其他改变成功度的效果叠加，例如失能特征（自然1或20时除外）。怪物每次获得神话韧性时，可选择一项豁免。该能力应首先应用于该怪物的最高豁免。

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: When Lythazossa is destroyed, she re-forms after [[/gmr 2d4 #days]]{2d4 days} in the Prosperity Vault, fully healed. She can be permanently destroyed if the apocalypse seed is removed from Varisia.

Undying Myth.name: Undying Myth
Undying Myth.description:
Cost all of Lythazossa's Mythic Points

Trigger Lythazossa would be destroyed and has at least 1 Mythic Point

Effect Lythazossa remains active, and recovers @Damage[140[healing]] Hit Points.

Calamitous Roar.name: Calamitous Roar
Calamitous Roar.description:
Lythazossa laments her cursed fate. Each living creature within 30 feet attempts a @Check[will|dc:42] save with the following results.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Calamitous Roar for 1 minute.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}

Critical Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}

Recharge.name: Recharge
Recharge.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Lythazossa can use Soul-Melting Breath again.

Reroll.name: Reroll
Reroll.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Trigger Lythazossa fails a check

Effect Lythazossa rerolls the check.

Telekinetic Assault.name: Telekinetic Assault
Telekinetic Assault.description: Lythazossa cries out in pain and anguish, hurling small objects and debris is a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. Creatures in the area take @Damage[10d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic] save).

Vestige of an Ancient Curse.name: Vestige of an Ancient Curse
Vestige of an Ancient Curse.description: When Lythazossa hits a creature with her jaws Strike, the target must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:42] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} until Lythazossa's spirit is put to rest. If the target critically fails this saving throw, Lythazossa regains 40 HP, and the target is instead @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3}.

Lythazossa.name: Lythazossa
Lythazossa.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Bespell Strikes.name: 附法打击 Bespell Strikes
Bespell Strikes.description:
频率 每回合一次

需求 信徒最近一个动作是施放一个非戏法的法术

效果 信徒将法术能量虹吸并注入他们的鸦喙中。直到其回合结束，该武器造成额外的 1d6 力场伤害，并获得奥术特征。

Counterspell.name: 法术反制
Counterspell.description:
触发 一个生物施放信徒已准备的法术

效果 信徒消耗一个已准备的法术位，以反制触发生物对该相同法术的施法。信徒失去该法术位，就如同他已经施放了该触发法术一般。随后，信徒尝试反制该触发法术。

Trinity Initiate.name: 三位一体信徒 Trinity Initiate

Beacon of Jandelay.description: The watcher spends 10 minutes erecting a glowing spire of pale yellow energy, marking an important site destined for an apocalypse for collection and preservation in the Apocalypse Archive. Whenever a watcher uses a teleportation effect to reach a Beacon of Jandelay, they don't need a locus and always arrive on target. A watcher can create a Beacon of Jandelay even while Out of Phase. If the watcher creates a new beacon, any previous Beacon of Jandelay they created vanishes.
Beacon of Jandelay.name: Beacon of Jandelay

Mythic Ritualist.name: Mythic Ritualist
Mythic Ritualist.description: Although a watcher isn't a mythic creature, when they cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4ddJSjC9Zz5DX0oG]{Freedom} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2CNqkt2s2IYkVnv6]{Imprisonment}, they attempt Occultism checks at mythic proficiency, and roll those checks twice and take the better of the two results.

Out of Phase.name: Out of Phase
Out of Phase.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The watcher shifts themself out to desynchronize with reality, allowing them to observe a world without becoming caught in the world's events (including any apocalypses). While Out of Phase, the watcher is invulnerable to all damage and can't be targeted or affected by anything for 1 round, but they can't cast spells, activate items, or use actions that have the attack or manipulate trait. A watcher can Sustain this activity as long as they wish and automatically phases back in at the end of a turn in which they don't do so. A watcher can also Dismiss this activity as free action at the beginning of their turn.

Apocalyptic Knowledge.name: Apocalyptic Knowledge
Apocalyptic Knowledge.description: A watcher can attempt a Jandelay Lore check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} about any world that has been destroyed or is on the precipice of destruction.

Speechless.name: Speechless
Speechless.description: A watcher can't speak aloud and must use writing, telepathy, or other methods to communicate.

Inconspicuous Mien.name: Inconspicuous Mien
Inconspicuous Mien.description: Despite their size, a watcher's role as an uninvolved observer of the Great Beyond causes most creatures to overlook and ignore them. A watcher is always undetected, and a creature must deliberately @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} to perceive them unless it succeeds at a @Check[will|dc:45] saving throw to perceive the watcher (usually as a free action at the start of an encounter). The watcher is automatically perceived by a creature they interact with, such as by attacking the creature or targeting it with a spell or effect.

Stabilization Vulnerability.name: Stabilization Vulnerability
Stabilization Vulnerability.description: Whenever a watcher's teleportation effect is counteracted as it's being activated, they become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Torn from Time.name: Torn from Time
Torn from Time.description:
Frequency once per round

Trigger The watcher's last action was to damage a creature with their talon Strike

Effect The creature's body grows numb, and it loses control of its muscles, entering a form of temporal hibernation. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:45] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is slowed 1 with an unlimited duration and must attempt a @Check[will|dc:45] save at the end of each of its turns. On a failed save, its slowed condition value increases by 1 (or by 2 on a critical failure). A successful save reduces the slowed condition value by 1 (or by 2 on a critical success); the effect ends if this reduces the value to 0. A creature unable to act due to the slowed condition from Torn from Time becomes permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} and enters a state of suspended animation in which they don't age or require food or drink. A creature in this form of stasis remains aware of its surroundings and the passage of time, and if left in this state long enough, it might suffer extensive mental trauma at the GM's discretion.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature is initially @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2}.

Watcher.name: Watcher
Watcher.publicNotes:
Watchers lurk in the shadows of the Universe, witnessing as history unfolds around them across space and time. They come to worlds on the brink of destruction, recording these worlds' fates and cataloguing apocalyptic events for eternal enshrinement in their massive archives of Jandelay. Watchers usually perform this work unseen, slipping into the background of a plane so they can set their strange beacons undisturbed and secretly place creatures into stasis for transport back to their archives.

Though they concern themselves with calamities and apocalyptic events, the watchers have no desire to see a world end before its time. They're attracted to the actions of mortal heroes who defy fate and work to avert disasters, and they only rarely intervene to preserve an appointed apocalypse from being stalled by these heroes, often content to witness and record the curious heroics.

When faced with unusual news or threats to Jandelay, watchers congregate into small councils to discuss and consider. These councils typically number no more than five watchers, with one watcher designated as the council's observer, recording and remembering the meetings. Watcher councils are patient and deliberate, slow to reach any decisions, but once they reach a conclusion, there's always a unanimous consensus.

Watchers have six long, slick insectile legs and stand approximately 30 feet tall. Small, prehensile filaments hide within their talons, which allow the watchers to achieve an astonishing degree of manual precision.

Many watchers hold an almost religious reverence for the cycle of preservation and destruction that emerges between themselves and the Oliphaunt of Jandelay. This dualistic belief in that which is eternal and that which is lost is commonly interpreted as a faith that deifies both the Oliphaunt and a mysterious First Watcher as demigods of Jandelay. The watchers are often seen alongside the Oliphaunt when it rampages across the Universe, and whether they truly see it as a god, a colleague, or merely a necessary planar phenomenon, the truth of their relationship might simply defy mortal categorization and understanding.

Creation and Destruction

The watchers share Jandelay's fields with the Oliphaunt, herald of the apocalypse, a gargantuan beast that visits worlds on the eve of their annihilation to wreak havoc and destruction. Few scholars can agree if the watchers reach a doomed world first, creating beacons that call the Oliphaunt, or if the Oliphaunt instinctively knows when a world is on the brink of calamity and the watchers follow it as their apocalyptic guide.

Fending Off the Watchers

The Beacons of Jandelay, towers of energy erected by watchers to mark worlds on the eve of their apocalypse, are a terrifying sight for those who recognize their significance. Though the watchers are commonly understood as mere observers and recorders, some scholars theorize the watchers call the Oliphaunt from Jandelay themselves only after erecting their beacons and preparing to record the ensuing calamity. By repelling the watchers and destroying their beacons (which have AC 48, Hardness 40, and 380 HP) or countering the beacons with an effect like dispel magic, these scholars believe doomed worlds can be snatched from the jaws of ruin.

Wide Swing.name: Wide Swing
Wide Swing.description: Czaresia makes a single mace Strike and compares the attack roll result to the ACs of up to two foes within her reach. This counts as two attacks for Czaresia's multiple attack penalty.

Reactive Strike (Special).name: Reactive Strike (Special)
Reactive Strike (Special).description:
The rune giant gains an additional reaction at the beginning of each of their turns that they can use only for a Reactive Strike.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ReactiveStrike]

Command Giants.name: Command Giants
Command Giants.description: When Czaresia casts a mental spell against another giant, the DC is 41, rather than 37.

Demand.name: Demand
Demand.description: When a rune giant casts their innate @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.R9xqCBblkS5KE4y7]{Sending} spell, they can also cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qwlh6aDgi86U3Q7H]{Suggestion} on the target.

Flashing Runes.name: Flashing Runes
Flashing Runes.description:
Trigger The rune giant uses an arcane ability or casts an arcane spell

Effect The runes on the giant's body flash with magical energy. Each creature within a @Template[emanation|distance:10] must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:40] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

Invoke Rune.name: Invoke Rune
Invoke Rune.description:
The rune giant invokes one of the runes on their body, causing the rune to spray forth a @Template[cone|distance:30] of sparks that deals @Damage[6d12[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage to all creatures in the cone (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic|options:area-effect] save).

The giant can't use Invoke Rune again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Invoke Rune]]{1d4 rounds}.

A glowing copy of the invoked rune appears on a single weapon the giant holds, granting the weapon one effect listed below of the giant's choice. The effect on the weapon lasts for 1 minute. If the giant places a new rune on a weapon, any previously placed rune immediately vanishes, ending its effect.

Rune of Pride (emotion, fear, mental) A creature struck by the weapon becomes convinced they fight an unconquerable foe. The creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:40] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}. On a critical failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} and can't take hostile actions against Czaresia for as long as they remain frightened.

Czaresia.name: Czaresia
Czaresia.publicNotes:
Rune giants are tyrants among their own kind, given power to command and magically control other giants. They once served even more powerful masters—potent wizards known as runelords—and in so doing, commanded entire armies of giants in service to the runelords' empires.

In the eons since these empires collapsed, rune giants have persisted, though to the outside world they're little more than fabled horrors. Rune giants usually dwell in the most remote and rugged of towering mountain ranges, but they can also be found in immense ruins atop lost islands, glacial valleys, or even more remote or magical regions.

Dozens of runes decorate rune giants' striking charcoal flesh. They are towering creatures, averaging at 40 feet in height and weighing 25,000 pounds.

Giants are massive humanoid creatures who live in remote regions throughout the world. They vary widely but are united in their hunger, requiring sustenance of their own element along with the feasts one would expect from such a massive humanoid. Although a simple matter for some giants, more esoteric types find this need a harsh reality. While a massive fistful of ice or snow alongside their meal will satisfy a frost giant, shadow giants hunger for the coagulated shadows of the Netherworld.

Beyond Life.description: A risen runelord may drink or eat for pleasure or entertainment, but they need not do so for nourishment and never suffer the effects of thirst or starvation.
Beyond Life.name: Beyond Life

Remove a Condition.name: 移除状态 Remove a Condition
Remove a Condition.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The risen runelord ends one condition affecting them.

Mythic Resilience (Will).name: Mythic Resilience (Will)
Mythic Resilience (Will).description: 该怪物将与其相关的豁免成功率比骰掷结果的成功度高一个等级。这不会与其他改变成功度的效果叠加，例如失能特征（自然1或20时除外）。怪物每次获得神话韧性时，可选择一项豁免。该能力应首先应用于该怪物的最高豁免。

Vanishing Death.name: Vanishing Death
Vanishing Death.description: When a risen runelord is slain, their body and (if manifested) polearm vanishes as the trapped legacy that was drawn upon to create them is set free, exploding outward in a riot of swirling color. This release of arcane energy hammers the minds of nearby creatures. All creatures adjacent to a risen runelord during their vanishing death must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 24 hours (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) as fragments of their own memories are temporarily scrambled or hidden. Other objects carried by the risen runelord fall to the ground.

Manifest Runelord's Polearm.name: Manifest Runelord's Polearm
Manifest Runelord's Polearm.description:
Requirements The risen runelord isn't holding a runelord's polearm

Effect The risen runelord causes their runelord's polearm to appear in one of their hands. The exact appearance of the polearm depends on the type wielded by the runelord in life, but these weapons are purely spiritual constructs that inflict mental damage on a Strike and vanish as soon as the risen runelord releases the weapon or dies.

Mythic Power.name: 神话之力 Mythic Power
Mythic Power.description: 该生物拥有 3 点神话点，并可以将这些神话点用于以下任何动作。

Quickened Casting.name: Quickened Casting
Quickened Casting.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect If the risen runelord's next action is to cast a cantrip or spell that's 4th-rank or lower, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

Recharge.name: Recharge
Recharge.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The risen runelord regains an expended spell slot or can use Quickened Casting again.

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt the risen runelord's spellcasting action, the risen runelord attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

Risen Runelord (Lust).name: Risen Runelord (Lust)
Risen Runelord (Lust).publicNotes:
Risen runelords are created by a powerful ritual invented by Runelord Xanderghul—a ritual called raise runelord. All risen runelords are at least level 11 creatures. Once created, a risen runelord has no capacity to become more powerful, as they are manifestations of their legacy at a specific point in time (although given enough time and resources, a risen runelord could potentially find a way to overcome this limitation on self-improvement).

A risen runelord has a modicum of free will, but as long as the one who created them via raise runelord lives, they're bound to their creator's desires. A risen runelord ordered to undertake obviously self-destructive actions might, at the GM's discretion, resist the command and could potentially even break free of their creator's control.

Since raise runelord draws upon a runelord's legacy as it exists within the Dreamlands, no risen runelord can ever sleep or dream. Xanderghul can use a risen runelord in a special way: he can use any risen runelord (including ones he didn't create) as a spare body. If he's slain, his soul can instantly jump to the closest risen runelord to replace them and continue the fight, unless the PCs can disable this defense during the second adventure in Revenge of the Runelords. Regardless of level, all risen runelords are mythic creatures and are immune to sleep effects.

Lust and Pride

Of the seven sins, lust and pride are unique among the runelords for these sins were only ever represented by a single runelord—and both still live during the events of this Adventure Path. This may change once the events of Revenge of the Runelords come to a conclusion, in which case the sinful foci for lust and pride become potential options for risen runelords of Sorshen or Xanderghul, but during Revenge of the Runelords, no risen runelords of lust or pride can exist.

Risen Runelord Gear

A risen runelord's polearm is an extension of their being and cannot exist without them, vanishing upon their death. This doesn't prevent a risen runelord from claiming, carrying, or using other items, and most higher-level risen runelords keep real magic items that remain behind after their death.

Beckoning Trail.name: Beckoning Trail
Beckoning Trail.description:
Trigger A creature crosses over the footprints' trail

Effect The triggering creature suddenly realizes the nature of the immense trail they just stepped into and feels a compulsion to follow the trail to their destination; the triggering creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:35] save with the following results.

Critical Success The creature Strides once down the trail before coming to their senses—this movement does not put the creature in any peril or danger.

Success The creature takes its three actions to Stride down the trail. While this movement doesn't put the creature in any direct peril, when they end the movement, they're overwhelmed with the knowledge that had they gone further, something horrible would have happened; the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 hour by the close call.

Failure As success, but the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and also stupefied 1 for 24 hours.

Critical Failure As failure, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}. In addition, at the end of the three Strides, the creature vanishes from view, instantly teleporting to some dangerous area or hidden prison. This might be a nearby location that the creature's allies can discover and rescue them from, or it may be somewhere further away that will require more effort to reach before the victim can be rescued.

Unspeakable Impressions.name: Unspeakable Impressions
Unspeakable Impressions.disable: @Check[deception|dc:46] (master) to distract those (including yourself) compelled to follow footprints, or @Check[survival|dc:43] (legendary) to quickly obscure the trail
Unspeakable Impressions.hazarddescription: A trail of over-sized footprints crosses the path, markings of the apparently recent passage of a dangerous and mind-shattering entity whose stride is enough to be mistaken for depressions in the natural terrain, and promising destruction to those compelled to follow the tracks.
Unspeakable Impressions.reset: The unspeakable impressions fade once they are triggered, but reform somewhere else in the vicinity 24 hours later unless they are successfully disabled.

Risen Runelord (Greed).name: Risen Runelord (Greed)

Vanishing Death.name: Vanishing Death
Vanishing Death.description: When a risen runelord is slain, their body and (if manifested) polearm vanishes as the trapped legacy that was drawn upon to create them is set free, exploding outward in a riot of swirling color. This release of arcane energy hammers the minds of nearby creatures. All creatures adjacent to a risen runelord during their vanishing death must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 24 hours (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) as fragments of their own memories are temporarily scrambled or hidden. Other objects carried by the risen runelord fall to the ground.

Mythic Power.name: 神话之力 Mythic Power
Mythic Power.description: 该生物拥有 3 点神话点，并可以将这些神话点用于以下任何动作。

Recharge.name: Recharge
Recharge.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The risen runelord regains an expended spell slot or can use Quickened Casting again.

Remove a Condition.name: 移除状态 Remove a Condition
Remove a Condition.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The risen runelord ends one condition affecting them.

Beyond Life.name: Beyond Life
Beyond Life.description: A risen runelord may drink or eat for pleasure or entertainment, but they need not do so for nourishment and never suffer the effects of thirst or starvation.

Mythic Resilience (Will).description: 该怪物将与其相关的豁免成功率比骰掷结果的成功度高一个等级。这不会与其他改变成功度的效果叠加，例如失能特征（自然1或20时除外）。怪物每次获得神话韧性时，可选择一项豁免。该能力应首先应用于该怪物的最高豁免。

Manifest Runelord's Polearm.name: Manifest Runelord's Polearm
Manifest Runelord's Polearm.description:
Requirements The risen runelord isn't holding a runelord's polearm

Effect The risen runelord causes their runelord's polearm to appear in one of their hands. The exact appearance of the polearm depends on the type wielded by the runelord in life, but these weapons are purely spiritual constructs that inflict mental damage on a Strike and vanish as soon as the risen runelord releases the weapon or dies.
