This doesn't prevent a risen runelord from claiming, carrying, or using other items, and most higher-level risen runelords keep real magic items that remain behind after their death.

Green Glow.name: Green Glow
Green Glow.description: 15 feet. A creature beginning its turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:37] save to avoid becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure). A creature that's already sickened instead becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} on a failure (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} on a critical failure) for 24 hours.

Statue's Head.name: Statue's Head
Statue's Head.description: Until the next time it acts, the abysium sentinel appears to be the head of a statue it's perched atop. It has an automatic result of 58 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as nothing more than a statue's head.

Security Alert.name: Security Alert
Security Alert.description:
Trigger The abysium sentinel becomes aware of an unfamiliar creature

Effect The abysium sentinel alerts its owner of an intruder, either with a mental or audible alarm, depending on established orders. The mental alarm has a range of 1 mile.

Abysium Sentinel.name: Abysium Sentinel
Abysium Sentinel.publicNotes:
This creature is crafted from a toxic skymetal known as abysium.

Thassilonian sentinels are crafted in the shapes of skulls or heads.

Sentinel Sets

Thassilonian sentinels were typically carved from marble, ivory, and bronze, easily blending in with most statues. Rarer sentinels carved from wood, coral, and skymetals were often commissioned in sets alongside matching statues to ensure seamless fits or were carefully sculpted for display alone.

Mindwarp Ink.name: 心智扭曲墨汁 Mindwarp Ink
Mindwarp Ink.description:
触发 一名生物进入被墨汁污染的水域

效果 该生物必须进行@Check[will|dc:37] 豁免，以避免陷入持续24小时的 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}（若大失败则陷入持续24小时的 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2}）。随后，危害骰先攻。

Flawed Memories.name: 瑕疵记忆 Flawed Memories
Flawed Memories.disable: @Check[crafting|dc:45]（大师）以释放炼金试剂中和水中的墨汁，@Check[nature|dc:42]（传奇）以操控该区域的原能魔法使墨汁的效果失效，或 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]（8环；反制DC 34）以反制水中的魔法墨汁；需成功四次方可解除该危害（净化或操控水流的法术，如 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qXTB7Ec9yYh5JPPV] 或 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.zfn5RqAdF63neqpP]，可视为施法者使用同环级的 解除魔法 一般影响此危害）。
Flawed Memories.hazarddescription: 充满房间的浑浊水体，会呈现出往昔的虚假幻象。
Flawed Memories.routine:
（2 动作）陷阱的第一个动作，对所有房间内处于水域外或通往区域A5的楼梯上的生物发动一次水流喷射远程打击。第二个动作，浸染水体的原能魔法试图渗透入水中生物的思维，迫使水中的每个生物进行一次 @Check[will|dc:39] 意志豁免，以抵抗以下效果。

大成功 生物不受影响。

成功 生物受到 @Damage[4d6[mental]] 伤害。

失败 生物受到 @Damage[8d6[mental]] 伤害，并陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2}，持续24小时。生物处于呆滞状态时，进行 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]的检定将额外承受–2状态减值。

大失败 与失败相同，但生物受到 @Damage[16d6[mental]] 伤害，陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 3}，且呆滞状态无限期持续。
Flawed Memories.reset: 陷阱保持解除状态，直至鲍伦重新为该区域填充墨汁（通常每4小时一次）。

Endless Realities.name: 无尽现实 Endless Realities
Endless Realities.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:38]（传奇）以抓住虚假现实的一缕并用力拉扯，从而解开周围的幻象， @Check[arcana|dc:41] 以掌控虚假现实中的幻象并迫使它们自我消解， @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]（7环；反制 DC 39）以反制幻术所创造的四个现实之一
Endless Realities.hazarddescription: 大量幻象涌入生物的感官，将它们拖入一个由流动的现实组成的不断变换的迷宫。
Endless Realities.routine:
（1动作）陷阱从当前现实切换至随机确定的另一种现实，以不同方式影响所有迷失于幻象中的生物。若新的现实之前曾受过伤害，则其恢复@Damage[20[healing]]生命值。每当PC通过检定或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]尝试解除陷阱成功时，或当前现实生命值降至0点时，这一现实将消失，PC们将陷入一片没有尽头的虚无之中，唯有上方“天空”中有一颗三尾彗星正在燃烧（可通过一次DC25的@Check[arcana|dc:25]、@Check[nature|dc:25]、@Check[occultism|dc:25]或@Check[religion|dc:25]检定认出那是三位一体星），直至陷阱进行下一次动作并从剩余选项中随机确定新的现实。若在解除或摧毁当前现实时仅剩一种无尽现实，PC们将被送回真实世界，且陷阱被完全解除。

当无尽现实切换时，从以下选项中随机确定其效果与外观（若结果已被解除或摧毁，则重骰）。

每当PC在抵抗现实伤害的豁免检定中取得大成功时，陷阱将退化；其解除DC与硬度每次大成功均降低2点。若以此方式将陷阱硬度降至0点，则整个陷阱将立即被解除。

燃烧的现实 （火焰） 额外无效 火焰；效果整个世界仿佛燃起了熊熊烈火，同时燃烧的怪物组成的军团向队伍发起攻击。每位PC承受@Damage[10d6[fire]]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:34|basic|traits:fire]豁免）。

冻结的现实 （寒冷） 额外无效 寒冷；效果整个世界仿佛被寒冰封冻，同时冰冻的幽灵组成的军团袭击了PC们。每位PC承受@Damage[10d6[cold]]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:34|basic|traits:cold]豁免）。

不可能的现实 （心灵） 额外无效 物理；效果世界仿佛扭曲成了不可能存在的几何结构，PC们感觉自己的身体也随之扭曲，仿佛化作无法成立构型的畸变倒影。每位PC承受@Damage[10d6[mental]]伤害（@Check[will|dc:34|basic|traits:mental]豁免）。

溶解的现实 （酸蚀） 额外无效 酸蚀；效果整个世界仿佛逐渐消融瓦解，与此同时，四周涌出大量蠕动的泥怪集群，吞没了PC们。每位PC承受@Damage[10d6[acid]]伤害（@Check[fortitude|dc:34|basic|traits:acid]豁免）。

Reality Undone.name: 现实崩解 Reality Undone
Reality Undone.description:
触发 一个不是赞多古尔追随者的生物试图进入本区域东侧的走廊或房间

效果 幻象如潮水般汹涌而至，伴随着纷繁的图像与声音，将触发此效果的生物及其身处朝银工坊内的所有盟友尽数淹没。受影响的生物必须通过一次 @Check[will|dc:34] 豁免，否则将在 24 小时内陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}（若大失败，则为 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2}）。

Ally of Golarion.name: Ally of Golarion
Ally of Golarion.description:
Trigger Xanderghul rolls initiative

Effect Sorshen casts telepathy, allowing her to communicate with the PCs; she can inform them of her options during her routine and follows their advice and requests if given. She then rolls initiative.

Queen Sorshen's Aid.name: Queen Sorshen's Aid
Queen Sorshen's Aid.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:55] to unravel the energies allowing Sorshen to continue to vex Xanderghul; 4 successes are required to disable the hazard.
Queen Sorshen's Aid.hazarddescription: Queen Sorshen is a beautiful Thassilonian woman wielding a shimmering guisarme. Her violet eyes are fierce and focused, but the corner of her lips twist up in a small, lopsided smile.
Queen Sorshen's Aid.routine:
(3 actions) On her initiative each round, Sorshen can spend her three actions on any of the following options, following PC suggestions if requested. She cannot use any action from the following list more than once per round.

Aid Ally 1 Sorshen uses her magic to empower one of the PCs, granting that PC a +4 circumstance bonus to attack rolls until the start of her next turn. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.MNITD4PrcyRCqPbK]{Effect: Queen Sorshen's Aid (Aid Ally)}

Dispel Pride 1 Sorshen attempts to counteract a magic effect put in place by Xanderghul, with a counteract rank of 9th and a [[/gmr 1d20+40 #Counteract]]{+40} modifier for the roll.

Distracting Presence 1 Sorshen uses her power to distract Xanderghul, causing him to lose his resistance to mental damage until the start of her next turn and also to attempt a @Check[will|dc:50] save with the following results.

Critical Success Xanderghul takes no further penalty, and is temporarily immune to Distracting Presence for 24 hours.

Success Xanderghul is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of his turn.

Failure Xanderghul is off-guard until the start of Sorshen's next turn.

Critical Failure As failure, but Xanderghul is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as he remains off-guard.

Indulgent Arcana 1 Sorshen empowers a PC's magic, so that the next spell with the mental trait they cast before Sorshen's next turn increases its save DC and attack roll by 2 and removes the spell's incapacitation trait, if any. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.KFmJLxZAFQ2Q7C1N]{Effect: Queen Sorshen's Aid (Indulgent Arcana)}

Sinuous Strike 1 Sorshen swings her guisarme, usurping some of Xanderghul's own power to manifest an illusory duplicate that attempts a guisarme Strike against him.
Queen Sorshen's Aid.stealthdetails: +45 for initiative; noticing her has a DC of 0

Manifest Runelord's Polearm.name: Manifest Runelord's Polearm
Manifest Runelord's Polearm.description:
Requirements The risen runelord isn't holding a runelord's polearm

Effect The risen runelord causes their runelord's polearm to appear in one of their hands. The exact appearance of the polearm depends on the type wielded by the runelord in life, but these weapons are purely spiritual constructs that inflict mental damage on a Strike and vanish as soon as the risen runelord releases the weapon or dies.

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt the risen runelord's spellcasting action, the risen runelord attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

Remove a Condition.name: 移除状态 Remove a Condition
Remove a Condition.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The risen runelord ends one condition affecting them.

Beyond Life.name: Beyond Life
Beyond Life.description: A risen runelord may drink or eat for pleasure or entertainment, but they need not do so for nourishment and never suffer the effects of thirst or starvation.

Mythic Resilience (Will).name: Mythic Resilience (Will)
Mythic Resilience (Will).description: 该怪物将与其相关的豁免成功率比骰掷结果的成功度高一个等级。这不会与其他改变成功度的效果叠加，例如失能特征（自然1或20时除外）。怪物每次获得神话韧性时，可选择一项豁免。该能力应首先应用于该怪物的最高豁免。

Vanishing Death.name: Vanishing Death
Vanishing Death.description: When a risen runelord is slain, their body and (if manifested) polearm vanishes as the trapped legacy that was drawn upon to create them is set free, exploding outward in a riot of swirling color. This release of arcane energy hammers the minds of nearby creatures. All creatures adjacent to a risen runelord during their vanishing death must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 24 hours (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) as fragments of their own memories are temporarily scrambled or hidden. Other objects carried by the risen runelord fall to the ground.

Mythic Power.name: 神话之力 Mythic Power
Mythic Power.description: 该生物拥有 3 点神话点，并可以将这些神话点用于以下任何动作。

Quickened Casting.name: Quickened Casting
Quickened Casting.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect If the risen runelord's next action is to cast a cantrip or spell that's 4th-rank or lower, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

Recharge.name: Recharge
Recharge.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The risen runelord regains an expended spell slot or can use Quickened Casting again.

Risen Runelord (Wrath).name: Risen Runelord (Wrath)
Risen Runelord (Wrath).publicNotes:
Risen runelords are created by a powerful ritual invented by Runelord Xanderghul—a ritual called raise runelord. All risen runelords are at least level 11 creatures. Once created, a risen runelord has no capacity to become more powerful, as they are manifestations of their legacy at a specific point in time (although given enough time and resources, a risen runelord could potentially find a way to overcome this limitation on self-improvement).

A risen runelord has a modicum of free will, but as long as the one who created them via raise runelord lives, they're bound to their creator's desires. A risen runelord ordered to undertake obviously self-destructive actions might, at the GM's discretion, resist the command and could potentially even break free of their creator's control.

Since raise runelord draws upon a runelord's legacy as it exists within the Dreamlands, no risen runelord can ever sleep or dream. Xanderghul can use a risen runelord in a special way: he can use any risen runelord (including ones he didn't create) as a spare body. If he's slain, his soul can instantly jump to the closest risen runelord to replace them and continue the fight, unless the PCs can disable this defense during the second adventure in Revenge of the Runelords. Regardless of level, all risen runelords are mythic creatures and are immune to sleep effects.

Lust and Pride

Of the seven sins, lust and pride are unique among the runelords for these sins were only ever represented by a single runelord—and both still live during the events of this Adventure Path. This may change once the events of Revenge of the Runelords come to a conclusion, in which case the sinful foci for lust and pride become potential options for risen runelords of Sorshen or Xanderghul, but during Revenge of the Runelords, no risen runelords of lust or pride can exist.

Risen Runelord Gear

A risen runelord's polearm is an extension of their being and cannot exist without them, vanishing upon their death. This doesn't prevent a risen runelord from claiming, carrying, or using other items, and most higher-level risen runelords keep real magic items that remain behind after their death.

Moonlight's Kiss.name: Moonlight's Kiss
Moonlight's Kiss.description:
A moon hag in an area illuminated by moonlight gains a +2 status bonus to AC and initiative rolls. In the light of a full moon, they're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened}, and can use the extra action only to Stride or Strike. If the moon hag has a fly Speed, they can use the extra action to Fly as well.

Any time they're outside of the oubliette or in area C7 they are in moonlight.

Dreadful Prediction.name: Dreadful Prediction
Dreadful Prediction.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The moon hag howls a series of dreadful, apocalyptic predictions at a single creature within 30 feet, shattering its perceptions of reality. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:38] save and takes a –2 circumstance penalty to the save if it can see the moon. On a failure, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} on a critical failure) until the curse is removed. Regardless of the outcome, the creature is then temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Coven.name: Coven
Coven.description:
A Bittersweet Sister adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5bTt2CvYHPvaR7QQ]{Interplanar Teleport}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r784cIz17eWujtQj]{Scrying}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.PHVHBbdHeQRfjLmE]{Spirit Blast} to her coven's spells.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Coven]

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The moon hag can take on the appearance of any Medium humanoid woman. This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage bonuses with their Strikes, but it might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Ride the Moonbeams.name: Ride the Moonbeams
Ride the Moonbeams.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The moon hag teleports themself and any items they're wearing and holding to another space within 30 feet, or 60 feet if they're in moonlight. They then gain a 25-foot fly Speed until the end of their next turn. If the moon hag is in the air when the effect ends, they float to the ground, taking no falling damage.

Any time they're outside of the oubliette or in area C7 they are in moonlight.

Meteor Shower.name: Meteor Shower
Meteor Shower.stealthdetails: @Check[Astronomy Lore|dc:41] (master) or @Check[nature|dc:45] (legendary) to notice signs of the approach of unusual celestial bodies
Meteor Shower.disable: @Check[Astronomy Lore|dc:40] (master) or @Check[nature|dc:50] (legendary) to predict the trajectory of the falling asteroids and determine safe zones, @Check[athletics|dc:45] (legendary) or @Check[crafting|dc:47] (master) to dig underground shelters, @Check[diplomacy|dc:45] (master) or @Check[intimidation|dc:47] (master) to coordinate an orderly evacuation
Meteor Shower.hazarddescription: Impact from a sufficiently large asteroid would be powerful enough to wipe out a region or destroy a planet, but smaller-scale impact events, like from a meteor shower, present hazards that could be survived. This shower might arise naturally, or it might be the result of the PCs or other forces preventing a greater calamity by breaking a world-rending asteroid into smaller pieces.
Meteor Shower.routine: (1+ minutes, @Check[flat|dc:17]) Small asteroids rain down across the sky, battering and incinerating those caught in their path before carving craters. Over the course of a minute, enough asteroids smash into the ground and explode to inflict @Damage[6d10[bludgeoning],14d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to any unprepared characters in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:44|basic] save). The @Template[type:burst|distance:40]{40-foot-radius} craters left behind are greater difficult terrain.

Runic Warmaw.name: Runic Warmaw

Echo Arcana.name: Echo Arcana
Echo Arcana.description:
Trigger A rune giant within 30 feet casts one of the warmaw's innate spells by reading their shared runes

Effect The runic warmaw makes a jaws Strike.

Rune Flare.name: Rune Flare
Rune Flare.description:
Trigger The runic warmaw is targeted by an arcane spell or effect

Effect The runes etched across the runic warmaw's body burst to life with a sudden flow of energy. The runic warmaw becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round and can use the additional action only to Stride or Strike.

Howl of Ash and Ember.name: Howl of Ash and Ember
Howl of Ash and Ember.description: The runic warmaw exhales a surge of foul soot and flame, dealing @Damage[15d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to all creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[reflex|dc:37|basic] save). A creature that fails the save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure). The runic warmaw can't use Howl of Ash and Ember again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Howl of Ash and Ember]]{1d4 rounds}.

Invigorating Bite.name: Invigorating Bite
Invigorating Bite.description: When a runic warmaw critically hits a target with a jaws Strike, they regain 30 Hit Points and, at the start of their next turn, gain an additional reaction during that turn.

Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack
Pack Attack.description: The runic warmaw's Strikes deal an additional 3d6 precision damage to creatures within the reach of at least two of the runic warmaw's allies.

Share Runes.name: Share Runes
Share Runes.description: When a runic warmaw is within 60 feet of a rune giant, that rune giant can cast any of the runic warmaw's innate spells during the rune giant's turn—these spells use the rune giant's DCs but are depleted from the warmaw's daily uses. The rune giant is the point of origin and makes all the decisions about the spell's targets.

Runic Warmaw.publicNotes:
Rune giants have specialized talents and magical abilities to command other giants, yet giants are far from the only creatures they favor when it comes to guardians. The first runic warmaws were created by Runelord Alaznist in –5780, not long after she perfected the fleshwarping techniques she learned from the qlippoth lord Yamasoth, in response to her rune giants' repeated requests for some form of powerful guardian they could deploy against her enemies on the field of battle. In the following years, as with sinspawn and other fleshwarp creations, other runelords capitalized upon these methods to create runic warmaws as well.

A runic warmaw looks somewhat like an immense, elephant-sized hound, yet with horselike heads that have large, toothy jaws well suited to rending flesh. Strange patterns of shifting red runes appear on their black-furred bodies—runes containing latent sources of magic that rune giants can use to access some of a runic warmaw's magical powers.

Specialized Warmaws

The runic warmaw presented here has been specially bred by rune giants to foster magical powers that serve well in combat, but others with a focus on different types of magical tactics, such as research, defense, or travel, exist. These warmaws have differently themed innate spells—replace the three combat-associated spells listed in the stat block as appropriate for the warmaw's theme you desire for the encounter you're building.

Remove a Condition.name: 移除状态 Remove a Condition
Remove a Condition.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The ancient one ends one condition affecting them.

Recharge.name: Recharge
Recharge.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The ancient one regains an expended spell.

Reroll.name: Reroll
Reroll.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Trigger The ancient one fails a check

Effect The ancient one rerolls the check.

Entropy Sense.name: Entropy Sense
Entropy Sense.description: The ancient one can predict the presence of a creature through supernatural insight into chaotic probabilities and chance and builds a perception of reality from this information, allowing them to "see" as a precise sense in the listed range. Invisible creatures are visible to them, but veil of privacy prevents a creature from being detected via entropy sense automatically (without a counteract check).

Mythic Resilience (Will).name: Mythic Resilience (Will)
Mythic Resilience (Will).description: 该怪物将与其相关的豁免成功率比骰掷结果的成功度高一个等级。这不会与其他改变成功度的效果叠加，例如失能特征（自然1或20时除外）。怪物每次获得神话韧性时，可选择一项豁免。该能力应首先应用于该怪物的最高豁免。

No Breath.name: No Breath
No Breath.description: An ancient one doesn't breathe and is immune to effects that require breathing (such as inhaled poisons).

Otherworldly Mind.name: Otherworldly Mind
Otherworldly Mind.description: Whenever a creature targets the ancient one with a mental effect, that creature takes @Damage[6d8[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:39|basic] save). On a critical failure, the creature also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

The Connection Cuts Both Ways.name: The Connection Cuts Both Ways
The Connection Cuts Both Ways.description: Creatures the ancient one affected with a mental effect or communicated with telepathically within the last round can hijack the ancient one's telepathic connection; they automatically ignore the ancient one's immunity to auditory, emotion, and visual effects until the end of their current turn. They can additionally spend 1 Mythic Point as a free action to reach through the connection to manipulate the ancient one's mind, ignoring the ancient one's mythic resilience on Will saving throws.

Undying Myth.name: Undying Myth
Undying Myth.description:
Cost all of the Ancient One's Mythic Points

Trigger The ancient one would die and has at least 1 Mythic Point

Effect The ancient one remains conscious, and recovers 50% of their maximum Hit Points.

Unified Timeline.name: Unified Timeline
Unified Timeline.description:
Trigger A creature ends its movement within 10 feet of the ancient one

Effect Ancient ones exist spread out across infinite times and places simultaneously and can shift themselves through their catalog of potentialities. The ancient one teleports themself and the triggering creature into empty squares within 10 feet of their respective positions, though the triggering creature can't be moved into hazardous terrain or to a place it can't stand. An unwilling creature can resist the teleportation with a successful @Check[will|dc:42] save.

Dismantle All Life.name: Dismantle All Life
Dismantle All Life.description: Time and entropy end all things, even the undead. When the ancient one's Strikes hit a creature with void healing, they deal vitality damage instead of void damage. The ancient one can't use their Strikes to restore Hit Points to living or undead creatures.

Slither Between Worlds.name: Slither Between Worlds
Slither Between Worlds.description: The ancient one instantly transports themself and any items they're wearing and holding from their current space to an unoccupied space within 100 feet they can see. Once per turn, the ancient one can spend 1 Mythic Point to slither between worlds as a free action on their turn.

Vision of Lost Meaning.name: Vision of Lost Meaning
Vision of Lost Meaning.description:
The ancient one speaks without sound, contacting a creature within 120 feet telepathically to send out waves of visions that fill its mind with fragmented thoughts, unrealized chaos, and futures where its choices are never consequential. The target attempts a @Check[will|dc:42] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is disoriented by the visions and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Failure The target is overwhelmed by the visions and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure, but the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3}.

Ancient One.name: Ancient One
Ancient One.publicNotes:
In the Dimension of Time, creatures clad in tattered robes float between encapsulated bubbles of still, captured moments, untethered to any other place, unspeaking and unseeing. The few mortals to meet these enigmatic, faceless creatures have never known them to identify by any name other than the ancient ones, seemingly holding no identity (or no identity they wish to share) beyond their relationship with time.

The ancients profess to have always existed in the Dimension of Time, and for time to have always existed in the Great Beyond. Most reside in Stethelos, the storied city at the center of time, though they're also found wandering the Void, crossing the strangest corners of the Maelstrom where it lies between other planes, and occasionally, venturing into dark corners of the Universe. They serve at the will of Tawil at'Umr, the All in One and the One in All, an avatar of Yog-Sothoth lurking deep within time as Stethelos's caretaker. Though the ancient ones resemble their master in stature and attire, and though none would describe Tawil at'Umr as anything other than ancient in origin, most scholars consider "ancient one" a classification of its own separate from that of Great Old One, and Tawil at'Umr is definitively counted among the Great Old Ones by all who know it.

Where Yog-Sothoth is an embodiment of all space and time, an entity who concerns himself with guarding cosmic secrets, the ancient ones are philosophers and mystics seeking ever more enlightenment. They search, have searched, and will search across time indefinitely and, having found entropy and disorder, conclude this to be the Great Beyond's ultimate purpose. When a new creature dawns, it's pristine and whole—perfectly ordered—for but a single moment before it can be eroded by Pharasma's poison, accumulating decay, change, and chaos, until finally it reaches its ending, when time leaves a twilight creature broken and gone. Law and chaos, the ancient ones believe, aren't opposing or even separate forces, but a single expression of reality viewed from two angles, different from each other only in time.

How Old is Time?

Lying in parallel with the Great Beyond with a presence felt on nearly every plane, from the Inner Sphere to the Outer Rifts, the Dimension of Time holds too many secrets for a reality so seemingly omnipresent. Can a world truly be said to begin before time is there to start? Scholars say Pharasma is the oldest being in the Great Beyond, a survivor of some previous multiverse's collapse, but does the Lady of Graves predate time, or did she bring the Dimension of Time with her so history could begin everything anew?

Into the Dimension of Time

The Dimension of Time is one of the most difficult and complex realms in the Great Beyond to travel to, with restrictions on its access limiting all but the most powerful of planar travelers from visiting it. At the GM's discretion, though, items looted from an ancient one, or even just fragments torn from their robes, could function as the planar key needed to allow a PC to use interplanar teleport to access the Dimension of Time.

Maddenmist.name: 狂雾 Maddenmist
Maddenmist.blurb: 男性沙达鱼人教派领袖

Sea Speech.name: 海语者 Sea Speech
Sea Speech.description: 任何具有游泳速度或者两栖或水栖特征的动物都能够理解沙达鱼人说出的水元素语。通过花费1星期时间有规律地和一只此类动物交互，沙达鱼人能够让它变得永远乐于帮助。

Drain Bonded Item.name: 汲取连结物品 Drain Bonded Item
Drain Bonded Item.description:
频率 每日一次

需求 狂雾持有他的法杖

效果 狂雾消耗其高等奥能法杖中储存的魔法力量。在当前回合中，狂雾可以施放一个他今天已经施放过的准备法术而不会耗费法术位。他仍旧必须进行施放法术，并满足该法术的其他需求。

Maddenmist.publicNotes:
高阶沙达鱼人既懂得策划战斗行动也能够亲自参加战斗。这些演讲者通过积攒数头大型仆从或者单个巨齿鲨这样的庞大生物来达到如今的地位。

沙达鱼人是形似鱼类的两栖类人生物，他们潜伏在格拉利昂的海洋中，以带领着手下的动物仆从上岸吞没那些呼吸空气的生物的行为而闻名。当有渔村在一夜之间突然消失时，沙达鱼人会是首要嫌疑犯。沙达鱼人自负为天生的领导者，他们的野心只会受到自身必须严格遵守的等级制度的限制。沙达鱼人的地位取决于自身能使役的动物仆从的力量、与在狩猎期间以及在对抗外人的战斗中所表现出的奋斗精神。

Remove a Condition.name: 移除状态 Remove a Condition
Remove a Condition.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The risen runelord ends one condition affecting them.

Quickened Casting.name: Quickened Casting
Quickened Casting.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect If the risen runelord's next action is to cast a cantrip or spell that's 4th-rank or lower, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

Recharge.name: Recharge
Recharge.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The risen runelord regains an expended spell slot or can use Quickened Casting again.

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt the risen runelord's spellcasting action, the risen runelord attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

Beyond Life.name: Beyond Life
Beyond Life.description: A risen runelord may drink or eat for pleasure or entertainment, but they need not do so for nourishment and never suffer the effects of thirst or starvation.

Vanishing Death.name: Vanishing Death
Vanishing Death.description: When a risen runelord is slain, their body and (if manifested) polearm vanishes as the trapped legacy that was drawn upon to create them is set free, exploding outward in a riot of swirling color. This release of arcane energy blasts at the minds of nearby creatures. All creatures adjacent to a risen runelord during a Vanishing Death must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:34] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 24 hours (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) as fragments of their own memories are temporarily scrambled or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}. Other objects carried by the risen runelord fall to the ground.

Manifest Runelord's Polearm.name: Manifest Runelord's Polearm
Manifest Runelord's Polearm.description:
Requirements The risen runelord isn't holding a runelord's polearm

Effect The risen runelord causes their runelord's polearm to appear in one of their hands. The exact appearance of the polearm depends on the type wielded by the runelord in life, but these weapons are purely spiritual constructs that inflict mental damage on a Strike and vanish as soon as the risen runelord releases the weapon or dies.

Mythic Power.name: 神话之力 Mythic Power
Mythic Power.description: 该生物拥有 3 点神话点，并可以将这些神话点用于以下任何动作。

Risen Runelord Kaliphesta.name: Risen Runelord Kaliphesta
Risen Runelord Kaliphesta.publicNotes:
Risen runelords are created by a powerful ritual invented by Runelord Xanderghul—a ritual called raise runelord. All risen runelords are at least level 11 creatures. Once created, a risen runelord has no capacity to become more powerful, as they are manifestations of their legacy at a specific point in time (although given enough time and resources, a risen runelord could potentially find a way to overcome this limitation on self-improvement).

A risen runelord has a modicum of free will, but as long as the one who created them via raise runelord lives, they're bound to their creator's desires. A risen runelord ordered to undertake obviously self-destructive actions might, at the GM's discretion, resist the command and could potentially even break free of their creator's control.

Since raise runelord draws upon a runelord's legacy as it exists within the Dreamlands, no risen runelord can ever sleep or dream. Xanderghul can use a risen runelord in a special way: he can use any risen runelord (including ones he didn't create) as a spare body. If he's slain, his soul can instantly jump to the closest risen runelord to replace them and continue the fight, unless the PCs can disable this defense during the second adventure in Revenge of the Runelords. Regardless of level, all risen runelords are mythic creatures and are immune to sleep effects.

Lust and Pride

Of the seven sins, lust and pride are unique among the runelords for these sins were only ever represented by a single runelord—and both still live during the events of this Adventure Path. This may change once the events of Revenge of the Runelords come to a conclusion, in which case the sinful foci for lust and pride become potential options for risen runelords of Sorshen or Xanderghul, but during Revenge of the Runelords, no risen runelords of lust or pride can exist.

Risen Runelord Gear

A risen runelord's polearm is an extension of their being and cannot exist without them, vanishing upon their death. This doesn't prevent a risen runelord from claiming, carrying, or using other items, and most higher-level risen runelords keep real magic items that remain behind after their death.

Nightmare Feast.name: Nightmare Feast
Nightmare Feast.disable: @Check[society|dc:43] (master) to fight these destructive urges by focusing your thoughts on traditions not so steeped in cruelty, or @Check[intimidation|dc:40] (legendary) to overwhelm the nightmare's influence with the strength of your own personality; three successes are required to disable the nightmare
Nightmare Feast.hazarddescription: The consumption of sentient, and even sapient creatures is widespread in Leng. Those who suffer such fates are as much the genesis of this nightmare as those who partake, and as such, this nightmare tends to manifest in places where meals were taken, from banquet halls to campsites.
Nightmare Feast.routine:
(1 action) The nightmare transitions from directly chewing on the creatures in the area to compelling them to feed for themselves. Each round on the nightmare's turn, all creatures within 30 feet of the nightmare's epicenter must attempt a @Check[will|dc:36] save with the following results.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The nightmare causes a momentary change to the creature's appearance, causing its jaws to take on a frightening, fanged appearance and filling the creature's mind with distracting, unsettling hunger that cause them to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of the nightmare feast's next turn.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} until the start of the nightmare feast's next turn and gains a +30 bite (magical) that deals @Damage[(3d12+10)[slashing]] damage plus @Damage[2d6[persistent,bleed]] damage on a hit. The creature favors this bite Strike when the confusion drives them to attack.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} and can use the extra action to make bite Strikes.
Nightmare Feast.reset: The nightmare deactivates as soon as a round begins with no creatures in its area, and resets in [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds}.

Invisible Feasters.description:
Trigger A living creature approaches within 10 feet of the remains of a previous feast

Effect Invisible attackers begin to bite and gnaw at the triggering creature and any other creatures within 30 feet. The creatures take @Damage[10d6[slashing]] damage from the biting (@Check[reflex|dc:36|basic] save), and then the nightmare rolls initiative.
Invisible Feasters.name: Invisible Feasters

Vogorond.name: Vogorond

Dreams of the Past.description: When a sleeping or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} creature wakes up within 20 feet of a vogorond, its memories are overwritten by those of an inhabitant of the vogorond's home world. The target is affected by a 9th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5BbU1V6wGSGbrmRD]{Never Mind} spell (@Check[will|dc:40] save).
Dreams of the Past.name: Dreams of the Past

Ruinous Aura.name: Ruinous Aura
Ruinous Aura.description: 10 feet. The air surrounding the vogorond is filled with floating rubble and debris. This area is difficult terrain for creatures other than the vogorond. Each time the vogorond is subjected to a critical hit while their aura is active, the aura's radius increases by 10 feet. If the vogorond's ruinous aura would ever extend to more than 30 feet, the vogorond crumbles apart and is destroyed.

Activate Aura.name: Activate Aura
Activate Aura.description: The vogorond's ruinous aura activates, extending to a range of 10 feet, and the vogorond can Fly once. The vogorond can Activate Aura as a free action when they roll initiative.

Debris Storm.name: Debris Storm
Debris Storm.description: Each enemy in the vogorond's ruinous aura takes @Damage[8d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic] save).

Launch Rubble.name: Launch Rubble
Launch Rubble.description:
Requirements The vogorond's ruinous aura is active

Effect The vogorond launches a piece of rubble up to 100 feet. Upon impact, the rubble explodes in a @Template[type:burst|distance:20]. Any creatures in the area take @Damage[15d8[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic] save). The radius of the vogorond's aura then decreases by 10 feet. The vogorond can't Launch Rubble again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Launch Rubble]]{1d4 rounds}.

Monument.name: Monument
Monument.description: The vogorond deactivates their ruinous aura. Until the next time they act, the vogorond appears to be an inanimate statue, altar, or fragment of architecture. They have an automatic result of 45 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as such an object.

Vogorond Lore.name: Vogorond Lore
Vogorond Lore.description: A vogorond serves as a repository of the memories of the inhabitants of their home world. This gives them the Vogorond Lore skill, which they use when casting @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.ZYoC630tNGutgbE0]{Hypercognition} and sifting through the combined memories of their countless shattered minds.

Vogorond.publicNotes:
Vogoronds are the remains of destroyed worlds imbued with the beliefs, hopes, and memories of that world's people. Their physical bodies often take the shape of monuments held dear by their worlds' former inhabitants, such as a statue of a beloved monarch. Vogoronds are intelligent and often seek to see their destroyed worlds reborn. Because their consciousnesses are formed from millions or even billions of individuals, however, they rarely possess the reasoning needed to pursue their desires to an end.

Reasoning With the Ruined Past

While a vogorond's memories aren't flawless, it knows more about its former world than any scholar could ever hope to learn. Often, a vogorond is the only remaining source of knowledge about the land it once inhabited. Theoretically, heroes from a world on the brink of destruction could travel forward in time to speak with a vogorond and learn what must be done to avert the apocalypse—an act which, paradoxically, would prevent the vogorond from being created in the first place.

Apocalypse Stormfront.name: Apocalypse Stormfront
Apocalypse Stormfront.hazarddescription: An endless void stretches in all directions. Visions of Golarion's destruction roll like storm clouds across the space.
Apocalypse Stormfront.reset: The hazard resets automatically once no creatures are in the area.

Brewing Storm.description:
Trigger A creature enters the shaft leading to area C8

Effect Storm clouds roiling with gouts of fire, bolts of lightning, and the wails of uncountable souls form in the distance. The hazard then rolls initiative.
Brewing Storm.name: Brewing Storm

Apocalypse Stormfront.disable: @Check[acrobatics|dc:47] to Fly through the space without becoming stuck in the webs, @Check[athletics|dc:50] to Climb the webs and make progress forward through the infinite, @Check[nature|dc:47] or @Check[occultism|dc:47] or @Check[arcana|dc:50] or @Check[religion|dc:50] (legendary) to collapse the extradimensional space, or @Check[perception|dc:52] to peer through the visions of Golarion to notice discrepancies that help keep the overwhelming despair from setting in; six successes disables the hazard, causing it to vanish forever and shunting all creatures to Liralarue's Prison.
Apocalypse Stormfront.routine:
(1 action) (arcane, emotion, illusion, mental) A stormfront filled with illusory scenes of Golarion's destruction rolls through the extradimensional space. Each creature in the hazard's area takes @Damage[6d12[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:42|basic|traits:arcane,emotion,illusion,mental] save). On a failed save, a creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2} on a critical failure). A PC reduced to 0 Hit Points by this damage is shunted back into area C7.

A creature that takes damage while Climbing the webs must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:40] save or fall. A creature can try to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} (@Check[reflex|dc:40]). On a success, they lose one success they've earned to escape the hazard but otherwise arrest their fall. On a failure, they plummet into the void, losing all Athletics successes they've earned to escape the hazard. Each round on their turn, the character can try to Grab an Edge again, but each time they fail to do so, the party must earn an additional success to escape the hazard. Characters who fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} or repeatedly fail to Grab an Edge might effectively become lost in the void, though once the nightmare hazard is disabled, they appear along with the rest of the PCs in Liralarue's Prison.

Misery Siktempora.name: 痛苦癔时妖 Misery Siktempora
Misery Siktempora.hp: 再生 40（命能、心灵或山铜使其失效）

Telepathic Wail.name: 摧心悲鸣 Telepathic Wail
Telepathic Wail.description:
痛苦癔时妖以满溢痛苦与折磨的哀号攻击其100尺内一个生物的心灵，造成@Damage[8d6[mental]]伤害（@Check[will|dc:32|basic]豁免）。

若豁免失败，目标下个回合的第一个动作陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]状态（大失败则持续1轮）。

Temporal Sense.name: 时感 Temporal Sense
Temporal Sense.description: 癔时妖总是可以用时间位面学识来掷先攻。当它如此做时，其掷骰获得+2环境加值。

Regeneration 40 (Deactivated by Mental,.name: 再生40（命能、心灵或山铜使其失效）Regeneration 40 (Deactivated by Mental, Orichalcum, or Vitality)

Slash the Suffering.name: 斩灭受苦者 Slash the Suffering
Slash the Suffering.description: 陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{困惑 Confused}与@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied}状态的生物对痛苦癔时妖@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]。

Uncanny Pounce.name: 离奇突袭 Uncanny Pounce
Uncanny Pounce.description:
触发 痛苦癔时妖用时间位面学识掷先攻。

效果 痛苦癔时妖行走一次，并进行一次爪击打击，自由决定顺序。

Inflict Misery.name: 制造痛苦 Inflict Misery
Inflict Misery.description:
需求 痛苦癔时妖的上一个动作是对爪击打击并对目标造成了伤害。

效果 痛苦癔时妖在目标的思想内满溢绝望。目标必须尝试一次@Check[will|dc:32]豁免。无论结果如何，目标对制造痛苦获得1分钟的临时免疫。

成功 目标不受影响。

失败 目标陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2}、@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 2}与@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2}，持续1轮。

大失败 如同失败，但持续1分钟。

Misery Siktempora.publicNotes:
这种生物因极度的痛苦与厄难而生，无臂六足的痛苦癔时妖是它们中数量最多的一种，因为只要活着就难避痛苦。它们也是最积极的癔时妖，试图传播让它们产生的痛苦。它们极为乐意去往主物质位面，因为那里的苦难是如此可悲地普遍存在，而又如此容易倍增。

在时间位面，强烈的情绪不只是虚无缥缈的感觉。它们会随着时间的推移而沉淀，例如由历史事件引起的大规模情绪，或是世代积累的执念。这些沉淀物最终会产生癔时妖。每个癔时妖都能感受到一种与孕育环境相关的独特强烈情感。极少数情况下，一个情绪激动的生物试图进入时间位面或者干扰时间流动时也会产生癔时妖，这可能会产生一些悖论或改变过去的事件。

癔时妖通常把自己隔离在时间位面，在创造他们的地方注入自己的情感，但也有些会前往其他位面。这些游荡者们渴望更沉浸于自己的核心情感，又或者催生更多这种感觉来实现它们同类的存续。

Risen Runelord of Envy (Prison).name: Risen Runelord of Envy (Prison)

Manifest Runelord's Polearm.description:
Requirements The risen runelord isn't holding a runelord's polearm

Effect The risen runelord causes their runelord's polearm to appear in one of their hands. The exact appearance of the polearm depends on the type wielded by the runelord in life, but these weapons are purely spiritual constructs that inflict mental damage on a Strike and vanish as soon as the risen runelord releases the weapon or dies.

Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The risen runelord ends one condition affecting them.

Mythic Power.description: 该生物拥有 3 点神话点，并可以将这些神话点用于以下任何动作。

Quickened Casting.name: Quickened Casting
Quickened Casting.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect If the risen runelord's next action is to cast a cantrip or spell that's 4th-rank or lower, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

Recharge.name: Recharge
Recharge.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The risen runelord regains an expended spell slot or can use Quickened Casting again.

Undying Myth.name: Undying Myth
Undying Myth.description:
Cost all the creature's Mythic Points

Trigger The creature would die and has at least 1 Mythic Point

Effect The creature remains standing and conscious, and recovers 50% of its maximum Hit Points.

Mythic Power.name: 神话之力 Mythic Power
Mythic Power.description: 该生物拥有 3 点神话点，并可以将这些神话点用于以下任何动作。

Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt the risen runelord's spellcasting action, the risen runelord attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

Mythic Resilience (Reflex and Will).name: Mythic Resilience (Reflex and Will)
Mythic Resilience (Reflex and Will).description: 该怪物将与其相关的豁免成功率比骰掷结果的成功度高一个等级。这不会与其他改变成功度的效果叠加，例如失能特征（自然1或20时除外）。怪物每次获得神话韧性时，可选择一项豁免。该能力应首先应用于该怪物的最高豁免。

Manifest Runelord's Polearm.description:
Requirements The risen runelord isn't holding a runelord's polearm

Effect The risen runelord causes their runelord's polearm to appear in one of their hands. The exact appearance of the polearm depends on the type wielded by the runelord in life, but these weapons are purely spiritual constructs that inflict mental damage on a Strike and vanish as soon as the risen runelord releases the weapon or dies.

Remove a Condition.name: 移除状态 Remove a Condition
Remove a Condition.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The risen runelord ends one condition affecting them.

Beyond Life.name: Beyond Life
Beyond Life.description: A risen runelord may drink or eat for pleasure or entertainment, but they need not do so for nourishment and never suffer the effects of thirst or starvation.

Mythic Resilience (Will).name: Mythic Resilience (Will)
Mythic Resilience (Will).description: 该怪物将与其相关的豁免成功率比骰掷结果的成功度高一个等级。这不会与其他改变成功度的效果叠加，例如失能特征（自然1或20时除外）。怪物每次获得神话韧性时，可选择一项豁免。该能力应首先应用于该怪物的最高豁免。

Mythic Power.name: 神话之力 Mythic Power
Mythic Power.description: 该生物拥有 3 点神话点，并可以将这些神话点用于以下任何动作。

Quickened Casting.name: Quickened Casting
Quickened Casting.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect If the risen runelord's next action is to cast a cantrip or spell that's 4th-rank or lower, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

Recharge.name: Recharge
Recharge.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The risen runelord regains an expended spell slot or can use Quickened Casting again.

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt the risen runelord's spellcasting action, the risen runelord attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

Risen Runelord (Envy).name: Risen Runelord (Envy)
Risen Runelord (Envy).publicNotes:
Risen runelords are created by a powerful ritual invented by Runelord Xanderghul—a ritual called raise runelord. All risen runelords are at least level 11 creatures. Once created, a risen runelord has no capacity to become more powerful, as they are manifestations of their legacy at a specific point in time (although given enough time and resources, a risen runelord could potentially find a way to overcome this limitation on self-improvement).

A risen runelord has a modicum of free will, but as long as the one who created them via raise runelord lives, they're bound to their creator's desires. A risen runelord ordered to undertake obviously self-destructive actions might, at the GM's discretion, resist the command and could potentially even break free of their creator's control.

Since raise runelord draws upon a runelord's legacy as it exists within the Dreamlands, no risen runelord can ever sleep or dream. Xanderghul can use a risen runelord in a special way: he can use any risen runelord (including ones he didn't create) as a spare body. If he's slain, his soul can instantly jump to the closest risen runelord to replace them and continue the fight, unless the PCs can disable this defense during the second adventure in Revenge of the Runelords. Regardless of level, all risen runelords are mythic creatures and are immune to sleep effects.

Lust and Pride

Of the seven sins, lust and pride are unique among the runelords for these sins were only ever represented by a single runelord—and both still live during the events of this Adventure Path. This may change once the events of Revenge of the Runelords come to a conclusion, in which case the sinful foci for lust and pride become potential options for risen runelords of Sorshen or Xanderghul, but during Revenge of the Runelords, no risen runelords of lust or pride can exist.

Risen Runelord Gear

A risen runelord's polearm is an extension of their being and cannot exist without them, vanishing upon their death. This doesn't prevent a risen runelord from claiming, carrying, or using other items, and most higher-level risen runelords keep real magic items that remain behind after their death.

Ayavah.name: Ayavah
Ayavah.allSaves: +1 status to saves against spells and magic effects

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Bloodline Focus.name: Bloodline Focus
Bloodline Focus.description: When Ayavah Refocuses, she completely fills her focus pool.

Corruption of Sin.name: Corruption of Sin
Corruption of Sin.description: When Ayavah casts a bloodline spell using a Focus Point or one of the following spells: blister, disintegrate, divine wrath, enlarge, fear, or slow, she can choose to either give a target a –1 status penalty to AC for 1 round or gain a +2 status bonus to Intimidation checks for 1 round.

Legendary Sculptor.name: Legendary Sculptor
Legendary Sculptor.description: Ayavah makes Crafting checks associated with sculpture at legendary proficiency. If she rolls a failure on a Crafting check involving sculpture, she gets a success instead.

Reach Spell.name: Reach Spell
Reach Spell.description: If the next action Ayavah takes is to Cast a Spell that has a range, increase that spell's range by 30 feet.

Bittersweet Dreams.name: Bittersweet Dreams
Bittersweet Dreams.description:
The dramofir swishes their robes in a mesmerizing display that brings the dreams in the robes to life before the viewer's very eyes. Each creature within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} must attempt a @Check[will|dc:34] save or be filled with ennui.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Success For 1 round, the creature takes a -1 status penalty to attack rolls, saving throws, and skill checks, and all other emotion effects on it are suppressed.

Failure As success, but the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and the duration is [[/gmr 1d4 #Duration Bittersweet Dreams]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Failure As success, but the creature is also slowed 1, the status penalty is -2, and the duration is 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.4FginnDcOt4wfedf]{Effect: Bittersweet Dreams}

Surreal Anatomy.description: A dramofir has resistance 10 to precision damage and the extra damage from critical hits. If the resistance is greater than the extra damage, it reduces the extra damage to 0 but doesn't reduce the attack's normal damage.
Surreal Anatomy.name: Surreal Anatomy

Replace Dream.name: Replace Dream
Replace Dream.description:
Requirements The dramofir is adjacent to an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} or sleeping creature

Effect The dramofir licks the creature's forehead, places their hand in the same spot, and siphons the creature's dreams to incorporate into their robes.

If the target is affected by any mental effect altering their dreams, such as an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core-2.Actor.r3PNRpEir4BVjnCC]{Animate Dream's} curse of endless nightmares or a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Uqj344bezBq3ESdq]{Nightmare} spell, the dramofir attempts to counteract that effect (counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+26 #Counteract]]{+26}). Otherwise, the dramofir plucks a benign dream from the creature, and the target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:36] save.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} until the next time it gets a full night's rest.

Critical Failure As failure, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}, and Javownir casts a 6th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GP3wewkQXEPrLxYj]{Subconscious Suggestion} on the target (typically suggesting the target seeks out frightening situations so that their dreams become more nightmarish over time).

Javownir.name: Javownir
Javownir.publicNotes: Beings of inscrutable intent and incredible power, dramofirs hail from the Dreamlands and shamble across the multiverse in search of dreams to incorporate into their voluminous robes. Few people on the Material Plane dare trifle with dramofirs and instead treat them with respect, hoping that they'll simply take their chosen victims' dreams and then go away. Often, this is exactly what happens. Every now and then, however, in the process of siphoning an individual's dreams, the dramofir slays their victim without warning or apparent cause.

Multiple Reactions.name: Multiple Reactions
Multiple Reactions.description: The Ashen Man's untethered relationship with time gives him an additional reaction each round, though he still can't use more than one reaction on the same triggering action.

Curse of Destiny.name: Curse of Destiny
Curse of Destiny.description: When the Ashen Man hits a creature with a doomsday scepter Strike, he inflicts the cursed destiny held in trust for all creatures who live: a promise of future death. The target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:46] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}. On a critical failure, the target additionally becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} or increases its current doomed value by 1.

Slither Between Realities.name: Slither Between Realities
Slither Between Realities.description:
Frequency once per round

Trigger The Ashen Man begins or ends his turn

Effect The Great Beyond loses track of the Ashen Man, and he slips between reality's cracks, instantly transporting himself and any items he's wearing and holding from his current space to an unoccupied space within 100 feet that he can see.

Unravel Reality.name: Unravel Reality
Unravel Reality.description: The Ashen Man holds aloft his doomsday scepter then swings it violently downward as he rips the quintessence of the planes apart in a @Template[type:line|distance:60], creating difficult terrain and dealing @Damage[24d6[spirit]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature in the area (@Check[fortitude|dc:46|basic] save). The Ashen Man can't Unravel Reality again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Unravel Reality]]{1d4 rounds}.

Visions of the Forever.name: Visions of the Forever
Visions of the Forever.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Frequency once per round

Effect The Ashen Man shrinks the distance separating all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:120], brushing up against their minds and granting them vivid, waking dreams. All who share the hallucination experience entire millennia in an instant, rushed into a bleak future where they alone are stranded as the last living person in a destroyed world of ash and ruin. There, as the sole survivor of an empty reality where even the gods have fallen, they hear the Ashen Man's voice ring through their minds a final time, demanding an explanation that justifies their fate. Each affected creature attempts a @Check[will|dc:46] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and can break the telepathic contact, dismissing the vision.

Success The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round by the unnerving vision.

Failure The creature is filled with dread and compelled to answer the Ashen Man's question, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and slowed 1 for 1 minute. It can't reduce its frightened value below 1 for as long as it remains slowed.

Critical Failure As failure, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 4} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2}. In addition, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round.

equipment-Doomsday Scepter.name: Doomsday Scepter
equipment-Doomsday Scepter.description: While many greatclubs are intricately carved, others are little more than a sturdy tree branch. These massive clubs are too heavy to wield with only one hand.

Doomsday Scepter.name: Doomsday Scepter
Doomsday Scepter.description: When the Ashen Man turns his attention to a world, a projection of that planet manifests among the branches of the doomsday scepter he carries. He can wield this device in combat as a greatclub. If he releases his grip on the doomsday scepter or it's disarmed, it vanishes, after which the Ashen Man can cause it to appear in his hand again as a free action with the concentrate trait during his turn.

Entropy Sense.name: Entropy Sense
Entropy Sense.description: The ancient one can predict the presence of a creature through supernatural insight into chaotic probabilities and chance and builds a perception of reality from this information, allowing them to "see" as a precise sense in the listed range. Invisible creatures are visible to them, but veil of privacy prevents a creature from being detected via entropy sense automatically (without a counteract check).

Remove a Condition.name: 移除状态 Remove a Condition
Remove a Condition.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The Ashen Man ends one condition affecting him.

Cohesion Vulnerability.name: Cohesion Vulnerability
Cohesion Vulnerability.description: The Ashen Man is repulsed by an orderly reality. Whenever the Ashen Man sees a creature that was injured restored to its full Hit Points, he becomes obsessed with correcting the defiance of entropy. He takes @Damage[8d6[mental]] damage and can't use actions with the concentrate trait until he's dealt damage to that creature that reduces their Hit Point total from its maximum value.

Feast on Destruction.name: Feast on Destruction
Feast on Destruction.description: 120 feet. Wait long enough and reality always proves that all things begin so they can end. The Ashen Man is empowered whenever this belief is vindicated. When a creature in the aura gains the dying condition or increases its dying value, the Ashen Man becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} 1 for 1 round. He can use the extra action only to Stride or Strike.

Mutually Assured.name: Mutually Assured
Mutually Assured.description:
Trigger A creature within 10 feet deals damage to the Ashen Man

Effect Reality hurtles toward destruction. The Ashen Man makes a wretched claw Strike against the triggering creature.

Mythic Resilience (Fortitude and Will).name: Mythic Resilience (Fortitude and Will)
Mythic Resilience (Fortitude and Will).description: 该怪物将与其相关的豁免成功率比骰掷结果的成功度高一个等级。这不会与其他改变成功度的效果叠加，例如失能特征（自然1或20时除外）。怪物每次获得神话韧性时，可选择一项豁免。该能力应首先应用于该怪物的最高豁免。

No Breath.name: No Breath
No Breath.description: An ancient one doesn't breathe and is immune to effects that require breathing (such as inhaled poisons).

Otherworldly Mind.name: Otherworldly Mind
Otherworldly Mind.description: Whenever a creature targets the ancient one with a mental effect, that creature takes @Damage[8d8[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:43|basic] save). On a critical failure, the creature also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

The Connection Cuts Both Ways.name: The Connection Cuts Both Ways
The Connection Cuts Both Ways.description: Creatures the ancient one affected with a mental effect or communicated with telepathically within the last round can hijack the ancient one's telepathic connection; they automatically ignore the ancient one's immunity to auditory, emotion, and visual effects until the end of their current turn. They can additionally spend 1 Mythic Point as a free action to reach through the connection to manipulate the ancient one's mind, ignoring the ancient one's mythic resilience on Will saving throws.

Undying Myth.name: Undying Myth
Undying Myth.description:
Cost all of the Ancient One's Mythic Points

Trigger The Ashen Man would die and has at least 1 Mythic Point

Effect The Ashen Man remains standing and conscious, and recovers 50% of his maximum Hit Points.

Unified Timeline.name: Unified Timeline
Unified Timeline.description:
Trigger A creature ends its movement within 10 feet of the ancient one

Effect Ancient ones exist spread out across infinite times and places simultaneously and can shift themselves through their catalog of potentialities. The ancient one teleports themself and the triggering creature into empty squares within 10 feet of their respective positions, though the triggering creature can't be moved into hazardous terrain or to a place it can't stand. An unwilling creature can resist the teleportation with a successful @Check[will|dc:46] save.

Dismantle All Life.name: Dismantle All Life
Dismantle All Life.description: Time and entropy end all things, even the undead. When the ancient one's Strikes hit a creature with void healing, they deal vitality damage instead of void damage. The ancient one can't use their Strikes to restore Hit Points to living or undead creatures.

Recharge.name: Recharge
Recharge.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The Ashen Man regains an expended spell.

Reroll.name: Reroll
Reroll.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Trigger The Ashen Man fails a check

Effect The Ashen Man rerolls the check.

The Ashen Man.name: The Ashen Man
The Ashen Man.publicNotes:
In the Dimension of Time, creatures clad in tattered robes float between encapsulated bubbles of still, captured moments, untethered to any other place, unspeaking and unseeing. The few mortals to meet these enigmatic, faceless creatures have never known them to identify by any name other than the ancient ones, seemingly holding no identity (or no identity they wish to share) beyond their relationship with time.

The ancients profess to have always existed in the Dimension of Time, and for time to have always existed in the Great Beyond. Most reside in Stethelos, the storied city at the center of time, though they're also found wandering the Void, crossing the strangest corners of the Maelstrom where it lies between other planes, and occasionally, venturing into dark corners of the Universe. They serve at the will of Tawil at'Umr, the All in One and the One in All, an avatar of Yog-Sothoth lurking deep within time as Stethelos's caretaker. Though the ancient ones resemble their master in stature and attire, and though none would describe Tawil at'Umr as anything other than ancient in origin, most scholars consider "ancient one" a classification of its own separate from that of Great Old One, and Tawil at'Umr is definitively counted among the Great Old Ones by all who know it.

Where Yog-Sothoth is an embodiment of all space and time, an entity who concerns himself with guarding cosmic secrets, the ancient ones are philosophers and mystics seeking ever more enlightenment. They search, have searched, and will search across time indefinitely and, having found entropy and disorder, conclude this to be the Great Beyond's ultimate purpose. When a new creature dawns, it's pristine and whole—perfectly ordered—for but a single moment before it can be eroded by Pharasma's poison, accumulating decay, change, and chaos, until finally it reaches its ending, when time leaves a twilight creature broken and gone. Law and chaos, the ancient ones believe, aren't opposing or even separate forces, but a single expression of reality viewed from two angles, different from each other only in time.

How Old is Time?

Lying in parallel with the Great Beyond with a presence felt on nearly every plane, from the Inner Sphere to the Outer Rifts, the Dimension of Time holds too many secrets for a reality so seemingly omnipresent. Can a world truly be said to begin before time is there to start? Scholars say Pharasma is the oldest being in the Great Beyond, a survivor of some previous multiverse's collapse, but does the Lady of Graves predate time, or did she bring the Dimension of Time with her so history could begin everything anew?

Into the Dimension of Time

The Dimension of Time is one of the most difficult and complex realms in the Great Beyond to travel to, with restrictions on its access limiting all but the most powerful of planar travelers from visiting it. At the GM's discretion, though, items looted from an ancient one, or even just fragments torn from their robes, could function as the planar key needed to allow a PC to use interplanar teleport to access the Dimension of Time.

Insatiable Bore Worm Swarm.name: Insatiable Bore Worm Swarm
Insatiable Bore Worm Swarm.publicNotes:
A single finger-length bore worm is unpleasant but mostly innocuous. Ten thousand bore worms, on the other hand, pose a formidable threat to even seasoned adventurers. The countless worms form a roiling, rancid mass of acid and pain, capable of delivering a hideous death to any person or beast unable to escape them. Unfortunately for any creature other than a bore worm, most encounters involve swarms.

These Darklands vermin produce corrosive, noxious slime and deliver agonizing bites, whether as a revolting, wriggling swarm of finger-length worms or a single massive, lurching beast. Among Darklands communities, most inhabitants regard bore worms much in the same way surface cultures speak of maggots or cockroaches-with general disdain and revulsion. Children consider catching a single bore worm and using it to torment others a rite of passage, albeit a dangerous one.

The humble bore worm is a small and simple creature, both biologically and magically. These qualities allow it to adapt rapidly to different environments, some of them quite extreme, and also makes it susceptible to magical radiation and experimentation. Many a Darklands apprentice takes their first steps in the school of transmutation by practicing on these worms, while variations-both natural and cultivated-are scattered about beneath Golarion's surface.

Painful Devouring.name: Painful Devouring
Painful Devouring.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[8d6[acid]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:38|basic] save). Creatures that fail this save become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} from the swarm's painful bites. On a critical failure, the painful bites cause the creature to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2}. In either case, the slowed condition persists for 1 round.

Risen Runelord Xirie.name: Risen Runelord Xirie
Risen Runelord Xirie.publicNotes:

If he's slain, his soul can instantly jump to the closest risen runelord to replace them and continue the fight, unless the PCs can disable this defense during the second adventure in Revenge of the Runelords. Regardless of level, all risen runelords are mythic creatures and are immune to sleep effects.

This may change once the events of Revenge of the Runelords come to a conclusion, in which case the sinful foci for lust and pride become potential options for risen runelords of Sorshen or Xanderghul, but during Revenge of the Runelords, no risen runelords of lust or pride can exist.
