Remove a Condition.name: 移除状态 Remove a Condition
Remove a Condition.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The risen runelord ends one condition affecting them.

Beyond Life.name: Beyond Life
Beyond Life.description: A risen runelord may drink or eat for pleasure or entertainment, but they need not do so for nourishment and never suffer the effects of thirst or starvation.

Vanishing Death.name: Vanishing Death
Vanishing Death.description: When a risen runelord is slain, their body and (if manifested) polearm vanishes as the trapped legacy that was drawn upon to create them is set free, exploding outward in a riot of swirling color. This release of arcane energy blasts at the minds of nearby creatures. All creatures adjacent to a risen runelord during a Vanishing Death must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:34] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 24 hours (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) as fragments of their own memories are temporarily scrambled or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}. Other objects carried by the risen runelord fall to the ground.

Manifest Runelord's Polearm.name: Manifest Runelord's Polearm
Manifest Runelord's Polearm.description:
Requirements The risen runelord isn't holding a runelord's polearm

Effect The risen runelord causes their runelord's polearm to appear in one of their hands. The exact appearance of the polearm depends on the type wielded by the runelord in life, but these weapons are purely spiritual constructs that inflict mental damage on a Strike and vanish as soon as the risen runelord releases the weapon or dies.

Mythic Power.name: 神话之力 Mythic Power
Mythic Power.description: 该生物拥有 3 点神话点，并可以将这些神话点用于以下任何动作。

Quickened Casting.name: Quickened Casting
Quickened Casting.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect If the risen runelord's next action is to cast a cantrip or spell that's 4th-rank or lower, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

Recharge.name: Recharge
Recharge.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The risen runelord regains an expended spell slot or can use Quickened Casting again.

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt the risen runelord's spellcasting action, the risen runelord attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

Moment of Glory.name: Moment of Glory
Moment of Glory.description:
Trigger A creature moves (or falls) more than 60 feet down the shaft below the illusory throne

Effect All creatures in the shaft suddenly witness an endless night sky all around them, as if they were hurtling through outer space with no sign of any nearby planetary bodies. Each affected creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:40] save to resist being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) for 24 hours as the visual overwhelms them. The trap then rolls initiative.

A Falling Star's Memories.name: A Falling Star's Memories
A Falling Star's Memories.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:40] (master) to unweave the magic left in the wake of the Trinity Star's passage, @Check[thievery|dc:43] (expert) to etch temporary runes to siphon away the magic, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th rank; counteract DC 33) to counteract the magic; three successes are required to disable the trap. Once the PCs are within the trap's overwhelming illusion, they can still attempt these checks to disable it, but the check DCs increase by 2.
A Falling Star's Memories.hazarddescription: The shaft walls vanish and are replaced by an endless field of stars in all direction, as if the viewer were suddenly lost in outer space.
A Falling Star's Memories.routine:
A Voyage Through the Infinite (1 action) Every round on its turn, the trap inflicts all creatures in the shaft with the perception that they have been hurtling at an unimaginable speed through the vastness of space. The stars are so distant that no indication of movement can be observed or felt beyond that overwhelming mental conviction. At the same time, the creatures feel as if something unimaginably powerful and hungry is chasing them... and gaining on them. Any PC who looks over their shoulder sees that the stars are indeed winking out behind them, as if an immense black object were growing closer or as if the stars themselves were vanishing. While the PC's body is somehow protected by the vastness of space, their minds are not—each PC must attempt a @Check[will|dc:40] save.

Critical Success As success below, but the creature also realizes they're reliving the memories of Runelord Xanderghul—like him, they're escaping some sort of horrific fate and are hurtling toward Golarion. The next time this creature achieves a critical success against this trap, they suddenly see Golarion loom large, and as they witness their "crash" into the Throne of the Troll King, they suddenly wake, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, in area C1 at the heart Xin-Cyrusian. If any other PCs are still trapped in the Falling Star's Memories, a PC in Xin-Cyrusian knows instinctively that they can call out to those trapped PCs—each PC in Xin-Cyrusian who does so reduces the save DC against A Voyage Through the Infinite for those still trapped by 5.

Success The creature realizes they're experiencing the path the Trinity Star took through the cosmos and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature's grip on reality fades as they experience what seems like years or even decades of hurtling adrift through a vast expanse. The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 24 hours or increases the value of their stupefied condition by 1 if they're already stupefied.

Critical Failure As failure, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (or increase the stupefied condition by 2).

Special If this trap would cause a creature's stupefied condition to exceed @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 5}, the creature instead "crashes" to the ground on the hilltop outside, about ten feet from the Throne of the Troll King. The creature takes @Damage[10d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic] save), and their stupefied condition now has an unlimited duration.

Spacious Stomach.name: Spacious Stomach
Spacious Stomach.description: A ravenous crypt has a 10-foot-space inside of it. A creature swallowed by the ravenous crypt isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or slowed, and the creature doesn't need to hold its breath. It can attack the ravenous crypt normally. Because it isn't grabbed, it can't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} the crypt, but it can break free by dealing bludgeoning damage to the crypt equal to the crypt's Rupture value or by Forcing Open the crypt's doors with a successful @Check[athletics|dc:34] check.

Thrash.name: Thrash
Thrash.description: Each adjacent creature and each creature swallowed by the ravenous crypt takes @Damage[5d10[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:34|basic] save). Swallowed creatures take a –2 circumstance penalty to this save. On a critical failure, a creature is also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Construct Armor (Hardness 15).name: Construct Armor (Hardness 15)
Construct Armor (Hardness 15).description: The ravenous crypt reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to its Hardness. Once it's reduced to less than 100 Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, removing its Hardness and reducing the crypt's Armor Class to 32.

Reduced to Rubble.name: Reduced to Rubble
Reduced to Rubble.description: When the ravenous crypt is reduced to 0 Hit Points, its space becomes an area of difficult terrain, and any creatures swallowed by the crypt fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} in a space of their choice within the area.

Sap Strength.name: Sap Strength
Sap Strength.description:
A creature that takes void damage from the ravenous crypt's Swallow Whole ability must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:34] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} for 1 minute.

Ravenous Crypt.name: Ravenous Crypt
Ravenous Crypt.publicNotes:
When tomb robbers loot the dead, sometimes the resting places of those victims animate to avenge them. This happens most frequently when the entombed person was a particularly greedy, gluttonous, or vindictive individual in life. Other ravenous crypts arise spontaneously in places where energy from the Void flows freely into other planes.

Boneyard Guardians

Ravenous crypts are occasionally encountered in the Boneyard, roaming that vast necropolis like packs of hungry dogs, although they quickly come to heel while in Pharasma's presence. This behavior has led some scholars to posit that the constructs are created at the behest—or at least with the blessing—of the Lady of Graves. Magrim, the demigod of the dwarven afterlife, is also believed to have some connection to ravenous crypts, as suggested by the fact the pediments of many crypts are carved with the scowling visages of dwarven elders.

Mythic Power.name: 神话之力 Mythic Power
Mythic Power.description: 该生物拥有 3 点神话点，并可以将这些神话点用于以下任何动作。

Susceptible to Confusion.name: 易于困惑 Susceptible to Confusion
Susceptible to Confusion.description: 鲍伦的神话韧性不适用于其针对 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ] 所进行的意志豁免检定。若鲍伦在其回合开始时处于困惑状态，他将受到 @Damage[6d10[mental]] 伤害。

Remove a Condition.name: 移除状态 Remove a Condition
Remove a Condition.description:
花费 1神话点

效果 该生物结束一项正在影响它的状态。

Altered Weather.name: 改变天气 Altered Weather
Altered Weather.description:
海怪能重塑范围2英里内的天气，效果等同于以海怪为中心的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.XkDCzMIyc0YOjw05]仪式，何种天气取决于海怪的心情，由GM判断。如果海怪死亡，天气立即恢复正常。

鲍伦目前满足于其被崇拜的地位，故而周边天气保持平静。

Undying Myth.name: （神话）不灭神话 Undying Myth
Undying Myth.description:
花费 鲍伦所有的神话点

触发 鲍伦将要死亡，并且至少拥有1点神话点

效果 鲍伦保持站立和意识，并且恢复其最大HP的50%。

Constrict.name: 紧勒 Constrict
Constrict.description:
@Damage[(2d10+17)[bludgeoning]]，一次 @Check[fortitude|dc:40|basic]。若豁免失败，正在屏住呼吸的生物将损失相当于 [[/gmr 1d4 #Lost rounds of air from Constrict]] 轮的空气。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Constrict]

Curse of Flawed History.name: 瑕疵历史的诅咒 Curse of Flawed History
Curse of Flawed History.description:
豁免 @Check[will|dc:37]

效果 目标难以分辨可能的历史与过去真实发生的事件之间的差异。该生物进行 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo] 的检定时受到–2状态减值（若大失败则为–4）。此诅咒无限期持续。

Double Attack.name: 双重攻击 Double Attack
Double Attack.description:
海怪用两只不同的腕足或触手进行两次打击，每次针对不同的目标。此能力在计算海怪的多重攻击减值时视为两次攻击，但是多重攻击减值在两次攻击结束后才会累积。

如果海怪命中后使用擒获动作，则它可以对此能力命中的任意目标进行擒获。

Ink Cloud.name: 墨水云 Ink Cloud
Ink Cloud.description:
The kraken releases a cloud of black, venomous ink in an @Template[emanation|distance:80]. This cloud has no effect outside water.

Creatures inside the ink cloud are exposed to retrocognitive ink poison and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} while inside the cloud.

The kraken can't use Ink Cloud again for [[/br 2d6 #Recharge Ink Cloud]]{2d6 rounds}, and the cloud dissipates after 1 minute.

Jet.name: Jet
Jet.description: The kraken moves through the water up to 280 feet in a straight line without triggering reactions.

Recharge.name: Recharge
Recharge.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Baolen regains an expended spell.

Retrocognitive Ink.name: Retrocognitive Ink
Retrocognitive Ink.description:
Baolen is immune to this poison

Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:40]

Maximum Duration 10 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[5d6[mental]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}, and the target is exposed to the curse of flawed history (1 round)

Baolen.name: 鲍伦 Baolen
Baolen.publicNotes: 海怪是残酷而聪明的拥有乌贼外形的海中巨兽。无论船只、鲸鱼还是英雄都难逃其口。由于海怪对于他们的老对头底栖魔鱼们的仇恨和嫉妒，许多海怪把巢穴建立在后者沉没的城市里，依照古老的传说寻找遗失已久的奥法秘密。

Remove a Condition.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Alaznist ends one condition affecting her.
Remove a Condition.name: 移除状态 Remove a Condition

Quickened Casting.name: Quickened Casting
Quickened Casting.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect If Alaznist's next action is to cast a cantrip or spell that's 4th-rank or lower, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

Recharge.name: Recharge
Recharge.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Alaznist regains an expended spell slot or can use Quickened Casting again.

equipment-Wand of Falling Stars (Rank 9).name: Wand of Falling Stars (Rank 9)
equipment-Wand of Falling Stars (Rank 9).description:
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.jrBa9deU2ULFWvSl]{Falling Stars}

This baton is about a foot long and contains a single spell. The appearance typically relates to the spell within.

Activate Cast a Spell

Frequency once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You Cast the Spell at the indicated rank.

Craft Requirements Supply a casting of the spell at the listed rank.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.

Beyond Life.name: Beyond Life
Beyond Life.description: A risen runelord may drink or eat for pleasure or entertainment, but they need not do so for nourishment and never suffer the effects of thirst or starvation.

Mythic Defenses.name: Mythic Defenses
Mythic Defenses.description: Whenever an attacker rolls a critical hit against Alaznist, the attacker must reroll the attack roll and take the new result.

Mythic Resilience (Reflex and Will).name: Mythic Resilience (Reflex and Will)
Mythic Resilience (Reflex and Will).description: 该怪物将与其相关的豁免成功率比骰掷结果的成功度高一个等级。这不会与其他改变成功度的效果叠加，例如失能特征（自然1或20时除外）。怪物每次获得神话韧性时，可选择一项豁免。该能力应首先应用于该怪物的最高豁免。

Undying Myth.name: Undying Myth
Undying Myth.description:
Cost all of Alaznist's Mythic Points

Trigger Alaznist would die and has at least 1 Mythic Point

Effect Alaznist remains standing and conscious and recovers @Damage[193[healing]] Hit Points.

Vanishing Death.description: When risen Alaznist is slain, her body and (if manifested) polearm vanish as the trapped legacy that was drawn upon to create them is set free, exploding outward in a riot of swirling color. This release of arcane energy blasts at the minds of nearby creatures. All creatures adjacent to Alaznist during Vanishing Death must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:39] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 24 hours (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) as fragments of their own memories are temporarily scrambled or hidden. Other objects carried by Alaznist fall to the ground.
Vanishing Death.name: Vanishing Death

Manifest Runelord's Polearm.name: Manifest Runelord's Polearm
Manifest Runelord's Polearm.description:
Requirements Alaznist is not holding a runelord's polearm

Effect Alaznist causes her polearm—a ranseur—to appear in one of her hands. This weapon is a purely spiritual construct that inflicts mental damage on a Strike and vanishes as soon as she releases the weapon or dies.

Mythic Power.name: 神话之力 Mythic Power
Mythic Power.description: 该生物拥有 3 点神话点，并可以将这些神话点用于以下任何动作。

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt the risen runelord's spellcasting action, the risen runelord attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

Risen Runelord Alaznist.name: Risen Runelord Alaznist
Risen Runelord Alaznist.publicNotes:
Risen runelords are created by a powerful ritual invented by Runelord Xanderghul—a ritual called raise runelord. All risen runelords are at least level 11 creatures. Once created, a risen runelord has no capacity to become more powerful, as they are manifestations of their legacy at a specific point in time (although given enough time and resources, a risen runelord could potentially find a way to overcome this limitation on self-improvement).

A risen runelord has a modicum of free will, but as long as the one who created them via raise runelord lives, they're bound to their creator's desires. A risen runelord ordered to undertake obviously self-destructive actions might, at the GM's discretion, resist the command and could potentially even break free of their creator's control.

Since raise runelord draws upon a runelord's legacy as it exists within the Dreamlands, no risen runelord can ever sleep or dream. Xanderghul can use a risen runelord in a special way: he can use any risen runelord (including ones he didn't create) as a spare body. If he's slain, his soul can instantly jump to the closest risen runelord to replace them and continue the fight, unless the PCs can disable this defense during the second adventure in Revenge of the Runelords. Regardless of level, all risen runelords are mythic creatures and are immune to sleep effects.

Lust and Pride

Of the seven sins, lust and pride are unique among the runelords for these sins were only ever represented by a single runelord—and both still live during the events of this Adventure Path. This may change once the events of Revenge of the Runelords come to a conclusion, in which case the sinful foci for lust and pride become potential options for risen runelords of Sorshen or Xanderghul, but during Revenge of the Runelords, no risen runelords of lust or pride can exist.

Risen Runelord Gear

A risen runelord's polearm is an extension of their being and cannot exist without them, vanishing upon their death. This doesn't prevent a risen runelord from claiming, carrying, or using other items, and most higher-level risen runelords keep real magic items that remain behind after their death.

equipment-Robes of Xin-Edasseril.name: Robes of Xin-Edasseril
equipment-Robes of Xin-Edasseril.description: These robes, the traditional raiment of the runelord of envy, function as +3 greater resilient antimagic greater energy-resistant explorer's clothing. The energy resistance granted by these robes can be selected from acid, cold, electricity, or fire when you perform your daily preparations—without these preparations, the robes default to cold resistance. The robe's pockets function as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.V1XhLQPWjdQz759K]{Retrieval Belt (Major)}.

equipment-Aeon Stone (Amplifying).name: Aeon Stone (Amplifying)
equipment-Aeon Stone (Amplifying).description:
Over millennia, these mysterious, intricately cut gemstones have been hoarded by mystics and fanatics hoping to discover their secrets. Despite their myriad forms and functions, these stones are purportedly all fragments of crystal tools used by otherworldly entities to construct the universe in primeval times.

When you invest one of these precisely shaped crystals, the stone orbits your head instead of being worn on your body. You can stow an aeon stone with an Interact action, and an orbiting stone can be snatched out of the air with a successful Disarm action against you. A stowed or removed stone remains invested, but its effects are suppressed until you return it to orbit your head again.

There are various types of aeon stones, each with a different appearance and magical effect. Each aeon stone also gains a resonant power when slotted into a special magical item called a wayfinder.

An Amplifying aeon stone must be activated to provide a benefit. The resonant power grants you a +2 item bonus to Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion checks-whichever corresponds to the tradition of the last spell you enhanced with this aeon stone.

Activate—Amplify 1 (concentrate, spellshape)

Effect If your next action is to Cast a Spell, that spell's rank is 1 higher (maximum 10th rank) for the purposes of counteracting and being counteracted.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.kdcVvwVVsttZgX1Y]{Effect: Aeon Stone Resonance (Amplifying)}

equipment-Aeon Stone (Nourishing).name: Aeon Stone (Nourishing)
equipment-Aeon Stone (Nourishing).description:
Over millennia, these mysterious, intricately cut gemstones have been hoarded by mystics and fanatics hoping to discover their secrets. Despite their myriad forms and functions, these stones are purportedly all fragments of crystal tools used by otherworldly entities to construct the universe in primeval times.

When you invest one of these precisely shaped crystals, the stone orbits your head instead of being worn on your body. You can stow an aeon stone with an Interact action, and an orbiting stone can be snatched out of the air with a successful Disarm action against you. A stowed or removed stone remains invested, but its effects are suppressed until you return it to orbit your head again.

There are various types of aeon stones, each with a different appearance and magical effect. Each aeon stone also gains a resonant power when slotted into a special magical item called a wayfinder.

After you've invested and worn this transparent stone for a week continuously, you no longer need to eat or drink. This time resets if you remove the aeon stone or it's invested by someone else.

The resonant power allows you to cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.W69zswpj0Trdy5rj]{Air Bubble} as a primal innate spell once per day.

equipment-Aeon Stone (Preserving).name: Aeon Stone (Preserving)
equipment-Aeon Stone (Preserving).description:
Over millennia, these mysterious, intricately cut gemstones have been hoarded by mystics and fanatics hoping to discover their secrets. Despite their myriad forms and functions, these stones are purportedly all fragments of crystal tools used by otherworldly entities to construct the universe in primeval times.

When you invest one of these precisely shaped crystals, the stone orbits your head instead of being worn on your body. You can stow an aeon stone with an Interact action, and an orbiting stone can be snatched out of the air with a successful Disarm action against you. A stowed or removed stone remains invested, but its effects are suppressed until you return it to orbit your head again.

There are various types of aeon stones, each with a different appearance and magical effect. Each aeon stone also gains a resonant power when slotted into a special magical item called a wayfinder.

This red crystalline star covers you in a faint aura when you are subject to lingering wounds. You gain resistance 3 to persistent damage. At the end of any turn where the persistent damage can't overcome this resistance, end that condition.

The resonant power allows you to cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SnjhtQYexDtNDdEg]{Stabilize} as a primal innate cantrip.

equipment-Belt of Long Life.name: Belt of Long Life
equipment-Belt of Long Life.description:
This thick leather belt is engraved with imagery of an ancient tree. You gain 15 temporary Hit Points the first time you invest the belt in a day. When you invest the belt, you either increase your Constitution modifier by 1 or increase it to +4, whichever would give you a higher value.

Activate—Call Upon the Ancient Life 1 (manipulate)

Frequency once per day

Effect You draw upon the lifegiving energy of the tree on the belt to gain rapid healing. For [[/br 2d4 #rounds]]{2d4 rounds}, at the start of your turn each round, you recover 15 Hit Points.

Spell Effect: Hidden Mind.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.C2w3YfBKjIRS07DP]{Hidden Mind}

You gain a +4 status bonus to saves against mental effects.
Spell Effect: Hidden Mind.name: Spell Effect: Hidden Mind

Undying Myth.description:
Cost all of Belimarius's Mythic Points

Trigger Belimarius would die and has at least 1 Mythic Point

Effect Belimarius remains standing and conscious, and recovers @Damage[175[healing]] Hit Points.
Undying Myth.name: Undying Myth

Quickened Casting.name: Quickened Casting
Quickened Casting.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect If Runelord Belimarius's next action is to cast a cantrip or spell of 8th rank or lower, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

equipment-Belimarius's Invidious Halberd.name: Belimarius's Invidious Halberd
equipment-Belimarius's Invidious Halberd.description:
Perception +29; darkvision, imprecise hearing within 60 feet

Communication speech (Azlanti, Elven, Thassilonian)

Skills Arcana [[/gmr 1d20+33 #Arcana]]{+33}, Deception [[/gmr 1d20+29 #Deception]]{+29}, Society [[/gmr 1d20+31 #Society]]{+31}

Int +8, Wis +6, Cha +4

Will [[/gmr 1d20+31 #Will]]{+31}

Belimarius's Invidious Halberd is a +3 greater striking keen spell reservoir high-grade dawnsilver halberd (at this time, their spell reservoir contains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WsUwpfmhKrKwoIe3]{Slow}). As the halberd passed from the hands of one runelord of envy to the next, the halberd's self-loathing and hatred of the arcane spellcasters they were forced to serve grew. Their own limited arcane magic paled in comparison to their powerful wielders, after all, and the halberd seethed at this perceived inequality. They only grudgingly abide their wielders—runelord or otherwise—and are only truly happy when they're used to cut down those who can cast arcane spells. The halberd can use 3 actions per turn, acting on their wielder's turn, and has a reaction. These actions and reaction don't count against their wielder's.

Activate—Absorb Arcana r (arcane, concentrate)

Trigger The halberd damages a creature capable of casting arcane spells

Effect The halberd attempts to absorb one of the creature's prepared arcane spells or arcane spell slots. If the creature struck fails a @Check[will|dc:37] save, it loses an arcane spell (or lose an unused arcane spell slot) as if it'd cast that spell. The spell or slot lost is randomly determined from the highest rank available, starting at 6th rank and working down. The halberd passes this absorbed energy on to their wielder, who becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round and can use the extra action only to Strike with the halberd.

Activate—Detonate Magic 2 (arcane, concentrate)

Frequency once per day

Effect The halberd casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kUSShxXzY1sPtJA0]{Detonate Magic} (DC 37).

Activate—Manipulate Mind 2 (arcane, concentrate)

Frequency once per hour

Effect The halberd casts a 9th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.FhOaQDTSnsY7tiam]{Rewrite Memory} (DC 37).

Activate—Shattermind f (arcane, concentrate)

Trigger The halberd critically hits a creature capable of casting arcane spells

Effect The creature struck is targeted with a 9th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5BbU1V6wGSGbrmRD]{Never Mind} spell (DC 37).

Destruction Belimarius's Invidious Halberd is destroyed if it's hurled under the feet of the Oliphaunt of Jandelay while there's no current runelord of envy living in the world.

equipment-Wand of Mountain Resilience (R.name: Wand of Mountain Resilience (Rank 4)
equipment-Wand of Mountain Resilience (R.description:
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2BV2yYPfVJ5zirZt]{Mountain Resilience}

This baton is about a foot long and contains a single spell. The appearance typically relates to the spell within.

Activate Cast a Spell

Frequency once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You Cast the Spell at the indicated rank.

Craft Requirements Supply a casting of the spell at the listed rank.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.

Remove a Condition.name: 移除状态 Remove a Condition
Remove a Condition.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Belimarius ends one condition affecting her.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Immortality.name: Immortality
Immortality.description: Belimarius is immortal and immune to the negative effects of aging and disease, and she's resistant to mental damage. Her immortality doesn't prevent her death from other means.

Never Enough.name: Never Enough
Never Enough.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet casts a spell with the air, earth, fire, metal, water, wood, or void trait that deals damage

Effect Belimarius seethes with jealousy at another spellcaster's magical accomplishments. She regains @Damage[25[healing]] Hit Points, and until the end of her next turn, Belimarius's spell DC increases by 1, and her spell attacks gain a +1 circumstance bonus.

Spell Riposte.name: Spell Riposte
Spell Riposte.description:
Trigger Belimarius is the target of a spell she's aware of

Effect Belimarius attempts to counteract the triggering spell with a [[/r 1d20+35 #Counteract]]{+35} counteract modifier and a counteract rank of 10. If the triggering spell would be counteracted, it instead continues with the caster as a target instead of Belimarius.

Manifest Halberd.name: Manifest Halberd
Manifest Halberd.description:
Requirements Belimarius has a free hand and isn't holding her Invidious Halberd

Effect Belimarius calls her Invidious Halberd, and it appears in one of her hands.

Mythic Ascension.name: Mythic Ascension
Mythic Ascension.description:
Trigger Runelord Belimarius reduces a mythic creature to 0 HP, or the PCs take more than 24 hours to confront her after securing entrance to the Eye of Desire

Effect The warshard Belimarius has fused with the Runewell of Lust flares with a sudden flash of blood-red light. Belimarius gains the mythic trait, 3 Mythic Points, and her Mythic Powers. In time, she might develop additional mythic powers, but only if she survives her encounter with the PCs.

Sacrifice Warshard.name: Sacrifice Warshard
Sacrifice Warshard.description:
Trigger Belimarius begins her turn

Requirements Belimarius has the warshard of Gorum held in a hand

Effect While its mythic potential and divine power has largely been used to transform the Eye of Desire and the Runewell of Lust into the forms described in Chapter 1 to enable her imminent mythic ascension, enough power remains within to generate one final effect. With a quick motion, Belimarius crushes the mostly depleted warshard she holds in her hand, destroying it and causing red rain to cascade down around her in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:120] (which easily fills the entirety of the Eye of Desire). Allies in this area (Belimarius and her two knights of malice) become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 minute but can use the extra action only to Strike with a melee weapon. Foes in the area (including the PCs) must attempt a @Check[will|dc:41] save.

Critical Success The creature absorbs some of Gorum's legacy and gains 1 Mythic Point that they must spend before the end of their next turn.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is overwhelmed with despair at Gorum's death and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Critical Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} with despair at Gorum's death. At the end of each of its turns, the creature can attempt a @Check[will|dc:41] save to end the effect, with the DC lowered by 2 each subsequent round.

Recharge.name: Recharge
Recharge.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Belimarius regains an expended spell.

Belimarius.name: Belimarius
Belimarius.allSaves: +1 status vs. magical effects, +4 status vs. mental effects HP 350; Immunities aging, disease; R

Pyroclastic Mukradi.name: 火山碎岩三头蜈蚣 Pyroclastic Mukradi

Spitting Rage.name: 报复喷吐 Spitting Rage
Spitting Rage.description:
触发 一个生物对三头蜈蚣造成重击。

效果 三头蜈蚣的能量吐息重新充能。作为此反应动作的一部分，它可以立即进行能量吐息。直到下次能量吐息自然充能完毕之前，它无法再使用此反应动作。

Breathe Energy.name: 能量吐息 Breathe Energy
Breathe Energy.description:
三头蜈蚣选择它的三个头其中之一吐息一道能量；区域内的所有生物必须进行@Check[reflex|dc:36|basic|options:area-effect]豁免。

三头蜈蚣在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breathe Energy]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用吐息能力。

  • 烈焰之喉 Flame Maw（火焰）@Template[cone|distance:60]，@Damage[16d6[fire]|options:area-damage]伤害
  • 电击之喉 Shock Maw（电击）@Template[line|distance:120]，@Damage[16d6[electricity]|options:area-damage]伤害
  • 烟雾之喉 Smoke Maw (毒素) @Template[type:cone|distance:60] 毒雾 @Damage[16d6[poison]|options:area-damage] 伤害.

Tremorsense (Imprecise) 60 feet.name: 震颤感知（模糊感官）60尺 Tremorsense (Imprecise) 60 feet

Remove a Condition.name: 移除状态 Remove a Condition
Remove a Condition.description:
花费 1 神话点

效果 火山碎岩三头蜈蚣结束一项正在影响它的状态。

Mythic Resilience (Fortitude).name: 神话韧性（强韧） Mythic Resilience (Fortitude)
Mythic Resilience (Fortitude).description: 该怪物将与其相关的豁免成功率比骰掷结果的成功度高一个等级。这不会与其他改变成功度的效果叠加，例如失能特征（自然1或20时除外）。怪物每次获得神话韧性时，可选择一项豁免。该能力应首先应用于该怪物的最高豁免。

Partitioned Anatomy.name: 分段结构 Partitioned Anatomy
Partitioned Anatomy.description:
触发 三头蜈蚣将要陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]、@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]、@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]状态。

效果 三头蜈蚣把削弱状态阻断在它神经系统的特定部分，忽视其效果，但是它必须选择自己一个头在效果持续期间进入休眠状态。在这段时间内这个头不能进行打击或能量吐息（Breathe Energy）。如果三头蜈蚣所有头都处于休眠状态，则无法使用此能力。

Mythic Power.name: 神话之力 Mythic Power
Mythic Power.description: 该生物拥有 3 点神话点，并可以将这些神话点用于以下任何动作。

Pull Apart.name: 撕扯 Pull Apart
Pull Apart.description:
三头蜈蚣用不同的两个头对同一个目标进行两次打击。如果同时命中，目标承受额外@Damage[(2d12+13)[slashing]]伤害，@Check[fortitude|dc:36|basic]豁免。如果目标大失败则被撕成碎片并死亡。

三头蜈蚣的多重攻击减值在此项行动的两次攻击动作都结束之后才会累积。

Recharge.name: 再充能 Recharge
Recharge.description:
花费 1 神话点

效果 火山碎岩三头蜈蚣额外获得一次能量吐息的使用次数。

Thrash.name: 连环击 Thrash
Thrash.description: 三头蜈蚣对触及范围内每个目标分别进行一次打击。它可以每个头各进行一次打击，进行一次尾打击，以及任意次数的腿打击。每次攻击都承受-2环境减值，并计入三头蜈蚣的多重攻击减值，但是多重攻击减值在此项行动的全部攻击动作都结束之后才会累积。

Pyroclastic Mukradi.publicNotes: 三头蜈蚣是可怕的蜈蚣状生物，长着三颗头的掠食者，拥有诸多杀戮，焚烧，肢解的毁灭手段。传说在幽暗地域（Darklands）存在一种三头蜈蚣的变种。这些变种的三头蜈蚣拥有黑色的鳞片，并且头部会喷出黑色的酸性粘液，这种粘液在被三头蜈蚣重新吸收之前会变成活物。

Aethusa's Prison.routine: (2 actions) The prison uses its first action to Self-Repair. If the hazard has less than its maximum Hit Points, it then uses its Chromatic Eruption action.
Aethusa's Prison.reset: The trap deactivates and then resets automatically when it repairs to its maximum Hit Points.

Chromatic Eruption.name: Chromatic Eruption
Chromatic Eruption.description:
Requirements The prison has less than its maximum Hit Points

Effect Tendrils of uncontained magical energy lash at creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20], dealing @Damage[10d6[untyped]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:37|basic] save) of a randomly determined type. Roll [[/gmr 1d4]]: 1–acid, 2–cold, 3–electricity, 4–fire.

Lockdown Protocol.name: Lockdown Protocol
Lockdown Protocol.description:
Trigger The prison takes any damage

Effect The prison uses its Chromatic Eruption action as part of this reaction, then gains immunity to the triggering damage type until the hazard resets. The hazard then rolls initiative.

Self-Repair.name: Self-Repair
Self-Repair.description: The prison regains @Damage[30[healing]] Hit Points. Then, if the prison is at maximum Hit Points, the hazard deactivates and immediately resets.

Energy Immunity.name: Energy Immunity
Energy Immunity.description:
Trigger The prison takes acid, cold, electricity, or fire damage

Effect The prison takes the damage but then gains immunity to the triggering damage type until the hazard resets.

Aethusa's Prison.name: Aethusa's Prison
Aethusa's Prison.disable: @Check[nature|dc:42] (legendary) or @Check[crafting|dc:45] (master) to remove an immunity the prison currently has to one of the following damage types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire (this effect lasts until the prison uses its Energy Immunity reaction to regain that immunity); @Check[arcana|dc:42] (master) to fortify the pedestal's containment runes, preventing the prison from using its Chromatic Eruption action for 1 round and causing it to suffer feedback that inflicts @Damage[20[untyped]] damage (this damage bypasses the prison's hardness and immunities); @Check[thievery|dc:42] (master) or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th rank; counteract DC 34) to suppress the pedestal's containment runes for 1 round, preventing the prison from using its Self-Repair action and causing it to suffer feedback that inflicts @Damage[20[untyped]] damage (this damage bypasses the prison's hardness and immunities). Unlike most hazards, Aethusa's prison can't be disabled, but it can be destroyed by reducing it to 0 Hit Points.
Aethusa's Prison.hazarddescription: A roiling sphere of chromatic energy floats above a pedestal marked with arcane symbols.

Earthfall.stealthdetails: @Check[Astronomy Lore|dc:42] (master) or @Check[nature|dc:45] (legendary) to chart the meteor's trajectory, @Check[society|dc:50] (master) to recall information on Xin-Bakrakhan and how it was destroyed during Earthfall
Earthfall.name: Earthfall
Earthfall.disable: @Check[Ocean Lore|dc:42] (expert) or @Check[nature|dc:45] (master) or Survival (master) to chart the flood paths of the coming waves, @Check[crafting|dc:50] (legendary) to reinforce a shelter
Earthfall.routine:
(5 minutes) Only the first five minutes of this disaster directly impact the PCs, but during that time, they must contend with the combination of a megatsunami and meteor shower.

Meteor Shower: As meteor shower, but @Damage[7d10[bludgeoning]] damage and @Damage[15d6[fire]] damage to all characters (@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic] save). If at least half the PCs succeeded at Prepare checks, only one randomly determined PC is affected by the meteor shower rather than the whole party.

Tsunami: If at least half the PCs succeed on Prepare checks, they avoid all effects of the megatsunami until the last minute, at which point they're affected as if they were unprepared. Many of Xin-Bakrakhan's citizens are powerful wizards or otherwise have access to flight, be it by spell, wings, or flying minions, but their retreat into the skies above is chaotic. A PC capable of flight (or who is carried aloft by a flying ally) for an entire minute can avoid the tsunami's effects if they succeed at a @Check[acrobatics|dc:35] check to Maneuver in Flight to avoid mid-air collisions with others or falling meteors—on a failure they're forced back into the dangerous waters below and take a –2 circumstance penalty to saves against the tsunami's effects.

The tsunami floods into the lowest elevation area on the 2nd minute, then proceeds up into the higher regions as shown on the map on each of the following minutes. A PC in the area is affected as the standard megatsunami, but @Damage[(6d12+35)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:42|basic] save) when they're first struck and then @Damage[(4d12+25)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic]) each minute they're carried along by the wave.

Gavergash.name: 加弗加什 Gavergash
Gavergash.hp: 再生25（由于电击或火焰失效）

Mythic Power.description: 该生物拥有 3 点神话点，并可以将这些神话点用于以下任何动作。

Furious Roar.name: 狂怒咆哮 Furious Roar
Furious Roar.description:
触发 战争领袖承受电击或火焰伤害

效果 战争领袖使用它的原始咆哮，如果它意识到了伤害的来源，则能够向来源行走一次。若战争领袖具有持续火焰伤害，它能尝试@Check[flat|dc:15]检定来将其移除。

Awaken Totem.name: 唤醒图腾 Awaken Totem
Awaken Totem.description:
需求 加弗加什与一个图腾相邻

触发 加弗加什在本轮先使用了一个动作来施放法术

效果 加弗加什对其中一个图腾发动一次近战打击，并用他的鸦喙或利爪将其击碎，将他最近施放的法术的残余魔力注入图腾，使其在令人目眩的色彩爆发中爆炸。任何在图腾的一个 @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] 内的非巨魔生物必须尝试一次 @Check[will|dc:39] 豁免。

大成功 该生物不受影响，且在24小时内对唤醒图腾暂时免疫。

成功 该生物不受影响。

失败 该生物在加弗加什的下一回合结束前陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]。

大失败 该生物陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]1分钟。

Primordial Roar.name: 原始咆哮 Primordial Roar
Primordial Roar.description:
巨魔战争领袖发出野兽般的咆哮。@Template[emanation|distance:100]区域内的每名非巨魔生物都必须尝试@Check[will|dc:29]豁免。这些生物之后会临时免疫10分钟。

大成功 生物不受影响。

成功 生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}。

失败 生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}。

大失败 生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 3}。

Recharge.name: 再充能 Recharge
Recharge.description:
花费 1 神话点

效果 加弗加什恢复一个已消耗的法术。

Gavergash.publicNotes:
长寿的巨魔有时会强忍着饥饿和痛苦的双重干扰，为了了解周遭的世界而踏上前路。为了掌控自己的再生能力，它们学会了使用粗糙的盔甲复盖自己，这些盔甲缓慢地与它们的表层皮肉融为了一体。以这种盔甲为标准，辅以自己那卓越的才智，这些战争领袖集结了各种各样的巨魔，在整个劫掠的大队中为它服务。

本文列出的战争领袖是一名森林巨魔，不过其他类型的巨魔也能够成为战争领袖。许多战争领袖掌握了最适合它们家园周遭环境的战争策略。

残忍、嘴角漏着口水、所向披靡的野兽：这是村民对名为巨魔的骇人怪兽的常规描述。这些故事起源于毫无疑问的事实。巨魔的肉体会无限制地再生，如果不及时削减的话甚至会长出异常的肢体或额外的头颅，而供养这不受限制的增生所需要的是无边的饥饿。然而，即便是在狼吞虎咽地进食的过程中，巨魔也会找到机会来嘲弄他们的猎物，并对其施加轻微的虐待行为。

巨魔的生存能力极端强大，以至于他们相信哪怕最碎小的肉片也能缓慢再生，蒙全地之力复生的同时极端痛苦。尽管痛苦难耐，但巨魔宣称这种不可破解的生命力源自其造物主的祝福。几乎没有巨魔听说过恶魔的讥笑，后者宣称这是其造物主的诅咒，造物主将巨魔自高空抛下、缚于大地，令其永远无法回升。

巨魔偏好独居占有所有食物。在极少数的情况下，一头年长且强大的巨魔会领导一群巨魔。这些战争领袖狡猾到能带领自己的部落进行毁灭性的袭击和屠杀，它们的存在会永久地改变周遭的生态系统。这种与周遭环境的联系是巨魔最常遭到误解的方面，而这一点随着巨魔的年龄和力量的增长变得愈发尖锐。这并不是说巨魔是大自然的英勇守护者。它们生性凶残且领地意识极强，且甘愿彻底毁灭自己的领地仅求一日饱腹。
Gavergash.blurb: 变体男性巨魔战争首领
Gavergash.ac: （褪下护甲后为26外加全域视野）

Manifest Runelord's Polearm.name: Manifest Runelord's Polearm
Manifest Runelord's Polearm.description:
Requirements The risen runelord isn't holding a runelord's polearm

Effect The risen runelord causes their runelord's polearm to appear in one of their hands. The exact appearance of the polearm depends on the type wielded by the runelord in life, but these weapons are purely spiritual constructs that inflict mental damage on a Strike and vanish as soon as the risen runelord releases the weapon or dies.

Mythic Power.name: 神话之力 Mythic Power
Mythic Power.description: 该生物拥有 3 点神话点，并可以将这些神话点用于以下任何动作。

Remove a Condition.name: 移除状态 Remove a Condition
Remove a Condition.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The risen runelord ends one condition affecting them.

Beyond Life.name: Beyond Life
Beyond Life.description: A risen runelord may drink or eat for pleasure or entertainment, but they need not do so for nourishment and never suffer the effects of thirst or starvation.

Mythic Resilience (Will).name: Mythic Resilience (Will)
Mythic Resilience (Will).description: 该怪物将与其相关的豁免成功率比骰掷结果的成功度高一个等级。这不会与其他改变成功度的效果叠加，例如失能特征（自然1或20时除外）。怪物每次获得神话韧性时，可选择一项豁免。该能力应首先应用于该怪物的最高豁免。

Vanishing Death.name: Vanishing Death
Vanishing Death.description: When a risen runelord is slain, their body and (if manifested) polearm vanishes as the trapped legacy that was drawn upon to create them is set free, exploding outward in a riot of swirling color. This release of arcane energy hammers the minds of nearby creatures. All creatures adjacent to a risen runelord during their vanishing death must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 24 hours (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) as fragments of their own memories are temporarily scrambled or hidden. Other objects carried by the risen runelord fall to the ground.

Quickened Casting.name: Quickened Casting
Quickened Casting.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect If the risen runelord's next action is to cast a cantrip or spell that's 4th-rank or lower, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

Recharge.name: Recharge
Recharge.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The risen runelord regains an expended spell slot or can use Quickened Casting again.

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt the risen runelord's spellcasting action, the risen runelord attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

Risen Runelord (Gluttony).name: Risen Runelord (Gluttony)
Risen Runelord (Gluttony).publicNotes:
Risen runelords are created by a powerful ritual invented by Runelord Xanderghul—a ritual called raise runelord. All risen runelords are at least level 11 creatures. Once created, a risen runelord has no capacity to become more powerful, as they are manifestations of their legacy at a specific point in time (although given enough time and resources, a risen runelord could potentially find a way to overcome this limitation on self-improvement).

A risen runelord has a modicum of free will, but as long as the one who created them via raise runelord lives, they're bound to their creator's desires. A risen runelord ordered to undertake obviously self-destructive actions might, at the GM's discretion, resist the command and could potentially even break free of their creator's control.

Since raise runelord draws upon a runelord's legacy as it exists within the Dreamlands, no risen runelord can ever sleep or dream. Xanderghul can use a risen runelord in a special way: he can use any risen runelord (including ones he didn't create) as a spare body. If he's slain, his soul can instantly jump to the closest risen runelord to replace them and continue the fight, unless the PCs can disable this defense during the second adventure in Revenge of the Runelords. Regardless of level, all risen runelords are mythic creatures and are immune to sleep effects.

Lust and Pride

Of the seven sins, lust and pride are unique among the runelords for these sins were only ever represented by a single runelord—and both still live during the events of this Adventure Path. This may change once the events of Revenge of the Runelords come to a conclusion, in which case the sinful foci for lust and pride become potential options for risen runelords of Sorshen or Xanderghul, but during Revenge of the Runelords, no risen runelords of lust or pride can exist.

Risen Runelord Gear

A risen runelord's polearm is an extension of their being and cannot exist without them, vanishing upon their death. This doesn't prevent a risen runelord from claiming, carrying, or using other items, and most higher-level risen runelords keep real magic items that remain behind after their death.

Frightful Presence.name: 恐怖威压 Frightful Presence
Frightful Presence.description:
90尺 @Check[will|dc:30]

当有生物在对抗铁鹭的恐怖威压的豁免中得到大失败时，只要该生物保留惊惧状态，就会同时陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1} 。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]
