Mythic Power.name: 神话之力 Mythic Power
Mythic Power.description: 该生物拥有 3 点神话点，并可以将这些神话点用于以下任何动作。

Mythic Skill.name: 神话技能 Mythic Skill
Mythic Skill.description:
花费 1点神话点；

效果 赞德雷铁鹭尝试的下次特技或贼活技能检定具有+4点加值，并且该检定视同为具有神话熟练度.

Snatch Prize.description: 铁鹭尝试用鸟爪的尖端以惊人的敏捷性从1个生物身上[[/act steal]]1件物品。该物品必须为2负载或更轻。若带有目标物品的生物正处于战斗或警戒之中，铁鹭仍可以尝试偷窃该物品，但仅限于它以神话熟练度尝试其贼活检定的时候。
Snatch Prize.name: 强取奖品 Snatch Prize

Unbalancing Rip.name: 失衡撕扯 Unbalancing Rip
Unbalancing Rip.description:
需求 赞德雷铁鹭的上个动作是以爪子打击伤害了大型或更小的生物

效果 铁鹭撕扯需求生物的肉体。该生物承受 @Damage[1d8[persistent,bleed]] 点持续流血伤害，并且陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]，直至铁鹭的下个回合开始为止。

Remove a Condition.description:
花费 1点神话点

效果 赞德雷铁鹭结束1个正在影响它的状态。
Remove a Condition.name: 移除状态 Remove a Condition

Reactive Beak.name: 反应鸟喙 Reactive Beak
Reactive Beak.description: 赞德雷铁鹭每轮获得2个反应动作。每次触发时它仍旧只能使用1个反应动作

Eron of Jandelay.name: 赞德雷铁鹭 Eron of Jandelay
Eron of Jandelay.publicNotes:
罕有人见过的赞德雷铁鹭在其末日般的家园位面上承担着重要的作用。这些细长、似鸟的生物用七条瘦长的腿高高地耸立在大地之上，它们的身体覆盖着宛如铁一般的羽毛，只需轻轻扇动翅膀便可将其掷出。作为拾荒者与收集者，铁鹭会处理它们在赞德雷发现的侵入物，将其储存到自己的巢穴中以便日后分拣。此类碎屑通常由已死的冒险者及其装备构成；铁鹭会毫不犹豫地攻击活着的冒险者，毕竟对于不属于此地的“杂物”来说，是生是死并没有任何区别。

残骸猎人 Remnant Hunters

当赞德雷铁鹭出现在即将毁灭的世界时，通常会寻找一份包罗万象的清单，这包括遗物、残骸，甚至有时还包含该星球上的生物，仿佛要在这个世界彻底湮灭之前甄选心仪的碎片一般。对于造访这个星球的铁鹭来说，此地是否真的即将毁灭对它来说并没有任何区别。在这些永恒的观察者看来，世界终结的真正时点与它们的狩猎毫无干系。有时候，拾荒而来的珍贵宝物会出现在铁鹭用念动移物拖拽的大型物体或载具之中。

Killing Fugue.name: Killing Fugue
Killing Fugue.disable: @Check[diplomacy|dc:48] (master) to talk the affected individual out of the killing fugue, @Check[occultism|dc:45] (legendary) to recognize the spiritual attack taking place and help the victim to resist its effects; four successes are required to disable the nightmare
Killing Fugue.hazarddescription: A vision of a terrifying presence (the King in Yellow, the Crawling Chaos, or some other horror beyond imagining) overwhelms an unfortunate explorer, putting them into waking stupor that quickly turns into a homicidal fugue.
Killing Fugue.routine:
(3 actions; curse) The killing fugue attempts to force a creature under the stupefying effects of deathly vision into taking violent actions against their allies. The affected creature can still take its normal turn of actions on its own turn, but on the killing fugue's turn they perform actions as decided upon by the GM. The killing fugue then spends the appropriate amount of actions to perform those actions and activities. The affected creature can attempt a @Check[will|dc:40|traits:curse] save each time the killing fugue attempts to force them to take actions in this way with the following results.

Critical Success The character throws off the killing fugue's influence, ending the nightmare.

Success The character prevents the killing fugue from taking the attempted action or activity.

Failure The character is forced to take the action or activity chosen by the killing fugue.

Critical Failure As failure, but the character can no longer attempt Will saves to resist the killing fugue.
Killing Fugue.reset: As long as a creature remains under the effects of the nightmare, it cannot reset. Once a creature has either recovered from the effects or died, the nightmare resets in [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Deathly Vision.name: Deathly Vision
Deathly Vision.description:
Trigger A living creature approaches within 10 feet of a site associated with the terrifying presence (such as a cairn, an altar, a cave, a strange skeleton, a waterfall, a pit, a statue, etc.)

Effect The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:40] save, with the following effects. The hazard then rolls initiative.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} as long as the Killing Fugue remains active.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round and is stupefied 1 but is capable of whispering to anyone nearby that if anyone touches them, they will die.

Critical Failure As failure but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}.

Kandirvek.name: 坎迪尔维克 Kandirvek
Kandirvek.allSaves: 对抗异能时全豁免+2状态加值

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult.name: 对抗异能时全豁免+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

Challenge Fate.name: 挑战命运 Challenge Fate
Challenge Fate.description:
触发 龙被一次攻击指定为目标；

效果 骰子尚未落地，命运尚未确定。攻击者须对触发攻击掷骰两次，并采用较差的结果。

Untethered to Fate.name: 命运无拘 Untethered to Fate
Untethered to Fate.description: 龙可以让任何会影响它的幸运或厄运效果无效化；其他生物仍然正常受到影响。

Destiny Breath.name: 兆命龙息 Destiny Breath
Destiny Breath.description:
龙吐出一股半透明的可能性之雾，让所有可能的未来压垮生物的大脑。龙息在@Template[cone|distance:40]范围内造成@Damage[13d6[mental]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[will|dc:34|options:area-effect]豁免）。豁免失败的生物因未来的画面陷入挣扎，陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}，持续1轮（大失败时@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 2}）。

[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Destiny Breath]]{1d4轮}内龙无法再次使用兆命龙息。

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓和一次翼击打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 龙的打击重击时，恢复兆命龙息的使用次数。

Prophetic Wings.name: 预见之翼 Prophetic Wings
Prophetic Wings.description:
龙和它的任意盟友都能通过龙翼预见未来，这一过程需要集中注意力进行10分钟。龙翼施展6环级@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.41TZEjhO6D1nWw2X]，但龙翼能预见1个月内的未来，且兆命龙会说一些和预言结果有关的神秘词汇。

龙每小时能使用预见之翼一次，每个生物每周只能从龙翼中窥见一次未来。每日一次，兆命龙可以从翅膀中获得一个月后的未来预兆。

Walk the Timelines.name: 时间线穿行 Walk the Timelines
Walk the Timelines.description:
频率 每小时一次

效果 龙分裂成拥有不同命运的两个版本。两个分身分别从当前位置行走或飞行，然后使用一个动作。如果动作都是攻击，它们使用同样的多重攻击减值，但在计算龙的多重攻击减值时这两次攻击视为一次。

动作结束后，龙在两个分身所在位置中选择一个作为真正的未来，同时另一个版本的自己消失。

Kandirvek.publicNotes:
格拉利昂的大地上，命运变幻无常。哪怕世上所有预言已经失效，也有方法能预见近在眼前的未来，或者针对遥远未来的事件获得模糊预感。兆命龙生来便注定会随时看见未来——尽管它可能非常模糊。对未来的预见仿佛一首安静的曲子，在兆命龙的头脑中流淌不止。它们可以随时随地选择专注或忽略命运之音，但无法停止它。一眼望去，兆命龙的外形与其他异能龙相近，但它们的翅膀内膜仿佛镜面，描绘着未来。这些画面模糊不清，但大体准确——理论上。一种天然的冲动促使兆命龙去分享它们所见的未来。龙不会为预见到的景象分辨对错，也不会因此感到愧疚，它们会将未来平等地分享给各方人士，不管那是无辜的村民还是邪恶的暴君。

各式各样的龙中不少都具有魔法能力，或是与魔法有所联系。相比之下，一部分龙从魔法中获得的力量更强，因此它们能通过长时间浸淫魔法来施展能力或改变身体性状。随着年龄增长，这些龙变得更加强大，与魔法起源的联系也更为紧密。学者为如何对龙进行分类争论不休，一些人喜欢魔法龙的分类，另一些则根据龙与特定魔法根源的联系而用根源分类龙。不论如何分类，龙都有一些共通的特征：它们能够利用魔力，它们的力量和狡猾会随着年龄增长而成长，以及它们都有囤积大量财宝的习性。

Goldgorger.name: Goldgorger
Goldgorger.publicNotes: Oregorgers are hulking, four-limbed brutes with bodies of raw primal metals accreted in layers. Driven entirely by an insatiable drive to consume metal, an oregorger stops at nothing to greedily devour as much metal as it can and expel it as caustic rust.

Rust Vision.name: Rust Vision
Rust Vision.description: The goldgorger ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from rust clouds.

Caustic Slivers.name: Caustic Slivers
Caustic Slivers.description: 5 feet. The goldgorger continually leaks tiny fragments of partially digested gold into the air around it. Any creature that ends its turn in the aura takes @Damage[8d6[acid]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:37|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:sickened] save. A creature that critically fails is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Devour Metal.name: Devour Metal
Devour Metal.description: Any time the goldgorger scores a critical hit with an adamantine bite attack, it deals the same amount of damage to any metal armor worn by the target, automatically bypassing any Hardness lower than 20. If a creature uses the Shield Block reaction with a metal shield against a goldgorger's adamantine bite, the shield is automatically broken, but no other item takes damage from that attack. Unattended metal items automatically take full damage from a goldgorger's adamantine bite, ignoring their Hardness if it's lower than 20.

Searing Spew.name: Searing Spew
Searing Spew.description: The goldgorger belches forth a cloud of caustic debris from its maw, filling a cube adjacent to it that's 10 feet on each side. Any creature in this area takes @Damage[6d10[acid],6d10[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic|options:area-effect] save). The ground under the cloud is difficult terrain for 1 hour, after which the shrapnel crumbles to dust. The goldgorger can't use Searing Spew again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Searing Spew]]{1d4 rounds}, but the ability recharges if the goldgorger damages an item with devour metal.

Jandelay Tolokand.name: Jandelay Tolokand
Jandelay Tolokand.publicNotes:
Streams run dry. The earth cracks. Green leaves brown and shatter. And the creature walks on.

The faceless, unknowable tolokands wander the land, bringing desolation with every footfall-belching poisonous smoke, blighting plant life, cracking the earth asunder, and even staining the ground with their foul blood. They turn habitable places into wastelands, which has earned tolokands the name "waste walkers."

These walking forces of destruction don't make their motives known. They remain unmoved by any pleas or threats levied at them, and they fight off attacks only so that they can return to their grim business. However, they have one consistent tendency: they travel to environments on the brink. A tolokand appears in a land wracked by famine or a natural disaster to give it the last push into oblivion.

Tolokands are mercifully few in number. Since they appear so rarely, it's unclear whether there are just a few individuals or several dozen. Clearly, more than one exists, though, because their patterned soles are as distinctive as fingerprints. Often, these smoking footprints are all that remain in a blighted land.
Jandelay Tolokand.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. primal magic

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair a tolokand's vision; it ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal Magic.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal Magic

Heartless Furnace.name: Heartless Furnace
Heartless Furnace.description:
50 feet. @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:37|basic] save).

The poisonous smoke that bellows from a tolokand makes all creatures inside it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the smoke are concealed to creatures within it.

Inexorable.name: Inexorable
Inexorable.description: The tolokand recovers from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} conditions at the end of its turn. It's also immune to penalties to its Speeds and ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain.

Toxic Blood.name: Toxic Blood
Toxic Blood.description: When a creature scores a critical hit against the tolokand with a piercing or slashing Strike, the tolokand's poisonous, oily blood sprays forth. Any creature within @Template[emanation|distance:5]{5 feet} of the tolokand takes @Damage[3d6[poison]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:38|basic|options:area-effect] save). Any non-creature plants the blood spills on die.

Blighted Footfalls.name: Blighted Footfalls
Blighted Footfalls.description: Whenever the tolokand ends a move action during which it moved 30 feet or farther, it automatically casts one of its innate spells as a free action.

Mythic Power.name: 神话之力 Mythic Power
Mythic Power.description: 该生物拥有 3 点神话点，并可以将这些神话点用于以下任何动作。

Recharge.name: Recharge
Recharge.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The Jandelay tolokand regains an expended spell.

Remove a Condition.name: 移除状态 Remove a Condition
Remove a Condition.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The Jandelay tolokand ends one condition affecting themself.

Sudden Destruction.name: Sudden Destruction
Sudden Destruction.description:
Requirements The tolokand hasn't cast any of its spontaneous spells this turn

Effect The tolokand casts one of its spontaneous spells, using up the spell slot normally. The tolokand can't cast any further spontaneous spells this turn and can't use this ability again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Sudden Destruction]]{1d4 rounds}.

Elemental Tsunami.name: Elemental Tsunami
Elemental Tsunami.publicNotes:
Elemental tsunamis are huge and destructive, having none of the caring or nurturing aspects of water.

Water elementals can be very destructive, but often not intentionally so; just as water can bring life to mortals in need, its waves can pound shores and rains can flood cities. Water elementals are similarly difficult to predict.

Waterbound.name: Waterbound
Waterbound.description: When not touching water, the elemental tsunami is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

Vortex.name: Vortex
Vortex.description:
50 feet.

Water in the area that is in the same body of water as the elemental tsunami is difficult terrain for Swimming creatures that don't have the water trait.

Drench.name: Drench
Drench.description:
The elemental puts out all fires in a @Template[emanation|distance:20].

It extinguishes all non-magical fires automatically and attempts to counteract magical fires ([[/r 1d20+20 #Drench]]{+20} counteract modifier).

Mindwarp Ink.name: Mindwarp Ink
Mindwarp Ink.description: A creature damaged by an elemental tsunami in area A6 must attempt a @Check[will|dc:31] save to resist being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure).

Surge.name: Surge
Surge.description:
The elemental tsunami momentarily expands to fill the area of its vortex. Creatures within the aura take @Damage[(5d12+6)[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[fortitude|dc:31|basic] save. A creature that fails this save is pushed 20 feet.

The elemental tsunami then shrinks to its normal space and can't Surge again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Surge]]{1d4 rounds}.

Push or Pull 10 feet.name: Push or Pull 10 feet
Push or Pull 10 feet.description:
The elemental tsunami can choose whether to push or pull the creature on a succesful hit.

Push 1

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Push]

Pull 1

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Pull]

Bittersweet Mask.name: Bittersweet Mask
Bittersweet Mask.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:45] (expert) twice to find the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} latches, @Check[athletics|dc:48] (master) to wrench the mask open quickly enough to prevent it from triggering before it's destroyed, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th-rank; counteract DC 35), or automatic with Spleen's key
Bittersweet Mask.hazarddescription: The many iron bars of this iron mask fits tightly around Javownir's head and snout, looking almost as if it was built in place to conform specifically to the shape of his skull with no apparent latch or hinge for it to be removed.
Bittersweet Mask.reset: The mask resets automatically at the start of the round after it is triggered.

Linked to Javownir.name: Linked to Javownir
Linked to Javownir.description: Whenever the mask takes damage, Javownir takes the same damage (@Check[reflex|dc:44|basic] save)

Toxic Off-gassing.name: Toxic Off-gassing
Toxic Off-gassing.description:
Trigger The mask takes damage, or an Athletics check to wrench it free fails or critically fails

Effect The mask creates a cloud of poison gas in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] around Javownir. Creatures in the area take @Damage[(6d12+41)[poison]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:44|basic] save; Javownir treats the result of this save as one degree of success worse than the rolled result).

Risen Runelord (Pride).name: Risen Runelord (Pride)
Risen Runelord (Pride).publicNotes:
Risen runelords are created by a powerful ritual invented by Runelord Xanderghul—a ritual called raise runelord. All risen runelords are at least level 11 creatures. Once created, a risen runelord has no capacity to become more powerful, as they are manifestations of their legacy at a specific point in time (although given enough time and resources, a risen runelord could potentially find a way to overcome this limitation on self-improvement).

A risen runelord has a modicum of free will, but as long as the one who created them via raise runelord lives, they're bound to their creator's desires. A risen runelord ordered to undertake obviously self-destructive actions might, at the GM's discretion, resist the command and could potentially even break free of their creator's control.

Since raise runelord draws upon a runelord's legacy as it exists within the Dreamlands, no risen runelord can ever sleep or dream. Xanderghul can use a risen runelord in a special way: he can use any risen runelord (including ones he didn't create) as a spare body. If he's slain, his soul can instantly jump to the closest risen runelord to replace them and continue the fight, unless the PCs can disable this defense during the second adventure in Revenge of the Runelords. Regardless of level, all risen runelords are mythic creatures and are immune to sleep effects.

Lust and Pride

Of the seven sins, lust and pride are unique among the runelords for these sins were only ever represented by a single runelord—and both still live during the events of this Adventure Path. This may change once the events of Revenge of the Runelords come to a conclusion, in which case the sinful foci for lust and pride become potential options for risen runelords of Sorshen or Xanderghul, but during Revenge of the Runelords, no risen runelords of lust or pride can exist.

Risen Runelord Gear

A risen runelord's polearm is an extension of their being and cannot exist without them, vanishing upon their death. This doesn't prevent a risen runelord from claiming, carrying, or using other items, and most higher-level risen runelords keep real magic items that remain behind after their death.

Remove a Condition.name: 移除状态 Remove a Condition
Remove a Condition.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The risen runelord ends one condition affecting them.

Beyond Life.name: Beyond Life
Beyond Life.description: A risen runelord may drink or eat for pleasure or entertainment, but they need not do so for nourishment and never suffer the effects of thirst or starvation.

Mythic Resilience (Will).name: Mythic Resilience (Will)
Mythic Resilience (Will).description: 该怪物将与其相关的豁免成功率比骰掷结果的成功度高一个等级。这不会与其他改变成功度的效果叠加，例如失能特征（自然1或20时除外）。怪物每次获得神话韧性时，可选择一项豁免。该能力应首先应用于该怪物的最高豁免。

Vanishing Death.name: Vanishing Death
Vanishing Death.description: When a risen runelord is slain, their body and (if manifested) polearm vanishes as the trapped legacy that was drawn upon to create them is set free, exploding outward in a riot of swirling color. This release of arcane energy hammers the minds of nearby creatures. All creatures adjacent to a risen runelord during their vanishing death must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 24 hours (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) as fragments of their own memories are temporarily scrambled or hidden. Other objects carried by the risen runelord fall to the ground.

Manifest Runelord's Polearm.name: Manifest Runelord's Polearm
Manifest Runelord's Polearm.description:
Requirements The risen runelord isn't holding a runelord's polearm

Effect The risen runelord causes their runelord's polearm to appear in one of their hands. The exact appearance of the polearm depends on the type wielded by the runelord in life, but these weapons are purely spiritual constructs that inflict mental damage on a Strike and vanish as soon as the risen runelord releases the weapon or dies.

Mythic Power.name: 神话之力 Mythic Power
Mythic Power.description: 该生物拥有 3 点神话点，并可以将这些神话点用于以下任何动作。

Quickened Casting.name: Quickened Casting
Quickened Casting.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect If the risen runelord's next action is to cast a cantrip or spell that's 4th-rank or lower, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

Recharge.name: Recharge
Recharge.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The risen runelord regains an expended spell slot or can use Quickened Casting again.

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt the risen runelord's spellcasting action, the risen runelord attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

Kraken Caller.name: 海怪呼唤者 Kraken Caller
Kraken Caller.publicNotes:
斥候通常由年轻的沙达鱼人来担任，他们会定期在海中寻找动物仆从或者上岸狩猎。在地表狩猎的斥候会驱使鳄鱼和蛇，而在水中的斥候则更喜欢使役电鳗和海马。

沙达鱼人是形似鱼类的两栖类人生物，他们潜伏在格拉利昂的海洋中，以带领着手下的动物仆从上岸吞没那些呼吸空气的生物的行为而闻名。当有渔村在一夜之间突然消失时，沙达鱼人会是首要嫌疑犯。沙达鱼人自负为天生的领导者，他们的野心只会受到自身必须严格遵守的等级制度的限制。沙达鱼人的地位取决于自身能使役的动物仆从的力量、与在狩猎期间以及在对抗外人的战斗中所表现出的奋斗精神。

Sea Speech.name: 海语者 Sea Speech
Sea Speech.description: 任何具有游泳速度或者两栖或水栖特征的动物都能够理解沙达鱼人说出的水元素语。通过花费1星期时间有规律地和一只此类动物交互，沙达鱼人能够让它变得永远乐于帮助。

Shared Feast.name: 分享盛宴 Shared Feast
Shared Feast.description: 沙达鱼人进行一次啃咬打击。若命中，他选择的一名盟友能够花费反应动作作出1次啃咬打击对抗相同目标。具有喙啄或类似攻击的盟友也能够使用该攻击替代啃咬。

Malfunctioning Perfumery (Freestanding).name: Malfunctioning Perfumery (Freestanding)
Malfunctioning Perfumery (Freestanding).disable: @Check[crafting|dc:52] (legendary) to quickly introduce neutralizing agents into the alchemical machinery, @Check[thievery|dc:55] (master) to disable the mechanized portions of the devices, or @Check[arcana|dc:55] (master) to counteract magical elements; four total successes are required to disable the hazard (destroying one of the four workbenches counts as one success)
Malfunctioning Perfumery (Freestanding).hazarddescription: The magically and mechanically automated tools Sorshen used to aid in the crafting of perfume on the long, eastern workbench have interacted in unexpected ways, transforming the workshop into a dangerous peril.
Malfunctioning Perfumery (Freestanding).routine:
(5 actions) On its initiative, the malfunctioning perfumery takes the following five actions, in order. For each success at disabling it, the hazard loses one action. The targets for actions 2–5 are randomly chosen from creatures in the room, with no one creature being targeted more than once before all other creatures in the room have been targeted. For example, a party of 4 PCs will each be targeted by one of these actions. If just a single PC is in the room, they will be targeted by all four.

  • 1: Crushing Notes 1 (olfactory, poison) The malfunctioning machinery exudes a blast of concentrated and overwhelming perfume notes into area B11. Creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:15|traits:olfactory,poison] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} on a critical failure).
  • 2: Nozzle Spray 1 (poison) Nozzles built into the machinery extend out to spray toxic, overwhelmingly cloying perfume in multiple directions. One randomly determined target in area B11 takes @Damage[14d6[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:45|basic|traits:poison] save).
  • 3: Sillage 1 (emotion, mental) A larger, more intimidating nozzle than the one utilized in the previous action extends forward and violently sprays a staggering array of different scents at a random target in the room. The overwhelming mixture of lingering scent (the perfume's sillage) causes the creature to take @Damage[10d6[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:45|basic|traits:emotion,mental] save); on a failed save, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round by the overwhelming scents.
  • 4: Oil Spill 1 (fire) Sparks from grinding machinery ignite a patch of spilled oil somewhere in the room—a random creature in area B11 takes @Damage[10d6[fire],4d6[persistent,fire]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:45|basic|traits:fire] save).
  • 5: Boiling Beaker 1 (emotion, mental) A pressurized beaker containing boiling fluids springs a leak, and a dislodged tube sprays disorienting, psychotropic fumes at a random creature in the room, who must then succeed at a @Check[will|dc:44|traits:emotion,mental] save to avoid becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round (1 minute on a critical failure).

Pungent Cloud.name: Pungent Cloud
Pungent Cloud.description:
Trigger The door to area B11 is opened or a creature enters the area, or any open flame is brought into area B11

Effect The musky fog filling the perfume laboratory billows out into the hall, spreading 5 feet from the doorway and expanding by another 5 feet each round the door remains open. All creatures within the fog become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the fog become concealed to creatures within it. Creatures in the fog must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:45|traits:poison|options:area-effect,inflicts:sickened] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure); this is a poison effect. If the pungent cloud was triggered by open flame, chemicals in the air ignite into a flash of fire, dealing @Damage[6d6[fire],6d6[poison]|options:area-damage] damage to all creatures in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:45|basic|options:area-effect] save), after which the pungent cloud disperses. The hazard then rolls initiative.

Cataclysmic Planar Rift (Escalation).name: Cataclysmic Planar Rift (Escalation)
Cataclysmic Planar Rift (Escalation).disable: DC 45 Lore (expert) with the plane's Lore skill, @Check[arcana|dc:48] (master), @Check[nature|dc:48] (master), @Check[occultism|dc:48] (master), @Check[religion|dc:48] (master) or @Check[performance|dc:51] (legendary) to perform a planar stabilization rite to minimize the damage
Cataclysmic Planar Rift (Escalation).hazarddescription: This apocalypse represents the effects of numerous planar rifts forming and exploding in a region, with the risk of the planar fabric being compromised enough to tear a city-sized (if not larger) hole in reality. These rifts are likely to eject inhabitants of the other plane into the Universe, as well as serve as gateways for furious defenders to pour through to punish anyone they think might be responsible for the problem. Any additional encounters that result from these incursions should award XP as normal for encounters of their difficulty. While the rifts are likely to all lead to the same plane, particularly far-reaching disruptions might create gateways to multiple planes at once, with each rift spewing forth its own defenders. These groups would each have their own aims and agendas, clashing, collaborating, or causing chaos wherever they go.
Cataclysmic Planar Rift (Escalation).routine:
(1+ hours, @Check[flat|dc:18]) Rifts detonate with raw planar essence. As the hazard progresses, the ruptures grow more frequent until they merge together into a gaping portal (this final stage might be prevented with good fortune or successful efforts to Prepare). Ruptures occur once per 10 minutes for the first hour and once per minute for the second hour. The frequency with which each unprepared creature in the area is hit by a rupture depends upon their proximity to the hazard's epicenter. If the hazard proceeds into a third hour, all creatures and objects in the area take the hazard's damage one final time before being swallowed up by the burgeoning portal and deposited on the other plane.

The planar explosions deal 3d12+18 damage, with a DC 45 basic saving throw, and inflict a condition on a failed saving throw. The damage type, saving throw type, condition, and condition duration depend upon the exploding plane, as detailed in the table below.

d20PlaneDamage and SaveCondition
1AbaddonFortitude vs. poison damagefrightened 2 (1 hour, The condition's value can't be reduced by the typical means for 1 hour)
2Astral or Ethereal PlaneEach time a new rift appears, roll again on this table, using the listed effects.Each time a new rift appears, roll again on this table, using the listed effects.
3AxisFortitude vs. force damageclumsy 2 (1 hour)
4BoneyardWill vs. spirit damagedrained 2 (1 hour)
5Creation's ForgeWill vs. vitality damagedazzled (1 hour)
6ElysiumFortitude vs. sonic damagedeafened (24 hours)
7First WorldWill vs. mental damageconfused (1 minute)
8HeavenReflex vs. fire damagefascinated by the rift (10 minutes)
9HellReflex vs. fire damagedoomed 1 (1 hour)
10Maelstromvaries 2varies 2
11NirvanaFortitude vs. bludgeoning damagestupefied 2 (1 hour)
12The NetherworldFortitude vs. cold damageblinded (10 minutes)
13Outer RiftsReflex vs. acid damagesickened 1 (1 hour) 1
14Plane of AirReflex vs. electricity damagestunned 1 (1 minute)
15Plane of EarthFortitude vs. bludgeoning damagefatigued
16Plane of FireReflex vs. fire damage4d6 persistent fire damage
17Plane of MetalReflex vs. slashing damage4d6 persistent bleed damage
18Plane of WaterReflex vs. bludgeoning damageoff-guard (10 minutes)
19Plane of WoodReflex vs. piercing damage–15-foot circumstance penalty to Speeds (10 minutes)
20The VoidWill vs. void damageenfeebled 2 (1 hour)
Cataclysmic Planar Rift (Escalation).stealthdetails: DC 43 Lore (expert) for the plane's Lore skill to notice pinpoint incursions from the other plane or @Check[arcana|dc:48] (master), @Check[nature|dc:48] (master), @Check[occultism|dc:48] (master), or @Check[religion|dc:48] (master) to detect subtle instabilities in the fabric of the Universe

Supervolcanic Eruption.name: Supervolcanic Eruption
Supervolcanic Eruption.disable: @Check[Mountain Lore|dc:42] (master), @Check[survival|dc:45] (master), or @Check[nature|dc:48] (legendary) to determine evacuation paths, @Check[medicine|dc:45] (master) to safely treat and relocate people poisoned by toxic gases in the preceding days, @Check[athletics|dc:48] (master) to relocate people and essential supplies, or @Check[crafting|dc:48] (legendary) to create filtration systems and barricades capable of withstanding a pyroclastic flow
Supervolcanic Eruption.hazarddescription:
Volcanic eruptions are dramatic events in which magma erupts from a planet's mantle onto its surface. They're often preceded by earthquakes and the opening of fissures in the ground that vent toxic gases. These initial signs can occur months or even years in advance, making it difficult to predict the eruption's timing. While the intensity, features, and progression of eruptions vary, this hazard represents the most dangerous variety of eruption, one that can swiftly overtake cities with rapid tides of superheated gas and rock and spew out enough ash to affect the climate for years. When these sorts of eruptions are also supervolcanos, eruptions with the highest degree of explosive force, they cause unparalleled transformation to the landscape and alter climate on a planetary scale.

If you're looking for something more supernatural, it's a relatively simple change to adjust the energy damage caused by a supervolcano's pyroclastic flow to something else—for example, a cloud of ghosts erupting from a long-lost city might inflict mental, spirit, or void damage instead of the fire or electricity damage a normal pyroclastic flow brings. Just be sure to give the new event a suitable description that matches the new type of damage!
Supervolcanic Eruption.routine:
(24 hours) When the hazard begins, toxic gas vents open throughout the affected region, followed by clouds of ash. As the eruption column collapses, material rushes forth from the volcano in a pyroclastic flow, which is followed by a dense ash cloud that persists for several minutes. Ash and toxic gas persist for up to 24 hours.

Ash limits visibility like a thick fog, deals @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage per minute, and creates difficult terrain as it collects on the ground. The ash also generates bolts of ash lightning. Once per minute, one unprepared PC takes @Damage[3d12[electricity]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:46|basic] save). Pockets of dense ash are particularly dangerous. Unprepared creatures in areas of dense ash must hold their breath or begin to suffocate.

When the pyroclastic flow first hits a region, creatures in its path must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:43] save with the following results (prepared creatures increase their roll by one degree of success).

Critical Success The creature avoids most of the pyroclastic flow, but still takes @Damage[3d6[fire]] damage and treats all movement in the area as greater difficult terrain for the next 10 minutes.

Success The creature takes @Damage[3d6[bludgeoning]] damage and @Damage[3d6[fire]] damage, and is buried in ash and debris. While buried, they can't breathe and take @Damage[4d6[fire]] damage each round at the start of their turn until they succeed at a DC 40 check to Escape, in addition to the normal @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage each minute for being buried.

Failure As success, but @Damage[6d6[bludgeoning]] damage and @Damage[6d6[fire]] damage, and [[/act escape dc=42]].

Critical Failure As success, but @Damage[12d6[bludgeoning]] damage and @Damage[12d6[fire]] damage, and [[/act escape dc=46]].
Supervolcanic Eruption.stealthdetails: @Check[Mountain Lore|dc:40] (master), @Check[survival|dc:42] (master), or @Check[nature|dc:45] (legendary) to predict the eruption's arrival

Animus of Longing.name: Animus of Longing
Animus of Longing.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:50] (legendary) or @Check[society|dc:50] (legendary) to decipher the symbols and runes scribed across on the runewell and pinpoint which runes can be used to deactivate it, @Check[thievery|dc:53] (legendary) to temporarily disrupt the anima focus's connection to the Eye of Desire or to destroy a phantom of desire; three total successes are required to disable the hazard (destroying a phantom of desire counts as a single success)
Animus of Longing.hazarddescription: Three pitchers pour water in an endless cascade, each decorated with a symbol of fertility, fecundity, and desire. The pitchers never empty, and the fountain below never overflows; the entire thing flickers with eerie red energy.
Animus of Longing.routine: (1 action) On its turn, the animus of longing sustains the three phantoms of desire. The three creatures each take their turn.
Animus of Longing.reset: The animus of longing deactivates as soon as no foes remain in the atrium, then immediately resets.
Animus of Longing.stealthdetails: (legendary) to detect the dangerous and sealed entrance to the Eye of Desire; noticing the anima focus itself has a DC of 0

Shroud of Passion's Might.name: Shroud of Passion's Might
Shroud of Passion's Might.description:
Trigger A creature attempts to use the anima focus to open the way into the Eye of Desire

Effect The Runewell of Lust's magic reaches out of the Eye of Desire and into the minds of all nearby creatures, creating vivid, dreamlike hallucinations fulfilling their greatest desires. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:44] save with the following effects. The hazard then manifests three phantoms of desire—incarnations of Runelord Sorshen empowered by certain beliefs that she hasn't actually turned over a proverbial new leaf and is playing a long-con game to take over the world. The phantoms and the hazard then roll initiative.

Critical Success The creature understands the false nature of the hallucination but gleans useful insights from what they see, gaining a +2 status bonus to one Perception check, saving throw, or skill check made before the end of their next turn.

Success The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round, then recognizes the hallucination for what it is and blocks it from their mind.

Failure The creature becomes lost in the hallucination, struggling to tell it apart from reality. The creature becomes dazzled and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as they remain in Sorshen's atrium. At the end of each of the creature's turns, it may attempt a new @Check[will|dc:44] save to end this effect.

Critical Failure As failure, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2}, and the Will save to end the effect is DC 48.

Echoes of the End.name: Echoes of the End
Echoes of the End.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:50] (master), @Check[occultism|dc:50] (legendary), or @Check[religion|dc:50] (legendary) to recognize and shore up the area against the localized planar instability causing a connection between the apocalypse seed and Jandelay, or @Check[athletics|dc:53] (legendary) to grasp the apocalypse seed and muffle its vibrations with your embrace. Four successes are needed to muffle the aura enough against the planar instability and end the hazard.
Echoes of the End.hazarddescription: An overwhelming trumpeting fills the area as the apocalypse seed vibrates and shakes off the encrusted bone that's accreted around it to reveal a large tooth fragment from some immense monster.
Echoes of the End.routine:
(1 action) Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:44] save. A creature with the slowed condition from this hazard takes a –2 penalty to this save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[(2d10+10)[sonic]] damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[(4d10+20)[sonic]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the start of the hazard's next turn.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[(8d10+40)[sonic]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} for 1 round.
Echoes of the End.reset: The apocalypse seed creates another area of instability after 24 hours.
Echoes of the End.stealthdetails: (legendary) to notice the low vibration forming in the area surrounding the apocalypse seed; noticing the apocalypse seed itself has a DC of 0

Oliphaunt's Echo.name: Oliphaunt's Echo
Oliphaunt's Echo.description:
Trigger A living creature enters area C6

Effect Pent-up magical energy from another world begins to release in waves of overwhelming sound. The hazard rolls initiative.

equipment-Naginata.name: Naginata
equipment-Naginata.description: This 6-foot staff has a 2-foot-long, slightly curved, swordlike blade attached at one end. The long pole helps keep the wielder out of reach of swords and shorter weapons.

Glimpse Uncertain Future.name: Glimpse Uncertain Future
Glimpse Uncertain Future.description:
Requirements Liralarue isn't stupefied

Trigger Liralarue fails a saving throw or attack roll

Effect Liralarue rerolls the saving throw or attack roll that triggered this reaction. She then experiences confusing visions of multiple futures all at once and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} until the end of her next turn.

Living Dream.name: Living Dream
Living Dream.description: Liralarue is made from solid dream-stuff. She no longer needs to sleep, breathe, eat, or drink. In return, she can't further develop her powers or exist outside the Dimension of Dreams—if she's forced out of the Dreamlands, she vanishes, then reappears 1 year later in the Dreamlands. She can be killed normally, but barring such an event, she could live forever as she no longer ages.

Beyond Dreams.name: Beyond Dreams
Beyond Dreams.description: When Liralarue casts the following spells on a PC or an item they carry while they're visiting her in dream, the lasting effects and results of that spell persist into the waking world: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.C2w3YfBKjIRS07DP]{Hidden Mind}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dMKP4fkWx8V2cqAy]{Remake}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rsZ5c0AUyywe5yoK]{Retrocognition}.

Trinity Star.name: Trinity Star
Trinity Star.description: When Dream Aethusa dies, a field of iridescent energy envelops her lifeless body (and her gear) for 10 minutes. During this time, any creature that touches Dream Aethusa's body takes @Damage[9d6[force]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:37|basic] save). After 10 minutes have passed, Aethusa's body rises into the air and is consumed by mythic energy, transforming into the Trinity Star hazard.

Mythic Resilience (Will).name: Mythic Resilience (Will)
Mythic Resilience (Will).description: 该怪物将与其相关的豁免成功率比骰掷结果的成功度高一个等级。这不会与其他改变成功度的效果叠加，例如失能特征（自然1或20时除外）。怪物每次获得神话韧性时，可选择一项豁免。该能力应首先应用于该怪物的最高豁免。

Recharge.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Dream Aethusa regains an expended spell.
Recharge.name: Recharge

Remove a Condition.name: 移除状态 Remove a Condition
Remove a Condition.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Dream Aethusa ends one condition affecting her.

Mythic Power.name: 神话之力 Mythic Power
Mythic Power.description: 该生物拥有 3 点神话点，并可以将这些神话点用于以下任何动作。

Quickened Casting.name: Quickened Casting
Quickened Casting.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect If Dream Aethusa's next action is to cast a cantrip or a spell that is 6th-rank or lower, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt Dream Aethusa's spellcasting action, she attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.
